loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilian is 48 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Lilian has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines. Lilian requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Lilian has been in this business for one year. In the future, Lilian would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family. Mary Grace is married and has a business direct selling personal and Avon products in the Philippines.

Mary Grace requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to her customers. Mary Grace has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell in her general store, like biscuits, candies, noodles, canned goods, sugar, and cooking oil.

Imelda has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store, like biscuits, candies, noodles, canned goods, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Rahayu group is receiving their new loan. The group had expected to increase the amount of their loan, but after an evaluation from MUK’s staff, the group is receiving the same loan amount.

Ni Luh is the head of the group. She already has 3 sows and she is using her portion of the loans to purchase feed only. The sows will birth new piglets soon. Ni Luh sells piglets in her village. One sow can birth 8 – 12 piglets. 

She hopes the sows can give birth safely and the piglets can grow healthy. She sell the piglets for fattening or pig rolls. She has a plan to save all the profit and use it for business capital later.

At the meeting, 2 of the members couldn't attend because they had a religious ceremony at the Temple.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 17 Mai 2007, et vient d’entamer son douzième cycle. Malgré les difficultés de la zone à maintenir une activité génératrice de revenues, ces membres sont d’une détermination assez solide et très courageux. Les membres sont solidaires entre eux et vivent dans le même village. L’activité principale est le petit commerce, accompagné de la culture sous pluie.

 Madame Mariama (assise à  droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans, est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont une fille et 02 garçons. Son activité s’inscrit dans la transformation de graines d’arachide en patte qu’elle revente au marché hebdomadaire international de la sous région. Pour ce faire elle achète la graine d’arachide par sac ou par bassine selon l’offre du marché pour ensuite faire le tri, la cuisson et finalement la transformation à la machine pour obtenir la patte d’arachide revendu par seau de 15 ou 20 litres.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 03 sacs d’arachide de 50 kilos à 12 500 F CFA pour la transformation et la vente.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’aider son mari dans la gestion quotidienne de la famille d’une part et d’autre part de conforter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 17, 2007 and has just started its 12th loan cycle. Despite the difficulties in the area of maintaining revenue-generating businesses, these members are very courageous and fairly robust in their determination. The members are in solidarity with one another and live in the same village. The main work is small-scale commerce, along with farming during the rainy season. 

Ms. Mariama (seated at the right with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of three children (a girl and two boys). Her business involves processing peanuts into peanut butter, which she resells at the weekly international market in the sub-region. To do so, she purchases peanuts by the sack or basin, according to what is available on the market. She sorts them and cooks them, and then finally processes them by machine to obtain peanut butter for sale by 15- or 20-liter pails.

With this loan, she intends to purchase three 50-kg sacks of peanuts at 12,500 francs CFA to process and resell. 

The profits will be used to help her husband to manage the family day to day, and some of it will go into her savings account.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts to process and resell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 56 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Remedios has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Remedios aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Freddy Giovanny

texts.es:
El señor Freddy Giovanny vive en la cuidad de Managua, trabaja en una universidad de Managua.

Freddy es un estudiante  universitario y con mucho esfuerzo se prepara para  tener un mejor nivel de vida y es por eso que esta  solicitando un crédito a kiva   a través de ceprodel  para  hacerle el cambio de techo a su vivienda ya que está en mal estado. 
 Necesita hacer  pago de universidad ya que está  cursando su último año  en la carrera.
texts.en:
Señor Freddy Giovanny lives in Managua. He works at the University of Managua.

Freddy is a student at the university.  He is working hard to prepare himself to have a better quality of life.  And that is why he is requesting a Kiva loan through Ceprodel.  He needs to replace his house's roof, which is in disrepair.  
Freddy also needs to pay the university, as he is in the last year of his degree.

loans.use: to purchase zinc.

loans.name: Marvin Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Marvin Adolfo vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como conductor en una empresa del estado.
Se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable en su trabajo y en las obligaciones familiares es por esta razón que se ve en la necesidad de solicitarle un crédito a ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción  como zinc ,y perlines ya que esta es la única manera de hacerle mejoras a su vivienda por que el techo de su vivienda esta en mal estado y con  el invierno se le pasa el agua  y esta situación se le hace incómoda para su pequeño niño.
 a la vez  agradece a kiva por ese apoyo que le puedan brindar para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia
texts.en:
Marvin Adolfo lives in the city of Managua and works as a driver at a state enterprise.  He is known as a person who is responsible in his work and in his family obligations.  

It is for this reason that he sees the need to apply to CEPRODEL for a loan to buy construction materials such as metal roofing and purlins, since this is the only way to make improvements to his housing.  The roof of his house is in bad shape and in the winter, water leaks through.  This is an uncomfortable situation for his young son.

He is grateful to Kiva for the support that they can provide him to be able to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, who is 39 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Richard, a electrician, and they have two children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Josephine operates a shop offering auto electrical services. Her husband is the main electrician. They offer battery charging and repairs of alternators,  starters, and power windows. Her shop is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are businesses in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the money to buy spare parts, supplies, and materials needed in her repair shop.

Josephine hopes that her business will continue to improve, and she dreams of giving her children a good quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, supplies, and materials needed in her repair shop.

loans.name: Carole Cristina

texts.en:
This is Carole Cristina, 42, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Samuel, a pastor, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carole Cristina operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy different products from wholesalers then sell them to customers for a profit. Her products are cabinets, soaps, processed foods, and other products. She also sells used-but-quality clothes. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales daily.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of supplies and products like cabinets, soaps, processed foods, and other products needed in her business.

Carole Cristina hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is a merchant from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has three children. Silvestra runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her area. This is the source of her income. 

Silvestra is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soda, soap and toiletries, plus biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

In the future, Silvestra dreams of expanding her store so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soda, soap, and toiletries, and biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Antonio vive en  la cuidad de Managua trabaja en el centro de compra más grande de Managua como higienista desde hace 20años.
Edgar solicita un crédito a kiva para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacerle el repello a las paredes de su vivienda ya que con estos tiempos de lluvia las paredes se le humedecen y esto leestá causando problema de salud a sus pequeños hijos.
A la vez nos manifiesta que se siente muy agradecido y bendecidos por la oportunidad que ceprodel  le ha dado ya que con mucho esfuerzo en su trabajo  él ha podido pagar los crédito a kiva y ceprodel  .
Porque  gracias a esos financiamientos ha construido su casa  para  darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edgar Antonio lives in the city of Managua and has worked in Managua's largest shopping center as a hygienist for the past 20 years.

Edgar is applying for a Kiva loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials to plaster the walls of his house.  In the rainy season, the walls get damp, and this is causing health problems for his young children.

At the same time, he says that he feels very grateful and blessed for the opportunity that CEPRODEL has given him, since with great effort at work, he has been able to repay his loans to Kiva and CEPRODEL.  Thanks to these loans, he has built a house in order to offer his children greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Hilario De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Hilario de Jesús es originario de la comarca Santa Ana jurisdicción del la ciudad de Pueblo nuevo a unos 52 km al noroeste de la cabecera departamental de Estelí. Este señor esta felizmente casado y tiene  dos hijos varones un que esta en edad escolar y el otro que esta tierno.
El se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias tales como la crianza y venta de ganado bovino de engorde y la producción de hortalizas como es el tomate y la chiltoma, desde hace aproximadamente unos 30 años de manera continua y lo que ha sido su principal soporte familiar y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar como el cuido de sus hijos.
Este señor ha trabajado con los financiamientos de Ceprodel en 11 ciclos creciditos lo que le ha beneficiado positivamente en el desarrollo de su hato ganadero y la producción de sus cultivos asi como en el mejoramiento de su forma de via. el se presenta nuevamente a la ofcinas de ceprode para solicita un nuevo financiamiento para poder comprar dos ternero para desarrollo, ya que de esta manera es que el ido aumentado su hato ganadero ya que sus ingresos no son fijos y no cuenta con el efectivo en el monto y comprar dicho ganado, el se ha mostrado agradecido con los creditos que le a brindado ceprodel y espero este otro le sea aprobado.
texts.en:
Hilario de Jesus is from the Santa Ana division, jurisdiction of the city of Pueblo Nuevo, about 52 KM Northeast of the department of Esteli.  He is happily married and has two sons, one is a student and the other one is little.  He works in farming activities such as raising and selling cattle and the production of vegetables such as tomatoes and peppers, he has done this for approximately 30 years and it has been the main family support, his wife works as a homemaker and takes care of their children.
He has worked with financing from Ceprodel with 11 credit cycles, which has had positive benefits in the development of his cattle herd and the production of his crops as well as the improvement of his lifestyle.  He is again at the offices of Ceprodel to request new financing to buy two calves to raise, this is how he has built his cattle herd, as his income is not fixed and he doesn't have the cash to buy the calves, he is grateful for the credits provided by Ceprodel and hopes the new one will be approved.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Vivian has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from vegetable vending.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 54 years old. With her loan, she is improving the condition of her store and increasing the selection of products that she sells from the little store that she runs from her home. She plans to tear down a wall and install a counter to better showcase some of her products like potatoes, vegetables, gum, candies, chips, and school supplies.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and remodel her store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 52, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Erlinda operates a hardware store. She sells cleaning products, electrical supplies, houseware, tools and other supplies. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy cleaning products, electrical supplies, houseware, tools, utensils and other supplies. 

Erlinda hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cleaning products, electrical supplies, houseware, tools, utensils and other supplies for her hardware store.

loans.name: Oude's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 12 septembre 2013, est composé de  femmes qui ont eu à mener des activités génératrice de revenus avant d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois dans l’objectif d’accroître leur capacité de financement. Elles vivent toutes dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Oudé (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles et un garçon. C’est une qui a une longue expérience de la vente de tissus et articles vestimentaires. Elle achète ses produits dans les pays frontaliers pour la revente à crédit par placement remboursable en deux tranches égales.

Elle compte s’appuyer sur ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce par l’achat en quantité de « kartoum » tenue légère pour la vente par pièce de 06 yards.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de venir en appui à son mari dans les dépenses liées aux charges
texts.en:
This new 'banc villageois' was inaugurated on September 12, 2013. It is composed of women who had to run revenue-generating businesses before joining the 'banc villageois' program with the goal of increasing their financial capacity. The women have all been living in the same district for several years and maintain ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Oudé (standing at the far right with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three children (two girls, and a boy). Ms. Oudé has much experience selling fabrics and clothing. She purchases her products from bordering countries and resells them on credit, payable in two equal installments.

She intends to rely on this loan to expand her business by purchasing large quantities of light-weight 'kartoum' fabric to resell by the 06-yard lengths. 

The profits from her business will enable her to help out her husband in covering [family-related] expenses.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of 'kartoum' fabric to be sold

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is an older member of BRAC Pakistan, who is taking her third loan. She has been improving her living standards with the help of the previous loans. 

Two years ago, Musarat took a loan and purchased an auto-rickshaw for her husband, with the contribution of her savings. The current condition of the auto-rickshaw is not good because its engine is creating problems and not picking up fuel. Her husband's daily income is spent on household expenses and he does not have savings to fix the problem.

After completion of her previous loan, Musarat, again, contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and described her financial problem. With the help of a loan, her husband will fix the engine on the auto-rickshaw and he will be able to derive a reasonable income.  

Musarat seems very happy after taking this loan and she says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of her husband's auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es:
Rolando Antonio  vive  en  la cuidad de trabaja como higienista  en un centro de compra de la capital casado con tres pequeño hijos.
Rolando esta solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en el pago de  estudio de sus hijos y en la reparación del techo de su vivienda ya que esta en  mal estado y con el invierno se le esta deteriorando y se le pasa el agua   ya que esto les causa incomodidad a sus pequeños hijos  es por esta razón que le pido a los inversionista este financiamiento  y  me siento muy agradecida por que con los crédito que me han otorgado he mejorado las condiciones de vida a mi familias
texts.en:
Rolando Antonio lives in the city and works as a hygienist at a shopping center in the capital.  He is married with three small children.

Rolando is applying for a loan to invest in paying for his children's studies and for repairing the roof of his house.  The roof is in bad shape and with the winter, it is deteriorating.  Water leaks through it, and this is causing discomfort to his small children.  

"This is why I am requesting this loan from the investors.  I feel very grateful because with the loan that they have given me, I have improved living conditions for my family."

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Joyitas De Villa Adela Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JOYITAS DE VILLA ADELA”  iniciará el vigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de refrescos, chicharronería, venta de coca, venta de ropa de bebe, punto VIVA, atención de internet, brostería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de deportivos; este negocio lo aprendió de su padres, ya que apoyaba en el negocio familiar desde niña, posterior a su matrimonio decide establecer su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal group "Joyitas de Villa Adela" [Little Jewels of Adela Village] will begin their twenty-sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Adela Village Center.  The group is made up of nine members, and they are overseen by a board of directors.  Julia is the president.  Members are involved in different types of businesses, including: selling beverages, cooking and selling pork cracklings, selling soda, selling children's clothing, providing telephone and call services, offering internet maintenance, and running a small restaurant.

The loan that the group takes out will benefit all of these small businesses.  Julia is one member that will benefit.  She says hat she has been a member of the institution for seven years.  Presently, she has a sewing business, and she also sells tennis shoes.  She learned this business from her parents; she has supported this family business since she was a young girl.  After she got married, she decided to set up her own shop.

The loan she well receive is to grow her working capital by purchasing fabric.  She will buy the fabric at wholesale stores in the city of El Alto.  She will then make and sell the items that her customers request.  This form of work allows her to generate resources so that she can maintain her home.  She is married and has three children.
 
When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, Julia responds that she likes the health and credit training sessions.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Ramón Arístides

texts.es:
El señor ramón Arístides  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una universidad de Managua.
Don ramón está solicitando un financiamiento para  comprar zinc y cambiarle el techo a su humilde casita ya que  el que tiene se le pasa el agua cuando llueve.
 Y va  a realizarse un chequeo médico  es por esta razón  que hago dicho préstamo y agradezco a  kiva y ceprodel
texts.en:
Ramón Arístides lives in the city of Managua and works as a security guard at a university in Managua.  

Ramón is applying for a loan to buy metal roofing and change the roof of his humble abode, since the one he has leaks water when it rains.  He is also going to get a medical check-up.  

"This is why I am applying for this loan, and I am grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL."

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses and to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Heydi Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Heydi de 26 años de edad vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la elaboración de adornos como ser picheles, jarrones, floreros, mariquitas, etc.
Doña Heydi se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años y sus clientes son amigos y personas que transitan por su negocio.
Doña Heydi está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mas material como arcilla y pintura,  para poder elaborar sus artesanías, también tiene sus clientes que le encargan su producto y solo se los envía.
Doña Heydi su sueño ampliar mas su negocio y está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Heydi is 26 years old and lives with her husband in her house located in a small town in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She makes a living by making ornaments like pitchers, urns, flower vases, ladybirds etc.

Heydi has done this job for a few years and her customers are friends and people who pass by her business. 

Heydi is applying for a loan to buy more materials such as clay and paints,so she can make her handicrafts. She also has customers who order products from her and she delivers them.

Heydi's dream is to expand her business and she is very happy to be working with Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013.

loans.use: to buy clay and paint for her business.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is 47 years old and married. She supports a family of three. Benter has a blacksmith business in Kericho town, served by the KADET Ltd Kericho office. 

This has been her income-generating business for the last five years; she gets an average monthly income of KES 50,000. She has borrowed a second loan with Kadet Ltd of KES 60,000. 

She plans to use this loan of KES 60,000 to purchase metal rods and metal sheets to make several items, e.g. watering cans and boxes among others, to boost her business. Her dream is to expand her business as well as educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase metal

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
A self-taught high school graduate, Vanessa began a career in cosmetology in 1992 working at a popular department store. Eventually however, her career path led her to work as a bank teller.

With 19 years of experience in the banking industry, Vanessa is now the assistant vice president and branch sales manager of a major national bank. She is also an ambitious entrepreneur and the owner of a real estate consulting business. 

Vanessa established her business in 2006 buying and selling real estate as well as managing properties and helping people buy homes. Her clients range from first time homebuyers to small business owners. At one point, she was providing business advice under the business name “The 411” because her expertise spanned so many areas.

It is that expertise and experience, paired with creativity, that sets Vanessa’s business apart. Vanessa’s goal is to be able to manage her business full-time and move toward 100% self-employment. She would like to purchase commercial buildings in order to produce rental income and expand on her consulting services. 

The money from this loan will go towards purchasing office equipment, including a computer and scanner, to build on Vanessa’s ambitions. Eventually, she hopes to create more jobs through her business to help develop the local economy.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and scanner for her real estate consulting company

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 12 septembre 2013, est composé de  femmes qui ont eu à mener des activités génératrice de revenus avant d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois dans l’objectif d’accroître leur capacité de financement. Elles vivent toutes dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Aissatou (debout à droite en tunique vert avec la main gauche  levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, est mariée et mère de trois de filles de 02 à 08 ans. Son activité s’articule dans la vente de produits de cosmétiques et divers articles de beauté qu’elle achète soit dans la sous région et à la capitale pour revente dans sa localité à crédit ou au comptant selon sa relation avec la cliente. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte renforcer sa capacité de financement en achetant 02 douzaines de lait de corps, une de champoing et parfum par envoi.

 Les bénéfices obtenus lui permettront de participer d’avantage dans la gestion quotidienne des charges de la famille.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' was newly inaugurated on September 12, 2013. It is composed of women who had to run revenue-generating businesses before joining the 'banc villageois' program with the goal of increasing their financial capacity. The women have all been living in the same district for several years and maintain ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Aissatou (standing at the right with her left hand raised and wearing a green tunic) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three girls, from 2 to 8 years old. Her business involves selling cosmetic products and a variety of beauty supplies, which she purchases either in the sub-region or in the capital in order to resell them in her town. She accepts cash or credit, depending on her relationship with the customer.

With this new loan, she intends to bolster her financial capacity by purchasing 2 dozen of body lotion, one of shampoo, and perfume.

The profits earned will enable her to do more in managing the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion, shampoo, and perfume to resell

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Being the oldest of seven children, Louise is no stranger to helping raise children of all ages. As a child development major at San Diego State University, she was an integral component in the development of a “kindergarten readiness curriculum” that was subsequently implemented in Head Start programs around the country.  “Childcare is my passion, I love getting down and playing with the kids and doing activities. It’s satisfying to watch them learn new things,” she shared.

After her son Henry (pictured) was born, Louise sought a way to continue her passion of working with children while remaining a stay at home mom. It seemed only natural to start Green Beans and Little Sprouts, a healthy living preschool with an emphasis on hands-on education. Green Beans and Little Sprouts emphasizes the “Reggio Amelia” method of teaching, entailing that students have some control over the direction of their learning in a supportive and enriching environment.  Louise plans to employ three teachers, dividing her space into an “infant room”, “toddler room” and “preschool room”. 
 
Children enrolled are taught the importance of a healthy diet and eat exclusively organic food arriving regularly from local farms. She shared, “Healthy food is very important to us; our kids will often request milk or water as opposed to sodas when out of the classroom. That makes me feel great.” Music and language are also an important component of the curriculum that Louise has created. Students are engaged in Spanish songs weekly as the importance of being bilingual from an early age is highlighted.

Kiva is an ideal financing solution for Louise as traditional loans were not an option for her. She shared, “Banks were telling me that I needed to have been in business for two years before being considered for a loan, how was I supposed to do that?” After securing rent payments for the first two months as well as an initial deposit from family members, Louise looked to the community for help. 

Louise will use her $10,000 Kiva loan to furnish her preschool, purchase necessary educational equipment and cover initial payroll for each of the instructors. In addition, these funds will ensure that only the highest quality organic local foods are provided for her students.

She hopes that her business will continue to take root and that her work will create a positive impact in the lives of her students. Although Louise currently has a license for six students, she will be moving in October to a new location that will accommodate over twenty. When asked about her future dreams, she joked, “Maybe I have to start an elementary school next!”

loans.use: to furnish her preschool, purchase necessary educational equipment and cover initial payroll for each of the instructors

loans.name: Firdous' Group

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Firdous. She is married, with five children, and she lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

For a few years now, her husband has conducted a business of selling clothes in a nearby town, in which he sells both ladies' and gents' clothes. His customers now demand embroidery dresses also, so he has decided that he should offer embroidery dresses too. 

Now their children are growing older, and their needs are growing as well. With the rapid increase in the family's necessities, her husband wants to grow his business. He does not have any other source of income to fulfill the needs of his family.  He wants to grow his current business but he does not have sufficient money.

So Firdous has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy a variety of embroidery dresses for ladies to sell.

Firdous hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her husband's enterprise and in her family as well.

Firdous is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery dresses for resale.

loans.name: Tening's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé  le 02 Décembre 2002  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de   femmes très attachées au culte du travail, elles jouissent d’une très bonne expérience dans le système des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même Village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Tening (assise à droite avec une main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37ans et mère de 2 filles. Elle pratique le petit commerce, vendeuse de cigarette, du riz et de l’huile depuis deux années.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’avoir deux bidons d’huile 18500 FCFA L’un, 5 sacs de riz à 14000 FCFA l’unité et trois grosses de cigarettes 10500 l’un renouvelable.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’augmenter son épargne et d’améliorer sa condition de vie
texts.en:
The group has been created on December 2, 2002, the day the banc villageois  has been launched. It is composed of women very dedicated to their work. They have a lot of experience with the banc villageois system. They are all from the same village. Their main activity is retail.
Mrs. Tening (seated on the right with a raised right hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is 37 years old and has two daughters. She has been retailing cigarettes, rice and oil for two years.

Her new loan will allow her to buy two jugs of vegetable oil at 18,500 West African francs each, five bags of rice at 14,000 West African francs each and three cases of cigarettes, 10,5000 per refillable  case. Her revenues will allow her to grow her savings and improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil, rice and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Salvador Marvin

texts.es:
El señor salvador Marvin vive en la cuidad de Managua  trabaja en un institución del estado de profesión mecánico industrial 
Marvin está solicitando un financiamiento a kiva  para aportar en gastos médico y la compra de medicamento de un familiar que  en este momento está pasando una situación difícil de salud.
texts.en:
Salvador Marvin lives in the city of Managua and works in an institution as a professional industrial mechanic.

Marvin is applying to Kiva for a loan to contribute to medical costs and buying medicine for a family member who is currently going through a difficult situation as regards their health.

loans.use: pay for medical costs.

loans.name: Maria Rita

texts.en: Maria Rita is married with five children. She resides in the village of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him in their farm by planting vegetable and corn to make a living. She borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy seedlings and fertilizer such as manure. She always finds ways to make money in order to earn for the family. In the future, she wants to see her children having a better living situation with their own families.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 24 years old from Nakuru; his spouse is a housewife and he has three children who are 5 years old, 3 years old, and the last born is 3 months old.

He is in the business of selling fast food, especially chips. He has been in this business for the last three years, and to enable him to buy more stocks of potatoes, cooking fat, and tomato sauce, which are necessary for his business, he has applied for his first loan of KES 20,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is KES 10,000 and he plans to use the anticipated profit from his expanded business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to open a prestigious hotel and to have a very happy family.

loans.use: To buy stocks of potatoes, cooking fat, and tomato sauce for use at his chips kiosk

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 58 years old and married to Veronica. They are blessed with four children aged between 28 and 13 years. 

Francis is a livestock trader in Kaboen, in the outskirts of Kapsabet. He is served by the Kadet Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the last fifteen years, and makes a monthly income of KES 60,000. He has requested a loan of KES 100,000 which he will use to buy livestock for resale at a profit. With the anticipated profits he will pay for his children's college fees, repay the loan and save the remaining for future needs.

Francis's dream is to be financially stable, give the best education to his children and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 27 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged five and two years old.

He is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has operated for 10 years, and has applied for fourth loan from Kadet Ltd after paying his previous loans on time to enable him buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor. With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy a plot of land.

He hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet ltd to boost his business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 12 septembre 2013 est composé de  femmes ayant un vœu ardent d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois. Elles vivent toutes dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture de l’arachide pendant l’hivernage.

Madame Maïmouna (debout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, est mariée et mère de sept enfants dont quatre garçons et trois filles. Son activité s’articule dans la vente de légumes frais en effet, elle tient une table dans son quartier où elle vente par tas des légumes frais qu’elle obtient via des femmes productrices de villages non loin de la commune. De plus elle vend aussi du thé et du sucre par sachet de 100 et 200 F CFA.
   
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte en plus des légumes qu’elle achète chaque matin, avoir un sac de sucre de 50 kilos et un carton de thé vert pour la revente au détail.

 Les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer sa contribution dans la gestion les charges quotidiennes liées surtout à l’alimentation.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' was newly inaugurated on September 12, 2013. It is composed of women who ardently wish to join the 'banc villageois' program. The women have all been living in the same district for several years and maintain ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and peanut farming during the rainy season.

Ms. Maïmouna (standing second from the left with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of seven children (four boys and three girls). Her business basically involves selling fresh vegetables. She has a table in her district where she sells piles of fresh vegetables she obtains from women producers from villages near the commune. In addition, she sells tea and sugar by the 100-franc and 200-franc sachet.

With this new loan, she intends to bolster her coverage of day-to-day expenses related in particular to food.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables, sugar, and tea to resell

loans.name: Lideres De Villa Group

texts.es:
PAOLA IVETTE, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera. Ella forma parte del grupo "Lideres de Villa", formado por seis socios, los cuales se han reunido recientemente para formar su grupo e iniciar de manera conjunta el trabajo para conseguir hacer crecer sus negocios a base del préstamo recibido.
Paola Ivette, desde hace aproximadamente un año, se dedica a la administración y atención de su bodega, aun es pequeña, ofrece solo cosas básicas, espera que con el préstamo recibido el cual le permitirá invertir en la compra de bebidas de diferentes marcas y tamaños; pueda ir aumentando su clientela, aumentar su stock, y poder satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes, que en la mayoría son vecinos de la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Paola Ivette is 18-years old. She is single and a member of the communal bank "Lideres de Villa" (Town Leaders).  The communal bank is made up of six members who recently got together to start their bank and work jointly, with their loan, toward making their businesses grow. 
For approximately one year, Paola Ivette  has made her living managing and working in a small grocery.  Although it is still small and she only offers basic items for sale, she hopes that with the loan she has received, she will be able to keep increasing her customer base and her stock and to satisfy her customers' requests.  The loan will allow her to invest in the purchase of various sizes and brands of beverages.  The majority of Paola Ivette's customers are neighbors from the zone where she lives.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of beverages to stock up her small grocery.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Litein area of Kenya, a very fertile area for agriculture production. He has six children and he has been doing farming for ten years. His primary income sources are milk, crops, and a job salary.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Growing crops and rearing livestock." His biggest challenge is: "Lack of enough funds." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: 'Seroi.'

Paul was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Because they give a grace period." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "That it uplifts the living standards of the low-income earners."

Paul's highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked: "How will this loan benefit his family?," Paul replied: "In paying school fees for my children."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Paul owns the following: 'cow and poultry,' but he does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile.' 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net,' but does not have: 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.'

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 44 years old and married to Rachael, who is a farmer. They have four children who are in school.

He is in a quarry business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has operated for 20 years, and has applied for his fifth loan from Kadet Ltd after paying his previous loan on time to enable him buy building stones to sell. He plans to meet his family's needs with the anticipated profits.

He hopes to improve his family's living standards in the near future.

loans.use: To buy building stones.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a very hard-working lady from Olkalou. She is 46 years old and married to John, who is a businessman.  They have four children, ages 24, 18, 13 and 7 years.

She is a farmer, an occupation that she has been into for the past 13 years.  To increase and diversify her farm produce, she has applied for her fourth loan of KES 65,000 from Kadet Ltd.  It is to be used in buying a dairy cow, which will produce milk for sale.

Her monthly income right now is KES 12,000, and she plans to use profits from her expanded business to  repay her loan. 

In the future, Susan hopes to be the most successful dairy farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 44 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. She has a money transfer business in Naivasha, which she has operated for one year. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. She will use the loan as float for her M-Pesa money transfer business. With the anticipated profits, she plans to open another M-Pesa shop. In the near future, she hopes to see her business grow and her children well educated.

loans.use: To increase her float for her money transfer business

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 48 years old and married with one child.

Clarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, chips, milk, eggs, etc.

Clarita has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from selling pre-paid mobile phone credits.

Clarita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, chips, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Elizabete's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 11 septembre 2013 est composé de  femmes ayant un vœu ardent d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel et vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Elizabéte, âgée de 46 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants dont quatre garçons et trois filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de denrées de première nécessité qu’elle achète au marché de la commune en gros et demi gros pour la revente au détail dans son village.   

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte renforcer son stock de marchandise par l’achat d’un carton de patte alimentaire et autre divers produits alimentaires.

 Les bénéfices me permettent de renforcer son épargner pour obtenir durant les prochains cycles de prêts plus importants.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' was newly inaugurated on September 11, 2013. It is composed of women who ardently wish to join the 'banc villageois' program. The women maintain ties of solidarity and mutual assistance, and they have all been living in the same district for several years. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and farming during the rainy season.

Ms. Elizabéte, aged 46 (standing at the far right with her left hand raised),  is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of seven children (four boys and three girls). She is active in selling basic necessities which she purchases at the commune market wholesale and demi-wholesale to sell retail in her village.

With this new loan, she intends to bolster her stock of merchandise by purchasing a box of pasta and various other products. 

The profits enable her to bolster her savings, so as to obtain bigger loans over the coming loan cycles.

loans.use: to purchase sundry supplies and other grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro, de 52 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Mauro consiste en brindar servicio como mecánico, tiene un taller de reparación de motos y de mototaxis en donde brinda solución a diversas fallas técnicas, el taller esta instalado en su casa y ocasionalmente trabaja a lado de un asistente. Lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 30 años y está contento de hacer algo que le gusta y de  generar ingresos económicos para su familia y la educación de sus 03 hijas. Al principio tenia muchos problemas pues no se acostumbraba a trabajar entre fierros y grasas, pero con el tiempo se fue acostumbrando a su labor y en todos estos años ha ganado mucha experiencia, por el momento lo que mas quiere es seguir trabajando con mejores resultados y para ello necesita renovar algunas herramientas que usa de manera cotidiana.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado comprará de desarmadores, llaves y otras herramientas para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
Mauro, who is 52-years old, is married and has three daughters.  They all live together in their own home.  Mauro's job is working as a mechanic.  He has a workshop where he repairs motorcycles and moto-taxis.  He offers solutions to a variety of technical problems.  The workshop is located in his home.  Occasionally, an assistant works alongside him.  Mauro has been doing this work for 30 years, and he is happy that he is doing something he likes to generate an income for his family and his three daughters' educations.  At first, it was problematic for Mauro; he wasn't used to working with metal and grease.  But with time, he got used to his work, and in his many years, he has gained a lot of experience.  For now, what Mauro most wants to is to keep working with better results, and for that he needs to replace some of the tools he uses on a daily basis. 
At this time, Mauro is requesting S/. 1000 (USD $375).  He is grateful to all the people who are offering him this loan so that he can meet his goals.  With the requested sum, Mauro will purchase screwdrivers, keys and other tools to add to his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase tools such as screwdrivers, keys and other items.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 11 septembre 2013 est composé de  femmes ayant un vœu ardent d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel et vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Khady (debout à l’extrême droite en tunique rouge et noire), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 filles et 02 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de sucre, de l’huile, du savon et divers friandises, qu’elle se procure en demi gros ou par paquet pour la revente en détail au village et dans les marchés hebdomadaire. 
  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle s’approvisionner en huile, ognon et divers condiments pour la revente durant les fêtes.

Les bénéfices me permettent de renforcer son épargner pour obtenir durant les prochains cycles de prêts plus importants.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' was newly inaugurated on September 11, 2013. It is composed of women who ardently wish to join the 'banc villageois' program. The women maintain ties of solidarity and mutual assistance, and they have all been living in the same district for several years. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and farming during the rainy season.

Ms. Khady (standing at the far right and wearing a red and black tunic) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of five children (three girls and two boy). She is active in selling sugar, oil, soap, and a variety of snacks, which she procures demi-wholesale or by the packet to be sold retail in the village and at weekly markets.

With this new loan, she intends to stock up on oil, onions, and various condiments to resell during the holidays. 

The profits enable her to bolster her savings, so as to obtain bigger loans over the coming loan cycles.

loans.use: to stock up on oil, onions, and various condiments to resell during the holidays.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, de 53 años, es casada y vive junto a su esposo, su hijo y su pequeña nieta en su casa propia. Elsa se dedica a la venta de jugos y diversos desayunos, ha instalado su negocio en un área de su casa que se encuentra en la esquina de una avenida muy concurrida, trabaja todos los días con ayuda de su hijo, tiene una licuadora en donde elabora variados jugos de frutas como papaya, piña, naranja, quinua, manzana y diversas hamburguesas ya sea con queso, mantequilla, huevos o palta. Trabaja en este oficio más de 02 años y por fortuna le va muy bien. Eventualmente ayuda a su esposo a vender repuestos vehiculares en su taller de mecánica. Se siente muy a gusto desarrollando su trabajo ya que su esfuerzo es retribuido con los buenos ingresos económicos que obtiene a diario, pero necesita de alguna ayuda económica adicional ya que quiere renovar los utensilios que usa en su trabajo e incrementar los alimentos que ofrece. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto solicitado comprará una batidora eléctrica y todos los ingredientes que usa para elaborar desayunos como panes, huevos, palta, quesos, frutas, azúcar y otros.
texts.en:
Elsa is 53 years old and married. She lives with her husband, son and granddaughter within their own home. Elsa makes a living selling juices and a variety of breakfasts. She has set up business at her home at the corner of a very busy avenue, working every day with her son's help. She has a blender from which she makes a variety of juices including papaya, pineapple, orange, quinoa and apple juice, and several types of hamburgers with cheese, cream, eggs, or avocado. 

Elsa has been working in this business for more than two years and is fortunate that it is going well for her. She then helps her husband sells spare vehicle parts in his car shop. She feels very satisfied carrying out her work because her efforts have paid off with a good daily income. However, she needs some additional economic support because she wants to replace the tools that she uses at work and offer more food. She is now requesting 1000 nuevo soles and is very excited to know that there are people who can provide her with an economic support in order to continue her business. She also commits to being a punctual and responsible partner. WIth the amount requested, she will purchase an electric mixer and the ingredients needed to prepare breakfast foods including bread, eggs, avocado, cheese, fruits and sugar.

loans.use: to buy an electric mixer and ingredients including breads, eggs, avocado, cheese, fruits, and sugar.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which is a very fertile area for agriculture. He has three children and has been doing this work for six years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "growing crops and rearing livestock." His biggest challenge is "insufficient funds." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Lelkina."

Hillary was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Because they finance assets." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "That they give loans to those in groups."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Hillary replied "in paying school fees for his children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Hillary owns the following: "cow, poultry" but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: "mosquito net" but does not have: "electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

loans.use: To expand his dairy farm.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 34 years old, a car dealer, a charcoal seller, and divorced. He is a father to one child. James has been running his car-dealing business for the past eight years, selling charcoal to supplement his income with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to carter for his own needs and those of his child. 

James is applying for his second loan term with KADET. He will use the loan to buy more vehicle spare parts for resale and other repairing tools and also to expand his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a piece of land and build commercial homes. 

James hopes and dreams that he will in the future be recognized internationally.

loans.use: To buy more vehicle spare parts for resale and other repairing tools and also to expand his business.

loans.name: Máxima Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Máxima del Carmen,  es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, atiende a diario su negocio  que es la venta de ropa nueva. Distribuye su mercadería en los departamentos y en su casa de habitación.
 
Solicita un  préstamo a cerpodel para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra ropa nueva. Esto con el propósito de incrementar su negocio y  ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. y captar más compradores. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en su negocio.

Agradece  a  ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, esto le ha permitido incrementar su negocio y le permitirá llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Máxima del Carmen is a hardworking and enterprising woman who tends to her business daily. She works selling new clothing, which she distributes door-to-door and from her home. 

She is asking for a loan from CEPRODEL in order to invest more capital in buying new clothing. With this loan, she intends to increase her business, offer variety to her clients, and gain more customers. She has invested a previous loan in her business.

She is thankful to CEPRODEL and Kiva for providing this opportunity and for putting their confidence in her. They have allowed her to grow her business, support her home, and improve her life.

loans.use: to buy jeans and t-shirts.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 30 years old and a shopkeeper. She is married to John, who provides additional income. Together they are blessed with three children. Catherine has been running her shop for the past 11 years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to provide daily bread for her family. She also sells clothes to supplement her income. 

Catherine will use the loan to buy more clothes for resale and add stock in her shop, such as flour, stationery, etc. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will repay her loan and expand her business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to give her children a quality education and a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale and add stock to her shop, such as flour, stationery, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 43 years old. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Nasreen's husband owns a scrap shop in which he sells damaged and useless scrap material such as plastic, iron goods and aluminum accessories. He purchases scrap from persons who live in the locality and sells it to recycling factories. He has been doing this same business for many years and earning a reasonable profit for his family. 

Due to a rapid increase in household expenses and in family needs, Nasreen's husband wants to increase his scrap purchases capacity. 
Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan so that her husband can buy more scrap goods and increase his income. Nasreen hopes that this loan will enhance her husband's purchasing capacity so that he can save more than he previously did. 
 
Nasreen seems very glad after taking this loan and says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 23 years old and the single mother of one child aged one year old.

She owns a cosmetics business in Naivasha, which she has been running for one year, and has applied for her first loan from Kadet ltd to enable her to purchase stock of products like braids, lotions, and perfumes, among others. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy more stock for her business.

She hopes to have a better living standard in the near future.

loans.use: To buy stock of braids, lotions, and perfumes, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to support and protect her coffee crop.

loans.name: Magally

texts.es:
Magally, de 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Magally se dedicaba a la venta de verduras, sin embargo actualmente solo se dedica al alquiler de mototaxi ya que hace tan solo unos días que dio a luz a un hermoso bebé, es por eso que brinda este servicio cómodamente desde su casa, para ello tiene un vehículo que ha comprado hace 3 años y que diariamente da en alquiler a cambio de un monto económico establecido que le entregan al culminar el día o la jornada de trabajo. Todo lo que realiza le gusta mucho y no duda en poner su mayor esfuerzo para trabajar cada día con mucho optimismo, su gran deseo ahora es comprar otro mototaxi alquilarlo y complementar así su labor mientras cuida de su pequeño hijo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3500, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio.
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y algunos repuestos para refaccionar su vehículo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Magally, age 38, is married and has four children with whom she lives in her own house.  Magally used to sell vegetables.  However, she currently only rents out her ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  This is because she gave birth to a beautiful baby only a few days ago.  That is why she provides this service comfortably from her house.  

In order to do so she has a vehicle that she bought three years ago.  She rents it out daily for an established sum of money that is given to her at the end of the day or the working shift.

She likes everything that she does very much.  She does not hesitate to put her best effort into her work every day with great optimism.  Her big wish now is to buy another mototaxi and to rent it out.  This way she will complement her work while she takes care of her little son.

She will now request 3,500 soles.  She is grateful and happy to know that she continues counting on the financial support she needs to advance with the progress of her business.  She will use the requested amount to buy tires and some replacement parts in order to repair her work vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires and some replacement parts for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Fatimata Houdou

texts.fr: Madame Fatimata est une femme très brave et active. Malgré son âge (53ans) elle continue toujours d'évoluer dans son activité de commerce de tissus qu'elle pratique depuis plus de 10ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, Fatimata aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Madame Fatimata a besoin de ce prêt d'un montant de 250.000F pour acheter de nouveaux tissus et renforcer son commerce. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle souhaite ouvrir d'autres magasin afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et terminer sa maison qui est actuellement en cours de construction. Elle a choisi cet activité par amour et pour surtout lutter contre la pauvreté
texts.en: Madame Fatimata is a courageous and active lady. Despite her age (53 years old), she continues to grow her fabric business, which she has run for over 10 years. She is married with children, and assists her husband with daily expenditures and her children's school fees. Madame Fatimata is seeking a loan of 250,000F in order to purchase new fabrics and boost her business. She begins her day at 8am and ends at 6pm. She wishes to open other stores in order to grow her revenues and finish building her house which is currently under construction. She chose this type of work out of love, and moreover in order to fight poverty.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for sale in the market

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 30 years old and married to Daniel, and they have three children who are in school.

She has been in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru for 10 years and has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy fertilizer and spraying chemicals and to pay for labor. With the anticipated profits, she plans to boost her farming business.

In the near future, she hopes to expand her farming business to uplift her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and spraying chemicals and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en:
Mutua is 36 years old and the father of 3 children, all of whom  are currently studying in school. For the last three years, Mutua has earned a living by selling timber in Malindi where he earns a monthly profit of 30,000 KES. 

Mutua was introduced to the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer.  He is applying for his third loan to purchase additional stock of timber needed for his business. Mutua will use the profit from his business to pay for school fees for his children, purchase food for his family and expand his current business. Mutua hopes to continue expanding his business to improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional timber for his business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor  julio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en un  centro de compra de la capital desde hace 6 años  como higienistas.
Julio  solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, perlin   para hacer el cambio de techo a su vivienda  que está un poco deteriorado  
Y  a la vez se siente muy agradecido porque gracias a los crédito otorgado por kiva y ceprodel ha venido contrayendo su casa para darles mayor seguridad a su familia
texts.en:
Julio lives in the city of Managua and has worked in a shopping centre in the capital for 6 years as a hygienist.

Julio is asking for a loan to buy building materials like zinc, perlin to change the roof of his house, which has deteriorated somewhat.

He is also grateful because thanks to the loans awarded to him by Kiva and Ceprodel he has been able to continue building his house to give greater security to his family.

loans.use: buying construction materials like bricks, sand and cement.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy, de 27 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, vive temporalmente en la casa de sus primos. Fredy se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público, esta labor lo realiza en su mototaxi. Lleva ejerciendo está actividad más de 5 años y realiza su trabajo con buenos resultados que le permiten ser muy solicitado entre las personas que lo conocen por su responsabilidad y la seguridad que brinda al conducir. Eventualmente se dedica a la crianza de aves. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede organizar su tiempo y horario de trabajo, genera sus propios ingresos económicos con el cual puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar, su meta principal es consolidar un taller mecánico en donde brinde servicio de refacción y reparación de mototaxis. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará los repuestos necesarios para renovar su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Fredy, 27, is single and has no children. He is living at his cousins’, but only temporarily. Fredy works in transportation; he has a mototaxi. He has been working with this activity for more than five years and has had good results, which is why his service is appreciated by clients who think he is responsible and feel safe travelling with him. Occasionally, he also raises poultry.

What Fredy likes the most about his job is that he can manage his own time and working schedule and he generates his own income to contribute to his family’s economy. His main goal is to open a repair shop where he will renovate and repair mototaxis.

This time, he is requesting 800 PEN. He wants to thank all those who are giving him the opportunity to have access to this loan in order to continue working. On the other hand, he promises to pay the installments on time. With this loan, he will buy different spare parts to renovate his mototaxi.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en: After successful pay off the previous loans, the group proceeds to the next period with a view to improving their businesses. Ni Ketut, head of the group, is coordinating members in the purchase of piglets so that all members get good piglets. With the loan, she purchases three local species of piglets for pork rolls that are sold every 2 months. As a result of this effort, she hopes she can make savings for her future needs. One member could not attend the meeting in the photo because of illness.

loans.use: to buy 3 local species of piglets.

loans.name: Yolith

texts.es: Yolith, de 42 años de edad, está casada y vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Yolith se dedica a la venta de periódicos. Diariamente se levanta muy temprano y se dirige a la imprenta en donde compra los periódicos que posteriormente pone a la venta de manera ambulatoria caminando por las calles de la ciudad. Tiene también clientes fijos a quienes hace entrega a domicilio. Lleva realizando este oficio desde hace 04 años y en todo este tiempo logró hacerse conocida. Por lo general trabaja sola pero ocasionalmente recibe el apoyo de su hijo. Le gusta su negocio pues con eso ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y mantenerlos a lo largo de su juventud, aprendió esta labor gracias a la motivación que le brindaba una vecina y viendo las ganancias económicos que obtenía por sus ventas decidió continuar realizando esta labor la misma que se ha convertido en su principal oficio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente la cantidad de periódicos al por mayor para seguir realizando su trabajo.
texts.en: Yolith is 42 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. Yolith works by selling newspapers. She gets up very early every day and goes to the press where she purchases the newspapers. Later, she sells these newspapers as she travels through the streets of the city. She also has fixed clients who she delivers to at home. She has been doing this for four years and she has been able to make a name for herself. In general, she works alone, but she occasionally has the help of her son. She likes her business because she has been able to give a better life to her children and to care for them during their youth. She learned her trade thanks to the inspiration she got from a neighbor and seeing all the economic advantages she earned. And so, Yolith decided to make this her primary income source. She would like to take the opportunity while applying for this loan to thank the lenders and to say how happy she is to know she will be able to continue in her work thanks to the help of the financing institute and to continue to grow her business. The loan will be used to progressively purchase higher quantities of newspapers and to continue with her work.

loans.use: purchase newspapers for resale.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé  le 02 Décembre 2002  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de   femmes très attachées au culte du travail, elles jouissent d’une très bonne expérience dans le système des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même Village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata  (assise à l’extrême droite en médaillons en bas), est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 69 ans, malgré son âge avancée c’est une femme très dynamique, elle est aussi la personne morale du banc villageois, mariée et mère de 08 enfants (05 garçons et 03 filles) elle prend aussi en charge 08 de ses neveux. Elle est vendeuse détaillante, actuellement elle est gérante d’une boutique au village ou elle vend du riz, lait en poudre, sucre et autres condiments. Cette activité elle l’a pratique depuis  plus de dix ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en riz pour trois sacs à 13 000 FCFA trois bidons de vingt litre d’huile de palm à 20 000 FCFA le bidon transport payé à la charge  en raison de 350 FCFA par sac. Cette activité est renouvelée au tant de fois possible durant le mois.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  en partie  et  de soutenir son mari  en âge très avancée dans la prise en charge de la famille dans son ensemble et envisage construire cette année.
texts.en:
This group was established on 2 December 2002 on the same day as the inauguration of the banc villageois. It is made up of women who are interested in working, and they have a lot of experience with the banc villageois system. They all come from the same village and engage in small-scale commerce. 

Fatoumata (seated on the far right) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 69 years old, but despite her age she is very dynamic. She is also the representative of the banc villageois. She is married and a mother of eight children (five boys and three girls). She also takes care of eight of her nephews.

Fatoumata is a retailer, managing a shop in the village, where she sells rice, powdered milk, sugar, and other condiments. She has been doing this for more than ten years. With this loan she plans to buy three sacs of rice at 13,000 francs CFA a piece and three 20-liter drums of palm oil at 20,000 francs CFA each, plus pay the costs for transport which are 350 francs CFA per sac. 

She will repeat this cycle as many times as possible during the month. Earnings from this business will allow her to save some and help her husband, who is very old, take care of the family as a whole. She also hopes to build [a house] this year.

loans.use: to pay for rice and palm oil and their transport

loans.name: Mame Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 21 Novembre 2009. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier et exercent le commerce comme activité. 
Mame, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main , est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 3 filles, la cadette est âgée de 7 ans.
Avec le prêt elle va faire du commerce de jus de fruits et de la glace. Elle compte acheter du bissap, du pain de singe, du sucre pour la préparation du jus, des sachets pour la glace.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer la dépense quotidienne et régler ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
This group of 22 women are members of the "banc villageois" which was formed November 21, 2009. It is made up of members who live in the same neighborhood and pursue similar businesses.
