Mame, pictured standing on the right hand side with her hand raised, is 50 years old. She is married and the mother of 7 children, 3 of whom are girls, and the youngest of whom is 7 years old. With this loan she will operate a business of fruit juice and ice cream. She plans to purchase hibiscus flowers, baobab fruits, sugar to prepare the juice, and bags for the ice cream. The proceeds will allow her to provide for her daily expenses and to take care of her personal needs.

loans.use: to purchase hibiscus flowers and baobab fruit

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 51 years old. She is widowed and has four children who are in school.

Charity has a pharmacy business in Naivasha that she has been running for three years. This is her first loan application to the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). She will use the loan funds to purchase additional medicines to sell in her pharmacy. With her anticipated profit, Charity plans to pay school fees and buy more stock for her business.

In the near future, Charity hopes to be financially stable and open a bigger clinic.

loans.use: to purchase additional medicines to sell in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Denise Esther

texts.es: Denise de 33 años de edad habita al sur accidente de la ciudad, con su cónyuge  y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 13 años; desde hace 8 años se dedica al comercio de artículos variados  como ropa femenina, masculina, electrodomésticos y productos para el hogar, porque ella decidió desde el año 2005 seguir su vocación de comerciante y por eso inició su negocio de manera muy pequeña, pero poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de trabajo, sus clientes, sus ventas y sus utilidades. Ella vende directamente al consumidor final de contado y a crédito diariamente, trabajando 6 horas diarias y comprando en un municipio fronterizo, donde encuentra proveedores que le venden más económico y ella con precios competitivos, puede satisfacer las posibilidades de su clientela. Su meta es fortalecer al máximo a sus compradores fijos e incrementar el ingreso y el nivel de vida.  Su mayor desafío es el aumento constante de su capital de trabajo, para fortalecer su negocio teniendo inventarios. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, cubrelechos, sabanas y productos para el hogar, con ello satisfará las necesidades de su clientela y poco a poco su nivel de ingresos y de vida.
texts.en:
Denise is 33 years old and lives in the south-west of the city, with her husband and their 2 children aged 12 and 13; for 8 years she has made a living by selling various articles such as women's and men's clothing, electrical appliances and products for the home. In 2005 she decided to follow her vocation as a businesswoman and this is why she began her business, in a very small way, but little by little her working capital, customers, sales and profit grew.

Denise sells directly to the end consumer in cash and credit daily, working for 6 hours a day and buying in a border municipality, where she finds suppliers who sell to her more cheaply. She can, with competitive prices, satisfy the wishes of her customers. Her goal is to strengthen her fixed base of buyers and increase income and standard of living.

Her main challenge is to constantly increase her working capital, to strengthen her business through having stock. She is currently applying for a Kiva creit, the first loan she makes through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use it to buy clothes, bedspreads, sheets and products for the home. This will meet the needs of her customers and will increase her income and standard of living little by little.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bedspreads, sheets and products for the home.

loans.name: Enilda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Enilda, quien con su credikiva compró mercancía variada, como calzado, ropa, perfumería e insumos como harinas, queso, bocadillo con los que preparó ricos productos alimenticios (postres, hayacas y deditos).
Su credikiva la benefició, porque aumentó su capital de trabajo y con ello su liquidez, sus ventas y sus utilidades. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva, que con el apoyo brindado la ayudaron a progresar, tanto en su negocio como en su vida familiar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, con el cual comprará artículos de fin de año, como ropa, calzado, detalles para toda ocasión e incrementará su negocio de pasabocas, comprando materias primas en mayor volumen y vendiendo en mayor cantidad, porque justamente estos productos son los que su clientela mas solicita en esta temporada de fiestas..
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Enilda, who thanks to her loan with Kiva, was able to purchase a variety of items such as shoes, clothing, perfume, supplies like flour, cheese, and snacks that she will use to make delicious foods like cakes, hayacas (like a tamale) and finger foods. 
Her Kiva loan helped her because she was able to increase her working capital and with it she was able to increase her sales, and settle her bills. She says to the lenders at Kiva that the help they have given her has helped her to advance, as much as in her professional as in her personal career. Currently, she is applying for a new loan that she will use to purchase end of the year items such as clothing, shoes, decorations and to increase her sales of finger foods by purchasing the ingredients in larger volume and then selling a higher quantity of product. These finger foods are what her customers ask for the most during holiday season.

loans.use: purchase clothing, shoes, decoration and more.

loans.name: Denia Maydeli

texts.es:
Denia es una mujer joven y luchadora, emprendedora con 27 años de edad en un estado civil de unión libre y madre de 1 hijo el cual está muy pequeño y no estudia ya que no está en edad escolar. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo y no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. En compañía de su pareja ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra aproximadamente hace 8 años ya que en la zona la actividad que genera dinero para el sustento de las diferentes familias es la caficultura. Las diferentes actividades en sus cultivos son elaboradas por ellos 2 y juntos son apoyo mutuo en la agricultura como unión familiar las cuales están ubicadas a 1 kilómetro de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en el mercado local en pequeña escala con los diferentes vendedores de la zona. 

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos que mejoraran sus cultivos de café ya que por medio de esto ella podrá asegurar sus cosechas y el producto para generar ingresos para su familia.
Sus planes y metas a futuro son de ampliar sus cultivos comprando más tierra en la que ella pueda trabajar y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus futuros hijos venideros. Su sueño es ver a su hijo realizado y estudiado a nivel universitario ya que de esa forma ella podrá prepararlo académicamente y dando en el seguridad y confianza para desenvolverse en un futuro.
texts.en:
Denia, age 27, is a tenacious and enterprising young woman.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has one child.  He is very little, and he does not go to school because he is not school age.  She has one grade of primary school education.  She was not able to continue studying for lack of financial support from her parents.  In her life partner’s company she learned to work the land approximately eight years ago.  In her area the business activity that generates money to support the different families is growing coffee.

The different jobs with her crops are done by the two of them.  They work together farming in familial union with mutual support.  The crops are one kilometer from their house, and they go there by foot.  Their product is commercialized and sold at the local market on a small scale to the different sellers in the area.

She is now requesting help in order to buy supplies to improve their coffee crops.  By doing so, she will be able to assure her crops and the product in order to generate income for her family.

Her plans and goals for the future are to expand her crops by purchasing more land.  She will be able to work the land and strengthen the heritage for her forthcoming children.  Her dream is to see her child fulfilled and with a university education.  This way she will be able to prepare him academically and give him the security and confidence to develop in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia de 70 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, vive sola y trabaja para mentenerce ella misma.

Desde hace 27 años se dedica a vender escapularios, este oficio lo aprendio cuando de joven tuvo un accindente y se fracturo la rodilla. Primero fue un pasatiempo, despues se dio cuenta que sus creaciones tenian buen mercado en la zona y fue asi como empezo en el comercio.

El prestamo sera utilizado para comprar materiales para la elaboración de escapularios como: tela, estampa, plasticos y  cinta que la compra para todo el año.

Ignacia tiene como objetivo seguir trabajando y no tener que depender de nadie.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 70 years old, single and has 2 children.  She lives alone and works to support herself.  For the past 27 years she has dedicated herself to selling scapulars.  She learned this trade when she was young after having an accident in which she injured her knee.  At first is was a hobby, but later she realized that their was a market in the area for her work, which led her to start her business.  

The loan will be used to purchase materials to make scapulars such as: fabric, yarn, plastic and tape that she buys for the whole year.  Ignacia's goal is to continue working and not have to depend on anyone.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make scapulars, such as: fabric, yarn, plastic and tape.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Gregorio, quien con su credikiva logró comprar al por mayor y de contado, refrescos, cervezas, mecatos y variedades.  Su capital de trabajo fue abundante y mejoraron sus ingresos familiares y su nivel de vida y el de su familia. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por el apoyo financiero, me ha servido de mucho para progresar y espero sigan ayudándome.“ En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará cervezas, refrescos, alimentos empacados al por mayor y de contado, además de mercancía variada para la época de fin de año. Pues es temporada alta para este tipo de negocio y esto impactará el mejoramiento del ingreso.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Gregorio who with his Kiva loan was able to purchase wholesale beverages, beer, snacks, etc... in case.  His working capital was abundant and improved his family's income as well as their standard of living.  

His message to the funders is the following: "Thank you very much for the financial support, it has allowed me to progress and I hope that you will continue to help me."  Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan with which he will purchase beer, beverages and packaged foods in bulk and in cash, as well as a variety of merchandise for the end of the year season.  Since it is a busy time for the type of business, it will have a great impact on the improvement of his income.

loans.use: purchase beer, beverages, packaged foods in bulk and in cash.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old and supports five members of his family. His wife gives additional income and they have three children of 7, 5 and 2 years. He has operated his retail shop for 8 years which earns him a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

Peter has taken a loan to purchase more stock for his retail shop.The profits he gets will be used to expand the business so as to meet the community demands. This is his sixth loan term with Kadet. His hopes and dreams in the future are to to be a wholesaler and distributor of home products in his community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 27-year-old farmer who is married to Aram, a driver. Their marriage is blessed with three children. Caroline has been farming for the past six years, with a monthly income of 8,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Caroline is applying for her second loan with KADET, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Caroline will use the loan to buy pigs for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the farm, she will buy more land for farming. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her farm.

loans.name: Meswaleh

texts.en:
Meswaleh is a married woman with three children who go to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Meswaleh operates a food making business, making food such as beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items for preparation and sale

loans.name: Denia Yolanda

texts.es:
Denia es una mujer de 33 años de edad madre de 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su esposo en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al esfuerzo, dedicación y apoyo que sus padres le brindaron pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar la tierra en donde es cultivada la hortaliza como también el café. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona y también las bodegas en la zona urbana donde es vendido su producto directamente. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan diariamente a pie para dar asistencia técnica para evitar daños en sus cosechas.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos como ser: abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café ya que con este apoyo podrá proteger sus cultivos y estará más seguro de plagas entre otros.

Su sueños es mejorar día a día sus cultivos poder incrementar un poco más sus cosechas en variedad y calidad, como también ser una de las caficultoras más fuertes para dedicarse a la compra-venta ya que sus hijos son la prioridad más grande, sus estudios y otras necesidades que diariamente se presentan para el mejoramiento de su familia
texts.en:
Denia is 33 years old and the mother of 3 children who all depend on her and her husband in all aspects of life. She finished her primary school education that she was able to finish with much determination and dedication and the support her parents were able to give her. But she was unable to continue in school because her family lacked the economic resources. She has a lot of experience in agricultural work because her parents taught her since she was very young to work the earth and how to grow coffee beans. Her customers are different buyers who come to her area and also warehouses in the urban area where she sells her product directly. Her fields are located about 3 kilometers from her home, where she travels by foot every day to help care for her crop. 

Today she is asking for a loan to purchase supplies like fertilizers and other things needs for the maintenance of her coffee crop because with these supplies she will be able to protect her fields and they will be safer from plagues and other unpredictable events. 

Her dream is to improve her fields day by day and to be able to increase her harvests in variety and quality. She would also like to be one of the biggest coffee bean suppliers and to begin working as a saleswoman of her product as well because in this way she will be able to provide her children with more opportunities for schooling and other daily needs that have, so they can have a better life.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies and to protect her coffee crop.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 19 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid with his three siblings and his parents. His father is a veterinarian. Mahmoud is studying for his Bachelor of Economics degree. He also works at a water station. He is planning to get his Bachelor's degree in order to work in his field of study after graduation and to start helping his parents financially. But his parents are currently facing a financial crisis, which is making it difficult for them to pay Mahmoud's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Sivanu

texts.en:
Sivanu is a 54-year-old married woman with eight children. She makes and sells donuts, pork buns and pies in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Sivanu needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, dripping oil, a large frying pan, baking soda and plastic bags for her bakery. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. Sivanu became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, dripping oil, a large frying pan, baking soda and plastic bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors, windows, cement and sand.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is 43 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She operates a tailoring shop in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last 12 years. She earns a monthly profit of 8,000 KES. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her fourth loan of 30,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to add some clothing material for her business. She will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her children. In the future, Kadzo hopes to grow her tailoring shop as she intends to open up a fully set-up boutique in the area.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 48 year old woman who sells a variety of commodities, such as hair clips, pony tails, cotton buds, earrings, chargers and batteries. She patiently runs this business everyday to earn living. 

With very little earnings, Imelda can hardly budget for her family. But she doesn't stop believing that someday she will be able to manage to budget for her family. With her determination to get ahead in life, she requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy hair clips, shades, combs, tissue, cuticle remover, acetone and nail polish as additional goods to sell. 

She believes that this loan amount will allow her to increase the profit she gains and to improve her living conditions. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved so she can make her dreams possible.

loans.use: to buy hair clips, shades, combs, tissue, cuticle remover, acetone and nail polish for her vending activity

loans.name: Nchi

texts.en:
Nchi is a divorced woman. She has four children: three adults and one school going child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Nchi has operated a vegetable stall business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a married woman with three children, who are all adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over seven years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in financing her child’s education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julieta hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena, is a 47-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Zareena's husband had been driving an auto rickshaw in the Lahore city for many years, but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are fully out of order. He sold his rickshaw to a scrap dealer at a very low price. Now he wants to buy a new auto rickshaw, but the amount of money they have is not enough. 

Zareen's husband is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without a rickshaw. Therefore, Zareena requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and with the addition of this amount, her husband can easily buy a new rickshaw. 

Her husband and Zareena say thank you to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw.

loans.name: Awa Ndaw's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 11 septembre 2013 est composé de  femmes ayant un vœu ardent d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture de l’arachide pendant l’hivernage.

Madame Awa  (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 33 ans et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 filles et 02 garçons. Elle s’active exclusivement dans la vente d’huile de palme qu’elle achète en majorité dans la sous région pour la revente en gros et détail dans la capitale, au village et dans les marchés hebdomadaire.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, lui permettra de renforce sa capacité de financement en achetant 3 bidons de 20 litres à 13 500 F CFA le bidons. 

Les bénéfices, elle compte les reconduire dans ses investissement via l’épargne en bénéficiant de  me permettent de renforcer son épargner pour obtenir durant les prochains cycles de prêts plus importants.
texts.en: This "banc villageois," newly inaugurated on September 11, 2013, is made up of women with the ardent goal of integrating the different "bancs villageois" program. The women have all lived in the same village for several years and maintain relations based on solidarity and mutual aid. They have, as their main business, the sale and growth of peanuts during the rainy season. Ms. Awa (standing to the far right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married, 33 years old, and the mother of 5 children, of which 3 are girls and 2 boys. She works exclusively in the sale of palm oil, the majority of which she buys in the sub-region for resale in bulk and at retail in the capital, the village and the weekly markets. With this new loan, she will be able to strengthen her financial capital by buying 3 drums of 20 liters at a cost of 15,500 f CFA per drum. She expects to divert the profit into investments via beneficial savings which will allow her to strengthen her savings in order to obtain more important loans during the next cycle.

loans.use: to strengthen her financial capcity by buying 3 drums of 20 liters at a cost of 13,500 f CFA per drum

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Es casada y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Nuestra amiga María es una mujer multifacética y con visión de negocio, ya que desarrolla ampliamente varios trabajos de acuerdo a la temporada, entre las actividades que realiza principalmente se dedica a la venta de bebidas envasadas como gaseosas, cervezas y agua mineral en diversas marcas y presentaciones, hace sus pedidos al por mayor a una empresa distribuidora para después venderlos entre los vecinos u ocasionales clientes que pasan por su casa. Para cumplir esta función tiene una refrigeradora que logró comprar con sus ahorros. Realiza esta labor hace 5 años. Eventualmente se dedica también a la venta de comida. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener un bar complementado con todo lo necesario para brindar comodidad a sus clientes con mayor tranquilidad, espera que todo el esfuerzo que realiza produzca buenos frutos como hasta ahora ya que lo único que desea es seguir adelante. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará más cantidad de gaseosas y cervezas para que siga trabajando.
texts.en:
María, 46, is hardworking and enterprising. She is married, and her five children live with her in their own house. María is a multifaceted person with a good sense of business; she has already grown several seasonal businesses, including her main business selling various brands of bottled soda, beer, and water. She places wholesale orders with a distributor and then sells the merchandise from her house to neighbors and passers-by. She used her savings to buy a refrigerator for the business, which she has been operating for five years. She also prepares and sells food. She would like to open a bar some day where she could more easily serve her customers and make them comfortable. 

She hopes that her efforts will produce great results, though right now she just wants to keep growing. She has applied for a loan of S/. 2000. She is very happy to know that funding will be available and that she can feel certain that her business will grow. She promises once again to make her payments on time. She will use the loan to buy soda and beer to keep working.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos Ernesto  vive en la cuidad de león de donde se traslada semanalmente Asia Managua donde trabaja en una empresa de servicios público.
Carlos está solicitando a la fuente de financiamiento de kiva y ceprodel un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento para la  reparación de una pares que tiene en mal estado y así darle mayor comodidad a su  familia ya que la mayor parte del tiempo  pasa alejado  de su familia  por las condiciones de su trabajo y esto le va dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos Ernesto  lives in the city of Leon where he commutes from during the week to Managua where he works at a public services company.  Carlos is requesting a from the financing sources Kiva and Ceprodel a credit to invest it in buying construction materials such as rocks, sand, and concrete to repairs some walls that are in poor condition and this way give his family more comfort as most of the time he is away from them because of his work and this will give his family more security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Nele

texts.en:
Nele is a 47 year old married woman with 3 children. She makes and sells BBQ food in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Nele needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soy sauce, onions, garlic, tomato sauce and bbq sets. 

She plans to use her profits to support her family. Nele became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy bbq food for preparation and sale

loans.name: Maripet

texts.en:
Maripet is 35 years old and blessed with four children. He is a livestock trader in the Olopito area and has been running the business for the past ten years. He makes a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He has borrowed a fourth loan from KADET of KES 80,000, which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. 

His future dream is to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy livestock for trade.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 55 years old.  He is a mixed crop farmer.  He is married to Mary, who is a green grocer owner. Their marriage is blessed with two children. Joseph has been running his farm for the past two years with a monthly income of ksh 10,000, which he uses to meet the needs of his family. 

Joseph is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy poultry, feed and boost his wife’s business. With the anticipated profits from both his farm and his wife’s green grocery, Joseph will expand his poultry farm.   

Joseph's hopes and dreams are to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy poultry, feed and boost his wife’s business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 47 years old, married to Josphine and they have five children who are in school. 

He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for two years and has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy fertilizer, seeds and spraying chemicals. With the anticipated profit, he plans to boost his farming business. 

He hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him expand and diversify his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and spraying chemicals

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en: Kavumbi is 63 years old, married, and a mother of three children. For the last twelve years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her grocery store in Malindi. She now earns a monthly profit of about KES 14,950. Kavumbi was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for her fourth loan of KES 60,000 to buy additional stock for her grocery store, such as cooking oil, vegetables, fruits, cooking flour and so on, to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as to expand her business. Her goal for the future is to grow her grocery store into a general store so as to realize improved income so that she may help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 32 years old, a mixed crop farmer, and a single mother to two children. Jacinta has been farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of KSH 5,000 which she uses for her upkeep and that of her family. 

Jacinta is applying for her first loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to buy a donkey and an oxen to help her with the work on the farm. 

With the anticipated profit following the loan, she will expand her farm. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy a donkey and an oxen to help her with farm work

loans.name: Rina Isabel

texts.es:
Rina de 28 años de edad, esta acompañada, tiene 4 hijos: de 4 meses, 5 años de edad, 9 años de edad y 12 años de edad. Rina es ama de casa, pero ademas de eso presta servicios con un molino que su pareja le compro, le enseño a usar y ahora, despues de 5 años administra.

El prestamo sera utilizado para comprar tejas y terminar el techo de la casa, ademas comprara las puertas, con eso la familia vivira con mayores comodidades.

El sueño de Rina es terminar su casa y que sus hijos logren terminar sus estudios en la universidad.
texts.en:
Rina, 28, has a life partner and four children, ages four months, 5, 9, and 12. Rina is a homemaker. However, for five years, she has also been offering milling service with the mill her husband bought and taught her to use. 

She will use this loan to buy tile, to finish the roof, and to buy doors for her house so that her family will live more comfortably. Rina dreams of finishing her house and of seeing her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy tile and doors for the house.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a married woman with three children, one in school and two adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Samira dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, beans and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, beans and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Imereta

texts.en: Imereta is 30 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling snacks and finger foods, coffee, etc., in her community and has been doing this for three years. Imereta has requested a loan to buy a sack of rice, boxes of chicken, sausages, soy sauce, sacks of flour, and foam plates. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Imereta will help her family in every need.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, boxes of chicken, sausages, soy sauce, sacks of flour, and foam plates

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 39 years old and a shopkeeper. He is married to Pasqulina and they are blessed with two children, ages 12 years and three years old. Antony has been running his retail shop for the past six years, with a monthly income of 5,000 KES, which he uses to meet the needs of his family. 

Antony is applying for his second loan with KADET. He will use the loan to add more stock, such as sugar, flour, stationery, etc., to his inventory. With the expected profits from his business, he will pay school fees for his children and repay his loan with KADET. 

Antony hopes and dreams that one day he will have a sustainable business and build a good home for his family.

loans.use: to add more stock, such as sugar, flour, stationery, etc., to his inventory.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her child’s education expenses and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Liza would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 10,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Liza dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her youngest child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married with four children, three of whom are in school and one who is an adult. They live in their own home, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Bahati's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

Bahati has operated a juice-making business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. 

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of passion fruit, carrots and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of passion fruit, carrots and sugar for her juice-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to continue buying mobile recharge cards and electrical materials that will help her to get more profit from her business.

loans.name: Dilma Lizeth

texts.es: Dilma, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo y reside en el municipio de Saba, Colon, en casa de su madre. Ella estuvo laborando en una entidad municipal y luego que quedo sin empleo se dedico al comercio, vende ropa de segunda y sandalias para damas. Este negocio lo estableció en un local que alquila en el mercado y para mantenerlo activo ha solicitado dos prestamos anteriores, con el actual es el tercer ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras, con este  préstamo va comprar dos fardos de ropa usada y sandalias para vender.
texts.en:
Dilma is 30 years old and lives at her mother’s house in the town of Saba, Colon.  She and her husband are in a common-law relationship.  

Dilma worked for a municipal entity, but she later devoted herself to the retail trade after she lost her job.  She sells secondhand clothing and sandals for women.  This business is located in a rented shop at the market and remains active.  Dilma has requested two previous loans.  This current loan, her third one, is in the amount of 15,000 HNL and will be used to buy two bundles of used clothing and sandals that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of used clothing and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 35, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and has children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rowena operates the buy-and-sell business of her family. What she does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell the merchandise with a little profit. Her products are women’s clothes, slippers and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy, due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She also sells ice for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items like women’s clothes, slippers and other products of the like.

Rowena dreams that her business will flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has no children and has been doing this work for eight years. His primary income sources are crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling the farm produce." His biggest challenge is "Marketing the produce." Animals on the farm have been given no names.

John was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Form the ease of access." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "They offer small loans which transform loans."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, John replied it "will improve his livelihood."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. John owns the following: "cow, poultry" but does not own: "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "solar power, TV" but does not have "mosquito net, electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 53 years old and lives with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a kind and hardworking lady. Her children have grown and she is worried about their future. 

Razia's husband owns his own business to have a regular income for the family. He manufactures and sells furniture, such as tables, chairs, beds, etc. He loves his business and does work with fondness, even in his old age. Razia's elder son assists his father in completing his daily work tasks. 

This business yields a good income for Razia's husband, but his family's needs are increasing day by day, and he needs to earn more money. He wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to expand his business. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy planks, chip boards and nails for making furniture. Razia hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for the business as well as for her family.

Razia says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support

loans.use: to buy planks, chip board, nails, etc., for furniture making.

loans.name: Linneth Guadalupe

texts.es: Lineth de 27 años de edad,  es la propietaria  de un negocio de panadería ubicada al sur de la ciudad, donde habita con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 9 meses. Su idea de negocio nació poco después de estudiar culinaria y como su esposo es administrador de un negocio de comidas, decidieron aprovechar toda esta experiencia, para  generar ingresos con esta actividad; así fue como en su casa dio inicio con poca inversión y hoy en día está ubicada en un local con mejores condiciones. Ella comienza su tarea diaria desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 9 de la noche, estimando los tiempos de alimentación y descanso. Contrata un panadero diariamente para su producción y ha logrado en su oferta, producir además de panes de diversos sabores y consistencias, elaborar diversas galletas, vender helados, jugos etc. En sus 3 años de experiencia ha vendido de contado y ha comprado de la misma manera, como hasta hoy lo hace. Su meta es contar con sillas y mesas, para más adelante tener una cafetería, porque su sueño y el de su esposo, es comprar su casa, y su mayor desafío es mantener y aumentar muchos clientes actuales, para que estos le refieran nuevos consumidores y continuar el camino de la prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará bultos de harina y víveres para incrementar la producción y vender más productos diversificados que hoy no tiene, lo que hace que su credikiva sea muy exitoso.
texts.en:
Lineth, 27, owns a bakery located is the southern part of the city where she lives with her husband and nine-month-old son. She came up with her business idea after studying cooking. Since her husband manages a food business, they decided to take advantage of all this experience and earn money at the trade. She started the business in her house, and now it is located in a better space.

She works from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day, including serving time and her break. She employs a baker to make the products and has managed to offer different types and flavors of bread, cookies, ice cream, juices, and more. During her three years in business, she has sold and bought in cash. Her goal is to buy tables and chairs for a cafeteria because she and her husband dream of buying a house. Her main challenge is keeping and growing her large customer base so that they refer new customers and that the business prospers. 

She has applied for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that she can buy bulk flour and food items to increase production and sell a wider range of merchandise, which will make her Kiva loan a big success.

loans.use: to buy bulk flour and food items.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 40 years old and supports three people in the family. His wife Monica adds to the income by rearing and selling chicken. Together they are blessed with three children of 11, 4, and 2 years respectively.

Nicholas has operated his retail business for three years, with a monthly income of KES 12,000. He has borrowed loans from KADET to purchase more stock for his retail shop. From the anticipated profits, he will educate his children.

This is his second loan after paying back the first loan successfully. Nicholas's hopes and dreams for his business in the future are to enlarge the business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Juana Ruth

texts.es: Doña Juana Ruth, es una madre muy trabajadora, en la actualidad tiene bajo su cargo a dos de sus hijos que son menores de edad y están estudiando. Junto a su esposo quien es  electricista se apoya trabajando a diario en el negocio de metalúrgica haciendo camas y cocinas de metal los cuales vende en su casa. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar materiales como marcos de metal para cama, cocina, resortes y pinturas, de esta manera continuar con su labor y poder ofertar sus productos.
texts.en: Juana Ruth is a hardworking mother, who cares for two of her younger children who are in school. She and her husband, who is an electrician, work in their metal workshop each day making beds and stoves, which they sell from their house. She has applied for a loan to buy materials like metal frames for beds, stoves, and pictures and springs so that she can keep working and selling her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy metal frames for beds, stoves, and pictures and springs.

loans.name: Chebarias

texts.en:
Chebarias is 52 years old and is married to Mary, who supports with additional income by the services she gives as a teacher. Together they are blessed with four children. His monthly income is KES 15,000.

Chebarias has asked for a loan from KADET to buy seedling bags and to pay laborers for his farmwork. He will use his profits to expand his farm. He will prepare nursery beds for fruits, which he sells at a profit. This is his first loan from KADET.

Chebarias's hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and live happily with his family.

loans.use: To buy seedling bags and pay laborers for his farmwork

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
This is Jason. He previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase poultry and feed supplies for his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that he will use to pay for poultry and feed supplies for his business. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jason dreams that his business will get bigger and hopes to have a vacation abroad. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for poultry and feed supplies for his business.

loans.name: Tening's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 12 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des alentours. Elles vivent une parfaite solidarité entre elles. 
Dibe âgée de 46 ans est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 filles. Sur la photo elle est en position debout et a levé la main.
Le prêt va lui permettre de faire l'embouche bovine. Elle va acheter 1 bœuf à 175 000f et de l'aliment pour l'engraissé pendant 5 mois. Elle compte le vendre à 275 000f voire 300 0000f.
Les bénéfices, sont destinés à satisfaire les besoins de la famille: payement des frais scolaires, assurer la dépense quotidienne mais aussi à renforcer l'épargne dans le banc villageois
texts.en:
This group of 28 women is part of the "banc villageois" that was founded on 12 December 2009. The group includes women who live in the same village and neighbouring villages. They all live in perfect solidarity.
Dibe is 46 years old. She is married and has six children of which four are girls. In the photo she is standing up on the right with her hand raised.
The loan will enable her to practice cattle fattening. She is going to buy one ox for 175,000 CFA and enough cattle feed to fatten the ox for 5 months. She plans to sell the ox for 275,000 CFA or even 300,000 CFA.
She will use the profits to satisfy her family needs: paying school fees, covering daily household expenses but also contributing to the savings of the "banc villageois".

loans.use: to buy an ox and cattle feed

loans.name: America Jacqueline

texts.es: América, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella lleva 6 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio donde ofrece los servicios de corte de pelo para damas y caballeros y venta de cosméticos. Ella adquirió experiencia en una barbería donde trabajaba anteriormente. Para mantener activo este negocio necesita invertir y ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar cosméticos y una vitrina para exhibir los productos y vender. Su propósito es aumentar los ingresos y poder ayudar a sus hijos a que logren un buen estudio.
texts.en:
América is 36 years old and a single mother with three children.  She lives in the town of Tela, Atlántida.  

For the past six years, América has managed her own business in which she provides haircuts to women and men.  She also sells cosmetics.  América acquired her experience at a barber shop where she was previously employed.  She needs to invest in her business in order to keep it active, so she is requesting a loan for 5,000 HNL.  The money will be used to buy cosmetics and a display cabinet for exhibiting the products that she sells.  Her goal is to increase her earnings so that she can help her children obtain a good education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and a display cabinet.

loans.name: Mujeres De Pajales Group

texts.en:
Mujeres de Pajales (Women of Pajales) are a group of four women who live in Pajales, in the small town of San Andres Villa Seca, near the city of Cuyotenango, Retalhuleu, Guatemala.  They are starting their second nine-month cycle with Namaste.  In the first cycle they were very responsible with their payments and worked hard with their Business Advisor.  In this cycle, they want to continue learning how to manage their businesses.  One of the women said, “We learned in the first cycle how to control our expenses and how to manage our profit.  Now we want to learn more about how to make our businesses bigger.”

Angélica Maria (1st from left) is 33 and has a third grade education.  She is in a domestic partnership and has five children, ages 11, 10, 8, 6 and a baby of 5 months.  The three oldest are in school.  The family lives in a one-room wood house constructed by her husband.  There is an outdoor kitchen and latrine.  There is no potable water so they get their water from a river about 150 yards away.  Her business is selling little chicks that she buys at one day old for about 60 US cents and sells after 2-3 weeks for about $1.20.  She spends her days selling chickens and looking after the children.  Her husband keeps an eye on the chicks at night (to avoid robbery) and works in whatever he can find during the day.  She supplies most of the income for the family, with her husband providing money when he finds work. 

Angélica Maria plans to use the money from her loan to fix up the area where she keeps the chickens, including putting wire mesh all around to prevent them from being stolen, and also to buy more chickens.  She currently sells approximately 12,000 chickens a month.  She spends 120 hours on this business and the rest of her time taking care of the children and home.  Her current profit is about US$623, and she plans to eventually add 3,000 more chickens and increase her profit by 25%.  She wants to have enough money to send her fourth child to school when he is ready next year.  Her goal is to keep growing her business so that she can meet all the chicken needs of her area.

loans.use: to fix up the area where she feeds her chicks and to buy more chicks for her business

location.town: Pajales, San Andres Villa Seca, Retalhuleu

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón  es un hombre  soltero de 26 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es un hombre trabajador que tiene el deseo de superarse y darle lo mejor a su familia. El se dedica a la compraventa de verduras en el mercado local de su comunidad. Eligio esta actividad porque sus padres le enseñaron esta actividad cuando él era pequeño.
A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir con la economía de su familia. El ahora cuenta con 7 años de experiencia en esta área que es bastante productiva y rentable.
El se ha dado cuenta que cada día hay más de manda en este tipo de negocio, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00  para la compra de verduras como papa, cebolla y zanahorias, esto lo hace con el fin de incrementar sus ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es construir su vivienda,  para poder darle lo mejor a su familia y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ramón is a single man who is 26 years of age.  He lives with his parents and siblings in the Department of Sololá.  

Ramón is a hardworking man who has the drive to excel and provide the best for his family.  He buys and sells vegetables at the local market in his community.  Ramón chose this line of work because his parents were the ones who taught him the trade when he was young.  Through his work, he has been able to generate a profit and earn acceptable income so that he can contribute to his family’s finances.  Ramón now has seven years of experience in this trade, which has been both productive and profitable.  

Ramón has realized that there is growing demand each day in this type of business.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 3,000 GTQ in order to buy vegetables such as potatoes, onions, and carrots, which will increase his earnings.  His greatest wish is to build a home so that he can provide the best for his family and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 26 years old, married to Rachael, and they have one child who is four months old.

He has a business of selling shoes in Naivasha which he has operated for two years.  He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to buy a stock of shoes to sell. With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy shoes.

He hopes to see his children well educated in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a stock of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ndickou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 12 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des alentours. Elles vivent une parfaite solidarité entre elles.
Ndickou âgée de 46 ans est en position debout sur la photo et a levée la main. Elle est marié et mère de 3 enfants.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter 2 bœufs à 140 000f l'un. Pour l’engraissement des bêtes, elle achète du foins à 4000f chaque mois pour une durée de 5 mois. En activité parallèle elle compte faire la vente de café. Chaque semaine elle achète 2 kg de café moulu, cette activité va lui permettre d'épargner.
Les bénéfices de ces activités lui permettent de renforcer son épargne, d'appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la famille, de payer en l’occurrence la scolarité de son fils qui est dans le privé.
texts.en:
These 5 women are members of a banc villageois that was created on December 12, 2009. It brings together women who live in the same village with women from surrounding areas. They live in perfect sisterhood. 

Ndickou is 46 years old, and is standing in the photo with her hand raised. She is married and has 3 children.

Ndickou will use her loan to buy 2 steers at 140,000 Francs CFA each. In order to fatten the animals, she will spend 4000 Francs CFA on hay each month for a period of 5 months. She also plans on buying 2 kg of ground coffee each week to sell. This second business will allow her to save up some money. 

The income from these businesses will allow her to increase her savings, help her husband support their family, and to pay for her son’s private schooling.

loans.use: to buy cattle and coffee.

loans.name: Lisbeth De Los Angeles

texts.es: la señora Lisbeth, casada ama de casa, su esposo labora por cuenta propio ya que es Ingeniero en Informatica,  la actividad comercial de Lisbeth es venta de ropa, con sus ganacias se ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ella vende en su casa y por encargo su mayor cliente la obtiene de una fabrica de Candela que esta cerca de su casa. el credito lo solicita para invertir en su negocio comprando Pantalones, Blusas, Calzado. espera con esta inversion mejores ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Lisbeth is a homemaker.  Her husband is self-employed as a computer engineer.  

Lisbeth’s business involves selling clothes and the income she earns helps with the household expenses.  She sells from home, but her largest client is the Candela factory that is located near her house.  The loan she is requesting will be invested in her business by purchasing trousers, blouses, and shoes.  She hopes that this investment will boost her earnings so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 24 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 12 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des alentours. Elles vivent une parfaite solidarité entre elles.
Diouma, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
Le prêt va servir à acheter de l'arachide, elle fait ce type d'activité depuis longtemps et y trouve bien son compte.
Avec les bénéfices, elle va aider son mari à prendre en charge les frais scolaires et l'habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
These 24 women are members of a banc villageois that was created on December 12, 2009. It brings together women who live in the same village with women from neighboring areas. They all live together in perfect sisterhood.

Diouma is 38 years old, and standing on the right with her hand raised in the photo. She is married and has 3 children. 

She will use the loan to buy peanuts. She has been working in that domain for a long time with great success.

Diouma will use the income to help her husband to buy clothing for their children and pay for their schooling.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Safietou Amadou

texts.fr:
Madame Safiétou est une  commerçante qui a ouvert une boutique d’alimentation générale dans son quartier.  Elle a une expérience de 15 ans dans ce domaine. Safiétou est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. C’est une habituée du guichet car elle a déjà eu à bénéficier de 3 crédits pour renforcer son activité. Etant dans une zone très fréquentée, elle a l’opportunité de fructifier son commerce car elle a une forte demande.  
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter les denrées les plus rapides à écouler comme le riz, le sucre, le lait, le thé, le savon...et des boissons.  Safiétou s’est très tôt responsabilisée dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. C’est elle qui se charge de la nourriture ; elle s’occupe aussi des frais de scolarité de ses enfants, mais réussi tout de même à mettre de l’argent de coté. Dans l’avenir elle voudrait agrandir sa boutique avec l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
Safiétou is a shopkeeper who opened a general food shop in her neighborhood. She has had 15 years of experience in this business. Safiétou is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She is already familiar with the borrowing process as she has already received three loans to improve her business.

Since she is in a heavy traffic area, Safiétou has the opportunity to make her business very productive as there is a high demand for her products. With this loan, she will purchase the food products that sell the most quickly, such as rice, sugar, milk, tea, soap, and beverages. 

Safiétou became responsible for her own daily expenses at an early age. She is in charge of food, as well as the education costs for her children, and yet also manages to put money aside. In the future she would like to grow her shop with the help of her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, sugar, oil, and soap to resell

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita lives in Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental in the Philippines, along with her family. While her husband works at a bakery, she manages a farm planting and harvesting vegetables to sell in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for four years, and earns 3,000 PHP every month. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC, that she used to buy fertilizer, was successfully repaid. 

Now, she borrowed a new loan of 4,000 PHP to buy seedlings and fertilizer. 

In the future, she wants to  improve her house and the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
Edita es una mujer emprendedora de 32 años de edad, casada con un grado de educación de primaria incompleto cursado hasta el tercer grado por lo cual agradase a sus padres por el apoyo brindado. Junto a su pareja tienen 3 hijos los cuales están en diferentes grados de educación en la primaria y en familia se dedican a la agricultura en lo que es la siembra y cultivo de café. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron dicha actividad mientras trabajaban tierras ajenas por lo que ella agradece a DIOS por hoy en día hacerlo en las propias gracias a una herencia de su padre que con el tiempo de trabajo pudo ahorrar y comprar su propia tierra para después ser cultivada heredando a su hija un pedazo el cual está ubicado a 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente. Su producto es comercializado con los intermediarios que llegan a la zona y que le caracterizan su producto como un producto de calidad e higiénico.

Hoy en día Edita ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas para sus cultivos de café y darles el mantenimiento y protección necesario para poder obtener una buena y provechosa cosecha.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar para poder cubrir los estudios de sus hijos, sus alimentos entre otras necesidades que son necesarias atender para el desarrollo en la vida.
texts.en:
Edita, 32, is enterprising and married. She thanks her parents for helping her finish third grade. She and her husband have three children in elementary school. The family grows coffee, a trade she learned from her parents while working land owned by others. She is grateful that she has is now working her own land, which she inherited from her father, who worked and saved to buy it. Later he gave a her a piece of the land, located about three kilometers from her house, and every day she walks there. She sells her crop through intermediaries who come to the area, and she says her product is of good quality and is healthy. 

Edita has applied to the COMIXMUL cooperative for a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, and pesticide to maintain and protect her coffee plants so that they produce a good harvest. She has plans to expand her plantings so that she can earn more income to pay for her children's education, food, and other needs as they grow up.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to improve her coffee crop.

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en:
Alofa is a 26-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells rice, curry, and sausages in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Alofa needs a loan to buy bag of rice, boxes of chicken, sausages, curry powder, onions, and soy sauce for her business. 

She plans to use her profits to renovate her home. 

Alofa has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy bag of rice, boxes of chicken, sausages, curry powder, onions, and soy sauce

loans.name: Laumoli

texts.en:
Laumoli is a 57-year-old woman who is married with four children. 

She runs a business selling different handicrafts and souvenir products at the market. She has two years of experience with this business.

Laumoli has requested a loan to buy kava bowls, war weapons, sinnet (rope), bangles, elei (fabric printing) materials, and earrings. 

She plans to use her profits to provide financial support to her family and kids. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy kava bowls, war weapons, sinnet, bangles,elei materials, and earrings

loans.name: Fonotasi

texts.en:
Fonotasi is a 35-year-old married woman with eight children. She runs a small business selling ice cream cakes in her community, and has been doing this for two years.

Fonotasi has requested a loan to buy cordial, sugar, foam cups, and chinese lollies. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Fonotasi will provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy cordial, sugar, foam cups, and chinese lollies

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер холостой молодой человек в возрасте 24 лет. Он проживает в районе Рудаки с родителями и сестрой. Алишер молодой бизнесмен. Вот уже три года как он занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Он продает в своем магазине печенье, пряники, чай, макароны, консервированные продукты, конфеты и т.д. В его отсутствии торговлю в магазине ведет его отец. Алишер в свободное от работы времени занимается спортом. Он за здоровый образ жизни. Сейчас в его магазине количество товаров уменьшилось. В связи с этим Алишер обратился за кредитом, чтобы закупить разнообразный ассортимент продуктов питания и таким образом увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en: Alisher is an idle young man who is 24 years old. He resides in the region of Rudaki with his parents and a sister. Alisher is a young businessman. He has worked as a food products trader for three years already. He sells cookies, cake, tea, macaroni, canned foods, and candy etc. in his store. In his father's absence he takes care of business at the store. Alisher plays sports in his free time from work. He has a healthy way of life. Now in his store the number of goods have decreased. In this regard Alisher applied for a loan, to purchase a diverse assortment of food products and therefor increase trade.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of products to in the store.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 25 years old and not yet married. He has a money transfer business in Ndunyu Njeru which he has operated for two years and has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd, to enable him to buy a stock of mobile phone accessories. He plans to plough back anticipated profits into his business.

In the near future, he hopes to see his business grow into a large-scale business.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William sells office and school supplies. His loan helped a lot in his business and in paying his youngest child's tuition fee. He uses his income from the business in his family's everyday expenses. He has had this business for two years now and his wife is helping him run the business.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for he will be utilizing the loan to buy office and school supplies needed in his business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

William dreams to always have good customers and hopes that his family is always in good health. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week. This is where he draws strength and inspiration from the word of God which he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for office and school supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old single mother of three children aged 20, 5 and 3 years old.

She has been in farming business in Ndunyu Njeru for four years and has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd, to enable her buy a dairy cow. With anticipated profits, she plans to educate her children.

In the near future, she hopes to grow financially by applying loans from Kadet Ltd.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fesoloai

texts.en:
Fesoloai is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, milk, rice, toilet rolls, etc. in her community. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Fesoloai needs a loan to buy sacks of sugar, flour, rice, mosquito coils, milk, toilet rolls, tinned fish, cooking oil, cigarettes, biscuits, foam cups and snacks. She hopes to use her profits to extend her store. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, flour, rice, mosquito coils, milk, toilet rolls etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is 66 years old and married to Teresia; they are not supporting any children.

He has a general shop in Ndunyu Njeru which he has been running for six years.  He has applied for a fifth loan from Kadet Ltd to buy maize flour, rice, and sugar, among other things. With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy more stock for his business.

In the near future he hopes to expand his business to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice, and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Sophia's Group

texts.en:
Sophia's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Sophia is 18 years old, and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sophia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, and salt. 

To help expand her business, Sophia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a refrigerator, and will help Sophia generate greater profits and take care of herself. 

Sophia hopes that in the future she will be able to increase in the capital. 

Sophia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Joel Kiega.

texts.en:
Joel is 53 years old, married to Mary and they have five children who are in school.

He has been in farming business in Ndunyu Njeru for fifteen years and has applied for his fifth loan from Kadet Ltd after paying all his previous loans on time. The loan will enable Joel buy fertilizer and seeds. With anticipated profits, he plans to boost his farming business.

In the near future, he hopes to be among the top farmers in his area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 42 years old, married to Francis and they are blessed with four children who are in school.

She has been in farming business in Ndunyu Njeru for thirteen years and has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd, to enable her to buy fertilizer and seeds. With the anticipated profits, she plans to buy a dairy cow.

In the near future, she hopes to expand her dairy farming to increase income from milk sale.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Naomie

texts.en: Naomie appreciates her previous Kiva loan that has improved her living standards and has enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase hair oil and hair chemicals for her beauty salon business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil and hair chemicals for her business.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha was born in 1986. She is married, and the mother of two. Her husband is in the military. 

Aysha has been selling goats and their products for a year. She started her project as a partner with her uncle. 

She is planning to work independently by buying her uncle's share in order to make it her own project in the future. 

Now she wants to increase the number of goats that they have in order to raise her productivity and income, and to be a good support for her family. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Suryakanti

texts.en:
Suryakanti is a 30-year-old widowed lady living with her in-laws and two children who are doing schooling. She lost her husband in an accident in 2004. After that, all the family responsibilities came on her, so she planned to start a small tailoring shop with one sewing machine. She had learned tailoring at her parents' house before her marriage. She is earning 4,000 INR (Indian rupees), which is very low.

She has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for the purchase of two new sewing machines and fabrics, and for a workforce. She wants to give her children a better standard of living and also wants to save some money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machines and fabrics.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 50 years old, married to Dorcas and they are supporting one child aged 20 years who is in college.

He has been in farming business in Ndunyu Njeru for seventeen years and has applied for fourth loan from Kadet Ltd after paying his previous loans on time. With the loan Samwel will buy spraying fertilizer chemicals and seeds and pay for labor. With anticipated profits, he plans to boost his farming business and also make some savings.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his farming business and also make some savings for future use.

loans.use: To buy spraying fertilizer chemicals, seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 39 years old, married to Stephen, and they have five children who are in school.

She has a hotel business in Naivasha which she has operated for five years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to buy flour and cooking fat. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the near future, she hopes to see her business grow and the children well educated.

loans.use: To buy flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Loluama

texts.en:
Loluama is a 27-year-old married woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Loluama has requested a loan to buy chemicals, barbed wire, taro roots and a wheelbarrow for her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Loluama hopes to save for her children's education and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, barbed wire, taro roots and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Zoila Ines

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Zoila en su negocio de artesanías, porque pudo comprar hilo macramé y coral,  además de lana y tela de hamacas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprara materias primas para participar en ferias y también para hacer cursos y prepararse como docente de artesanías. Ella dice a sus financiadores, “gracias por su apoyo y confianza”,  porque con su anterior credikiva logró incrementar sus ingresos y aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Zolla and her craft-making business. She was able to buy macrame thread as well as wool and hammock fabric. 

Now she is seeking another loan through Kiva to buy supplies to make crafts for upcoming fairs. Zolla also wants to take some courses so she can teach crafts. She thanks donors for their support and trust in her. With her previous loan she was able to increase both income and production.

loans.use: buy craft supplies and pay for courses so she can teach crafts

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
