Gilbert lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea growing region of Kenya. He has two children and has been doing this work for five years. His primary income sources are milk and tea.

Gilbert stated that he enjoys farming, but that his biggest challenge is lack of capital. Animals on the farm have been named 'Tamt'. 

Gilbert undertook the required microfinance traning session with Juhudi, where he said he learned about funding for small scale farmers. He said chose Juhudi Kilimo for for this loan due to the cheap interest. 

His highest monthly expense are the farming costs. Gilbert plans to use the increased income from the loan to support his family. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Gilbert owns cows and poultry but does not own pigs, a pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the electricity and a TV in the house but does not have a mosquito net, solar power, running water, sewing machine or DVD player.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Al-Amal Creater Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Amal Creater. It consists of three women who live in Aden, Yemen. They took a loan of 160,000 YER. 

Om-Alkhir is a good person who works hard in correspondence to improve her living standards. Although she earns a low salary, she loves her career. She is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. 

She would like to renovate her house. On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy building materials, such as cement and lumber. She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled. She hopes to have a big home to house her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement and lumber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farming supplies

loans.name: Ansatou Seydi's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans les activités génératrices de revenu. Ce  banc villageois créé en Juillet  2012 est a son troisième cycle ainsi les membres commencent à avoir une bonne maîtrise du système des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ansatou (debout à droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 19 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 garçons, malgré son jeune âge elle demeure une femme très dynamique et n’a que 02 cycles à son actif. Elle est vendeuse de condiments et divers autres produits alimentaires à savoir le thé vert, le sucre, huile raffiné, biscuits et bonbons pour enfant dans le village.

 Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en thé vert soit 02 paquets, en sucre un demi-sac et des bonbons et biscuits par paquets pour la revente au détail. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et  d’aider son mari dans la gestion du foyer.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are all very active in their small businesses. This "banc villageois" was formed in July 2012 and is on its third loan cycle due to the members having mastered the "banc villageois" system. They are all from the same village and get along well with each other.

The women's main business is small shops. Ansatou (pictured standing on the right with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 19 years old, married and the mother of 2 sons. Despite her young age she is a very dynamic woman and has two loan cycles to her credit so far. She is a reseller of spices and various other food products like green tea, sugar, refined oil, biscuits, and children's candy in the village. 

With this loan, Ansatou plans to increase her stock of green tea by two packages, her stock of sugar by a half-bag, and her stock of candies and biscuits by containers for resale. The profits she earns from her business will allow her to put money into savings and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to increase her stock of green tea by two cartons, her stock of sugar by a half-bag, and her stock of candies and biscuits by containers for resale

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is 23 years old and supports his parents. He is employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last two years earning Ksh 15,000 per month. He learnt about Kadet from other riders in Narok town who are already been funded by Kadet Ltd.

He has been advanced a first loan of Ksh 91,019 which will enable him purchase his own motorcycle. This is likely to yield him more income as he has an established customer base. He will use the proceeds to repay the loan.

His dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better as more items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Linda dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel has a variety store and two units of videoke (karaoke) machines for rent. He used his loan in his businesses, and they are both growing and expanding. His loan was also useful in the education of his children, who are in college and high school. His wife is helping him manage their household and their business.  His variety store has been running for twenty years now.

He would like to apply for another loan, this time for 45,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Rodel dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that their house, which is under construction, will be finished soon. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing materials and medicine

loans.name: Djide's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans les activités génératrices de revenu. Ce  banc villageois créé en Juillet  2012 est a son troisième cycle ainsi les membres commencent à avoir une bonne maîtrise du système des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Djidé (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe,  âgée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfant (05 garçons et 01 fille).
Elle achète et vend des produits alimentaires comme le riz, l’huile, sucre …, une activité qu’elle fait depuis 3 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en au niveau des grossistes au marché central régional pour revendre en détaille dans son village et les marchés hebdomadaires environnants.
Pour un sac de sucre de 22 000F Cfa elle revend à 30 000F Cfa
Pour un sac d’oignon à 8 000F Cfa elle revend à 14 000F Cfa
Et divers autres produits alimentaires.
Apres vente et déduction des frais de transport elle se retrouve en moyenne  avec un bénéfice net hebdomadaire de  10 000F Cfa. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et de prendre en charge une partie de la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group consists of women who are very busy in income generating businesses. This "banc villageois" was created in July 2012 and is on its third loan cycle thus the members are starting to have good knowledge of the "banc villageois" system. They are all from the same village and have a good understanding among each other. Their main business is shopkeeping.

Madam Djidé (standing on the far right with one hand raised), is the featured borrower of the group. Thirty-three years old, she is married and mother to 6 children (5 boys and 1 girl).

She buys and sells foodstuffs such as rice, oil, sugar..., a business which she has been in for 3 years.

With this loan she plans to get her supplies from the wholesalers at the regional central market to resell retail in her village and at the surrounding weekly markets.

She resells a 22,000 F CFA bag of sugar for 30,000 F CFA. She resells an 8,000 F CFA bag of onions for 14,000 F CFA. She also sells a variety of other food products.

After selling and deducting the transportation fees she finds herself with a net weekly profit of 10,000 F CFA.

The profits from her business will allow her to save and to take care of part of the daily expenses and the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, onions, and a variety of other food products.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land. He has three children and has been farming for 18 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and crops.
He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is that it is a source of income. His biggest challenge is lack of market and poor roads.

Dominic was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Client friendly, low interest rate.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Meets clients' financial needs.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Dominic replied 'Improve living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Dominic owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene una edad de 42 años ella es casada madre de 3 hijos y agricultora con un grado de educación de primaria incompleto el cual curso hasta el 3 grado. De sus tres hijos el mayor trabaja con ellos en el campo realizando actividades como: corte en tiempo de cosecha, limpieza, aplicación de abono, foliares y otros insumos agrícolas que ayudan a la protección de sus cultivos, y los últimos dos hijos menores uno esta en tercer grado de primaria y el otro en sexto grado en una escuela de la localidad. Su familia ha sido agricultora durante generaciones y la de ella no es la excepción dedicándose en compañía de su esposo al cultivo café el cual es comercializado en el mercado local y con algunos intermediarios que llegan a la zona. Las tierras que trabajan son propias y están ubicadas a 5 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan en vestía.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos entre otros para dar asistencia técnica y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café los cuales están en su punto para poder producir una buena cosecha y aprovecharla al máximo.

Los planes son los de poder incrementar el área de cultivo y para sus hijos apoyarlos en sus estudios ya que con esta solicitud buscan mejorar sus ingresos, que las ganancias sean más ya que sus metas son asegurar la plantación y aprovecharla al máximo.
texts.en:
Juana is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She is a farmer and holds an incomplete primary education degree, she completed third grade. The oldest of her three children works with them in the fields performing activities such as cutting at harvest time, weeding, and applying compost and fertilizers as well as other agricultural inputs that help in protecting the cultivations. The two younger children attend primary school in the locality, one is in third grade and the other is in sixth grade. 

Her family has been in agriculture for generations, and her own family is no exception. Together with her husband she cultivates coffee, which they sell at the local market or to middlemen who visit the area. The land they cultivate is their own and it is located 5 km away from their house, they get there riding on an animal. 

She has applied for a loan at COMIXMUL in order to buy fertilizers, compost, and more so that she can maintain her coffee cultivations that are at the point where they can start producing a good harvest, and she wants to make the most of it. 

Her plans are to increase the cultivated area and to support her children in their studies, since she seeks to improve her income with the help of the loan. She hopes that they will make more profit, since their aim is to ensure the harvest and make the most of it.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers to maintain her coffee cultivations

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida is a 42-year-old married Iraqi woman. She has four children. As the family grew, Nahida bought a sewing machine and worked as a tailor to assist her husband with their family's income. Now with the children going to school, the parents are having difficulty providing the basics for the children and paying for their school expenses. 

Nahida wanted to keep the children in school.  Every year, the family faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the study year with the additional expenses that are needed to cover study fees and books. With this loan, now she can accommodate all these expenses for her son, Maitham, and still cover the other expenses from her income. 

She is requesting a loan to pay for her son's school fees and other study expenses. Maitham is dreaming to be an officer. 

The story of Maitham is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients who are able to get a better education.

loans.use: to pay for her son's school fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 25-year-old mother of three 3 children. She runs a small business selling ice-cakes in her local community and has been doing this for two years. Mary has requested a loan to buy cordials, foam cups and sugar. The loan will also assist with her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mary will help improve her family standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cordials, foam cups and sugar

loans.name: La Union De Laderas De Chillon Group

texts.es: El grupo “LA UNION DE LADERAS DE CHILLON”   es una alcancía recién formada, sus integrantes son 08 amigos y vecinos del mismo lugar. Aida es una de sus socias ella tiene 47 años  es casada  y tiene 02 hijos uno de 28 y otra de 14 años que aun está en la escuela. Aida tiene su negocio de venta de ropa, hace 2 años instalo un lugar en su casa para poner su negocio allí vende toda clase de prendas tanto para niños damas y hombres. Gracias a su trabajo solventa algunos gastos de sus hijos así ayuda a su esposo. Aida destinara su préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir para la temporada de primavera  en el futuro quiere arreglar su local y poner más vitrinas para exhibir sus prendas. Aida agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por este préstamo para su grupo comunal, en la foto es la 7ma de la izquierda tiene casaca color ploma.
texts.en:
The group La Union de Laderas de Chillon is a brand new communal bank. Its members are eight friends and neighbors from the same area. Aida is one of the members. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Her son is 28 and her daughter is fourteen and still in school. Aida has her own business selling clothing. She set up a space at home two years ago in order to open her business there. She sells all types of clothing for men, women, and children. Her work allows her to cover some of her children's expenses, and that way she helps her husband. 

Aida will use her loan to purchase clothing items for the spring season. In the future she wants to fix up her space and add more display cases to show her items. Aida thanks Kiva investors for this group loan. In the picture, she is the seventh person from the right, wearing a gray sweatshirt.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Villa Universitaria Group

texts.es: La alcancía “Villa Universitaria” está integrada por 06 socias emprendedoras, todas se desempeñan en diferentes negocios. Una de ellas es Julia  de 62 años casada con 06 hijos mayores de edad. Hace 07 meses  inicio su propio negocio una fuente de soda que está ubicada en su misma casa, allí  vende comida rápida como salchipapas,hamburgesas y jugos. Julia se siente feliz con su negocio porque así ayuda a su esposo que no tiene un trabajo estable, su negocio es muy frecuentado por sus vecinos y amistades; por su zona no había ese tipo de negocio por lo mismo tiene muchos clientes. El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de frutas al por mayor y reponer algunos utensilios deteriorados, mas adelante desea ampliar su negocio para poder recibir a mas clientela. Julia esta agradecida a nombre de ella y su grupo comunal a todos los inversionistas de KIVA que hacen posible que puedan progresar en sus negocios, en la foto es la tercera de la izquierda viste chaleco color plomo, la foto adjunta pertenece a la Sra Ana Lucia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Villa Universitaria consists of six entrepreneurial members, each one with their own business. One of them is Julia who is 62 years old, married, and has six adult children. Seven months back she opened her own business, a food stand located in her home where she sells fast food such as fried potatoes with hot dog, hamburgers and juices. 

Julia feels happy about her business, because in this way she is able to help her husband who doesn't have a stable job. Her business is very frequented by her neighbors and friends. There was no such business in her neighborhood before, which is why she has a lot of customers. 

She will use the requested loan to buy fruits in bulk and to replace some worn utensils. In the future she wishes to extend her business in order to be able to serve more customers. Julia is grateful on behalf of herself and her communal bank to the Kiva lenders, who make it possible for them to progress with their businesses. Julia is the third person from the left wearing a grey vest. The attached photo shows Ana Lucia.

loans.use: to buy fruits and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Empresarios De Los Olivos Group

texts.es: Fany es socia del grupo “EMPRESARIOS DE LOS OLIVOS”  grupo que inicia su segundo ciclo.Fany de 28 años es separada y tiene una hija de 14 años, ella trabaja hace 5 años en un mercado de su zona allí vende pescados y mariscos, su negocio es uno de los más visitados por las amas de casa que diariamente acuden a comprarle sus productos, gracias a su trabajo puede darle a su hija una buena educación y calidad de vida. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos pesqueros, lo que más desea es comprar el puesto donde trabaja para no tener que pagar alquiler y así trabajar más estable y tranquila.Fany esta agradecida a los inversionistas KIVA por este préstamo que es de mucha ayuda para su grupo , en la foto es la ultima de la izquierda viste pantalon color rojo.
texts.en:
Fany is a member of the communal bank Empresarios de los Olivos, which is in its second loan cycle. Fany is 28 years old, separated, and has a daughter aged 14. Since five years back she works at a market in the area where she sells fish and seafood. Her business is one of the most visited, and housewives come there every day to buy her products. 

Thanks to her work she is able to give her daughter a good education and quality of life. She will use the loan to buy seafood. What she wishes for the most is to buy the stall where she works so that she won't have to pay rent and so that she can work under more stable and relaxed circumstances. 

Fany is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan which is of great help to her communal bank. She is the last person from the left, wearing red pants.

loans.use: to buy seafood

loans.name: Yaye Diama

texts.fr: Madame Yaye Diama est   une  femme  mariée  qui  vit  au  Sénégal   depuis  plusieurs  années .  Elle  s’active  dans  le  secteur  du  commerce  et pratique l’activité de vente  de  chaussures  depuis  3  ans.  Elle    est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de sa zone d’habitation ou ell sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de chaussures a revendre. Son intention est de développer d’avantage son activité de commerce et de renforcer les revenus qu’elle gagne. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices a travers le prêt qui lui est consenti lui permettra de diversifier les articles qu’elle commercialise et de démarrer la vente de sacs a main et de tissus. En plus son objectif est de renforcer le niveau de son épargne mais aussi de contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet dans le futur consiste a acquérir une cantine dans le marché ou  elle pourrait exposer ses marchandises.
texts.en: Madam Yaye Diama is a married woman who has been living in Sénégal for several years. She works in the commerce sector and has been selling shoes for 3 years. She is a member of the branch of the UIMCEC of the zone where she lives, with which she is requesting a loan of 300,000 frs for the purchase of shoes to resell. Her intention is to further develop her business and to strengthen the income that she makes. The growth of her profits through the loan that she is granted will allow her to diversify the items that she sells and to start selling handbags and fabric. In addition her objective is to strengthen the level of her savings and also to contribute to the improvement of the nutritional conditions of her family. Her future project consists in acquiring a cantine in the market where she would be able to display her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell.

loans.name: Cindy Juliet

texts.es: Cindy a sus 26 años de edad se dedica a trabajar en un negocio que inició hace aproximadamente 1 año, es un almacén donde vende ropa importada desde China, accesorios y otros artículos. Ella comenzó vendiendo los productos por medio de internet con las diferentes redes sociales y poco a poco fue adquiriendo clientela. Trabaja de Lunes a Domingo de 10:00 am a 6:00 pm y con esta actividad ha generado los recursos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. La cliente es una mujer activa, dinámica y tiene un espíritu emprendedor que la ha llevado a lograr los objetivos que se propone, actualmente desea iniciar un proyecto nuevo, pues desea incursionar con un café boutique, con la intensión de complementar sus ingresos; por esta razón solicita el crédito para comprar sillas y mesas y, adicionalmente realizar adecuaciones locativas, así podrá dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo con el que espera percibir mejores ingresos. Cindy sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y en un futuro poder abrir más sucursales, pero sabe que para lograrlo debe trabajar con mucho empeño, dedicación y disciplina, esto será clave para poder seguir progresando y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cindy at 26 years old works in a business that she started approximately a year ago, it's a store where she sells imported clothes from China, accessories and other articles.  She started to sell these products through the internet in different social media, and slowly made herself of clients.  She works from Monday to Sunday from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm  and with this activity she has generated sufficient resources to afford the basic needs of her family.  She is a very active woman, dynamic and has an entrepreneurial spirit that has take her to achieve the objectives she sets, she is currently wishing to start a new project, as she wishes to start a boutique coffee shop, with the intention to have additional income; for this reason she requests a loan to buy chairs, tables and make space adaptations, this way she will be able to start her new productive project with which she hopes to get better income.  Cindy dreams to make her business grow and in the future be able to have more locations, but knows that to achieve this she has to work with determination, dedication and discipline, this will be key to continue progressing and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and make space adaptations.

loans.name: Empresarios De Laura Caller Group

texts.es: El grupo “EMPRESARIOS DE LAURA CALLER”  es una alcancía nueva  conformada por 06 socios. Virginia de 50 años  es divorciada  tiene 03 hijos mayores de edad que viven con ella. Virginia se dedica al bordado de prendas de vestir básicamente borda prendas folklóricas y vestimentas típicas son 9 años que se dedica a este oficio, su trabajo es muy solicitado por artistas del medio quienes valoran y reconocen su trabajo. Virginia ha solicitado este crédito para invertir en su negocio con la compra de telas y  toda clase de materiales para bordar  así podrá seguir trabajando y ayudar a su familia con los ingresos. En el futuro le gustaría tener un taller mas grande y poder atender a mas clientes. Virginia agradece por este préstamo  a todos los inversionistas KIVA ya que es una gran ayuda para su grupo, en la foto esta con casaca color negra y botas color fucsia, la foto adjunta pertenece a Geancarlos.
texts.en:
The Empresarios de Laura Caller group is a new communal bank comprised of 6 members. Virginia, 50, is divorced and has 3 adult children who live with her. Virginia makes a living embroidering clothing. She primarily embroiders folkloric and traditional clothing. She has done this work for nine years. Her work is highly sought after by artists who value and recognize her work.

Virginia is requesting this loan to buy fabric and all sorts of supplies to embroider and keep working and helping her family with income. In the future, she'd like to have a larger workshop so she can attend to more customers. Virginia is grateful for this loan and all the Kiva lenders because it is a big help to the group.

In the photo, she is the one with the black jacket and fuchsia shoes. The attached photo is of Geancarlos.

loans.use: to buy embroidery supplies such as thread and fabric.

loans.name: Group 6 At Lien Mac 1

texts.en: Buoi, pictured first from the right, is 38 years old and has been working as a farmer for more than 18 years.  She currently earns around VND 700,000 a month.  She is married with two grown children.  Buoi has been a member of her local Women's Union since 1995 and recently joined a campaign to improve her community's sanitation and hygiene.  Currently, her family does not have a sanitary toilet at home, because they lack the adequate funds to install one.  With this loan, Buoi will be able to build a hygienic toilet that will improve the quality of life for her family and help them avoid the diseases and infections commonly associated with unsafe latrines.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Suega

texts.en:
Suega is 27 years old and married with three children.  She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cake in her community. 

To do this, she needs a loan to buy cordial flavors, plastic cups, Chinese lollies and sugar.  

In the future, Suega hopes to support her family financially.  She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cordial flavors, plastic cups, Chinese lollies and sugar.

loans.name: Gelser Francisco

texts.es: Gelser continua con la construccion de su casa pero se le ha hecho dificil por que su hija se ha enfermado un poco, su esposa lo apoya ya que ella comercializa productos de belleza y el labora para una empresa constructora de metal. con este credito comprara materiales cemento, arena, hierro, Piedrin para construir parte de la casa. el quiere que su familia tenga  las mejores condiciones para que vivan seguras y con toda las comodidades. agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gelser continues building his house but he has encountered difficulties since his child has been sick. His wife supports him selling beauty products and he works at a metal construction company. 

He will use the loan to buy materials such as cement, sand, iron, and gravel to build a part of the house. He wants his family to have better living conditions so that they can live safely and comfortably. He is grateful to Kiva and Afodenic for the help they have offered him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es: Marianella es  tesorera del grupo “LAS AMISTOSAS”  ella tiene 39 años es soltera y tiene un hijo de 14 años. Marianella trabaja como comerciante en un mercado de su localidad, allí tiene un puesto de abarrotes donde vende toda clase de menestras y productos de primera necesidad. Su trabajo le permite solventar los gastos de su hijo sobretodo su educación. Con el crédito solicitado podra mejorar su negocio con la adquisición de productos de abarrotes.En el futuro le gustaria tener su negocio mas surtido y poder abastecer a mas clientela. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por brindarle este préstamo que los ayudara en sus negocios. Marianella aparace en la foto con chompa color marron es la quinta de la izquierda.
texts.en:
Marianella is the “Las Amistosas” (Friendly Ones) group treasurer.  She’s 39-years-old and has a 14-year-old son.  Marianella works as a merchant in a local market where she has a stand where she sells all sorts of vegetables and basic staple goods.  Her work makes it possible for her to cover her son’s expenses, above all his schooling.

She will be able to improve her business with the requested loan purchasing grocery items.  In future, she’d like her business to be better-stocked and to be able to supply more customers.  

The group thanks Kiva lenders for providing this loan that will help in their businesses. Marianella appears in the photo wearing a brown sweater; she’s fifth on the left.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es: El grupo “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO” es una  alcancía nueva  que  está conformada por 07 socios, todos tienen sus negocios en diferentes zonas. Vionica de 30 años es una de las integrantes de la alcancía, ella tiene  02 hijas que son la razón por la cual trabaja cada día, ella se dedica al alquiler de vestidos y menaje para eventos; antes tenía una boutique con una amiga lamentablemente su negocio no dio resultados por ese motivo ella está empezando sola y le va muy bien. Con la finalidad de seguir mejorando su negocio este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de nuevos modelos de vestidos, más adelante le gustaría reabrir su boutique para que sus hijas continúen con el negocio. Vionica agradece a los inversionistas por su préstamo y el de su alcancía. En la foto es la que viste casaca color morada y pantalon jean celeste.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Rosario” group is a new communal bank consisting of 7 members each with a business of her own in various zones.  Vionica, 30, is one of the communal bank members.  She has two daughters who are the reason why she works every day.  She works renting dresses and event supplies.  She and a friend used to have a boutique but unfortunately the business didn’t yield good results so she started this one alone and is doing very well.

Aiming at continuing to improve her business the loan will allow her to buy new styles of dresses.  Later on she’d like to reopen her boutique so that her daughters can continue with the business.  

Vionica thanks lenders for her and her communal bank’s loans.  In the photo, she’s wearing a purple jacket and sky-blue jeans.

loans.use: to buy dresses.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman with one underage child. She lives in her own house that has no piped water but has electricity. 

Everlyne has operated a beauty salon business for the past five months.  Her potential customers are women. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Andado Ligguey 2A Group

texts.fr: Madame ABY est la présidente du Groupement, c'est une dame de 49 ans, qui s’active dans le commerce depuis 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle achète et vend des produits divers : de l’huile de palme, des tissus teintés. Malgré son âge, elle fait aussi la navette entre le Sénégal et la Mauritanie pour chercher des produits comme les tissus teintés qu'elle revende. C'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle n’a pas de charges qui l’encombrent mais donne sa participation dans la gestion des besoins familiaux. Et travaille pour de meilleures conditions de vie de son foyer. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h.
texts.en: Madam Aby is the president of the group. She is a 49 year old woman who has been in commerce for 10 years. She is married and a mother. She buys and sells a variety of items: palm oil, dyed fabric. Despite her age, she also commutes between Sénégal and Mauritania to look for products such as dyed fabric which she resells. It's her who has raised her hand in the photo. She has no responsibilities that hamper her and she contributes to the management of the family's needs and works for better living conditions in her home. She starts her day at 8am and finishes at 6pm.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as palm oil and dyed fabric to then resell them.

loans.name: Al-Anwar Group

texts.en:
Al-Anwar Group consists of three women who live in Aden, Yemen.  Ashar, 33, lives with her children in a poor area of town. 

For two years, she has been selling perfumes, incense and clothes.  To help her continue her work, she and her group have applied for a loan of YER 150,000. 

Ashar will use her portion to buy more perfumes, incense, cloth and other materials.  She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business which, in turn, will allow her to get her own shop.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, incense, cloth and other materials.

loans.name: Refaa

texts.en:
Refaa, born in 1968, is married and a mother of four.  Her husband is a driver.  

Refaa has been selling blankets for one year.  She started her project with a small quantity of blankets, and she found it to be a profitable project. 

Now she is planning to expand the quantity of blankets that she sells in order to raise her income and to support her family. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. 

For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell.

loans.name: Moila

texts.en:
"Moila  is 39 years old and married with nine children. 

She has a small garden where she grows tomatoes, peas, cabbage, cucumber,  etc.  Moila sell her produce in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Moila needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, rake, garden hose, wheelbarrow, fertilizer, garden fork and gloves. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.  Moila plans to use the profits from her sales for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, rake, garden hose, wheelbarrow, fertilizer, garden fork and gloves.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Amadou est un homme qui habite dans un quartier de la commune ou se situe le Guichet. Il est marié et père de famille qui évolue dans le transport. Amadou a une expérience de plus de 2ans dans cet activité. Amadou a besoin de ce crédit d'un montant de 300.000F pour acheter un moteur de sa voiture et remplacé celui qui en panne. Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour revenir à son domicile le soir après minuit. Il gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. A l'avenir Amadou souhaite augmenter ses revenus avec l'aide des crédits pour accroitre son parc automobile et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en: Mister Amadou is a man who lives in a neighborhood of the commune where the branch is located. He is married and a father who is developing his transportation business. Amadou has more than 2 years experience in this business. Amadou needs this 300,000 F loan to buy a motor for his car and replace the one that is out of order. He starts his day at 6am in the morning and comes back to his home at night after midnight. He manages his family's daily expenses and his children's school fees. In the future Amadou hopes to increase his revenue with the help of loans to grow his car fleet and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
This is Natividad. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase more grocery items and products needed in her business.  Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result for better profits.  Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Natividad hopes that her business will continue to expand and flourish.  She dreams for an abundant life for her family.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.
--------------------------------

CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is 36 years old and takes care of her brother's two children. She operates a fruits and vegetables business, which she has been running for the last twenty years. She learned about KADET from some other women in the market who are funded by KADET, Ltd. Consolata earns a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Consolata was advanced her fourth loan of KES 15,000. She will use the funds to get more vegetables and fruits for the business. The proceeds will be used to cater for the family's basic needs.

Her dream is to own a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Andado Ligguey 2B Group

texts.fr: Madame MBOULE est une femme qui habite aux environs du Guichet. Elle est la présidente du groupement des femmes ANDADO LIGGUEY 2B. C'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans le commerce depuis plus de 10ans. MBOULE est mariée et mère de famille, elle a besoin de ce crédit pour aller au marché hebdomadaire de Diaobé pour y acheter des balaies et d'autres produits divers pour ensuite venir les revendre dans le marché. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. A l'avenir elle souhaite avoir ses propres fonds pour ne plus prendre de prêts dans les mutuelles et augmenter ses revenus afin d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Madam Mboule is a woman who lives in the neighborhood of the branch. She is the president of the group of women Andado Ligguey 2B. She is the one who has raised her hand in the photo. She has been evolving in commerce for more than 10 years. Mboule is married and a mother. She needs this loan to go to the weekly market in Diaobé to buy brooms and a variety of other products there to then come resell them at the market. She helps her husband with the management of the daily expenses and her children's school fees. In the future she hopes to have her own funds in order not to take loans from mutual insurance companies anymore in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy brooms and resell them.

loans.name: Phidiliah

texts.en:
Phidiliah sells clothing.

She appreciates a previous loan that improved her living standards.  It enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Phidiliah would like to apply for a new loan of ksh.30,000 to buy more bales of clothes for resale. 

She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera, born in 1961, is divorced and a mother of three.  One of her sons works in a governmental entity.  

Sameera has been trying her best to support herself and her children by working at her mini market in her house.  She has been selling drinks, chips and biscuits in addition to cosmetic products and has done so for the past year.  

Now she is planning to expand her mini market and sales by buying a larger quantity of products in order to raise her income and to be a good financial supporter of her children.  But she doesn't have enough money to do so. 

For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks, chips and biscuits and cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Shalom

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Shalom travaille dans son salon de coiffure sis dans le quartier d'Agoè.
Son fonds de roulement est si faible qu’elle s’approvisionne plusieurs fois en semaine au grand marché de Lomé pour satisfaire ses clientes.
Ce micro crédit lui sera utile pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires par l’achat d’une douzaine de mèches et de 02 douzaines de tissage.
texts.en:
Shalom is married and has one child. She runs a hair salon in the neighborhood Agoè.

Her working capital is so small that she has to buy supplies from the Grand Marché in Lomé several times a week in order to satisfy her customers.

This micro-loan will help Shalom increase her business revenue by buying a dozen sets of hair extensions and two dozen weaves.

loans.use: to buy a dozen sets of hair extensions and two dozen weaves.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela is a 53 year old woman who is single with 12 children.  

She runs a business selling goods and groceries in her community.  She has four years of experience with this business.  Sela has requested a loan to buy sacks of sugar, rice, flour, Devondale milk,noodles, Protex soap, bag of onions, salt and cigarettes. 

She plans to use her profits to extend her house. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sifea

texts.en:
Sifea is a 38-year-old married woman with four children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Sifea has requested a loan to buy chemicals, backpack sprayer, file, bush-knife, ropes and barb wire.
 
She recently joined SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Sifea hopes to help her family's everyday need.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, backpack sprayer, file, bush-knife, ropes and barb wire for her plantation.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: Gilda, de 49 años de edad. Está casada con Lucio quien es docente y tiene 3 hijos de 26, 23 y 21 años de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia. Gilda se dedica a la venta de comidas, como menús y platos extras, contando con un pequeño local que logró ambientar en su propia casa, en donde puso mesas y sillas para atender cómodamente a sus clientes. También realiza la costura de ropas interiores por las tardes, logrando ganarse muchos  clientes por su buena atención. Se inició  hace más de 6 años, tiempo que viene funcionando su negocio y viene atendiendo con el apoyo de una ayudante que le ayuda  y a la que paga por mes. Sigue trabajando deseosa de progresar. Por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar sus ambientes y variar sus comidas. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevo soles comprará ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, como arroz, aceites, menestras y demás productos.
texts.en:
Gilda is 49 years old and married to Lucio, who is a teacher. She has three children aged 26, 23 and 21 with whom she lives in the house she owns. Gilda sells food in the form of menus and extra dishes, in a part of her house that she has furnished with tables and chairs so that she can comfortably serve her clients. She also sews underwear in the evenings, and has achieved many clients due to her good service. 

She started her business more than six years ago, and she serves her business with the help of an assistant whom she pays monthly. She continues working, eager to progress. Therefore she has plans to make her business grow, improve the room and vary her dishes. This is her fourth loan with Kiva, she is happy and grateful for the opportunity to get a loan so that she can advance her business. She pledges to make her repayments on time. She will use the requested 1,500 PEN to buy ingredients for the food preparation such as rice, oil, stews, and other products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oil, stews etc

loans.name: Vehanush

texts.en:
Vehanush is a private entrepreneur from the village Akhurik in the Shirak region. She runs a small local store where she sells different grocery products and household goods. Vehanush is very experienced in running her small business and she has already gained a reputation as a hardworking and successful entrepreneur. Her small business now needs some investments to be competitive and to continue functioning properly. 

Vehanush is requesting a 2,200 USD loan to enlarge the assortment of goods she sells in the store, particularly to purchase more grocery products and household goods to sell. She is very thankful to all the lenders for supporting her to maintain and develop her small business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products and household goods to sell

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 56 years old married and supports a family of three.  She operates a dairy farming business.  Her spouse helps in fending for the family too.  

This has been Philomena's income generating business for the last six years.  She earns an average monthly income of Kshs 40,000.

Philomena plans to use the loan of Ksh.73,000 to purchase animal feed.  

Her dream is to educate her kids and to set up a zero grazing unit as well as a bio-gas unit.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Nouh

texts.en:
Nouh was born in 1991. He lives with his parents and 12 siblings in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. 

Nouh has been selling drinks and snacks at a booth near his house for three months. He started this project by selling his products from his house, then he moved to that booth to attract more customers. 

Now he needs to buy the needed products that he usually sells; a coffee machine, a refrigerator where he can keep the cold drinks, in addition to the products that his customers requested, such as various foodstuffs, in order to expand his sales and income and be the man who supports his family. 

But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a coffee machine, a refrigerator where he can keep the cold drinks, and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah was born in 1964.  She is married and a mother of seven children.  Her husband is a teacher.  Sabah has been selling mobile credit cards for one year.  

She wants to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of mobile credit cards, in order to raise her sales and income in order to be a good financial support of her family.  But unfortunately she doesn't have enough money to do so. 

For this reason, Sabah applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy mobile credit cards.

loans.name: Martun

texts.en:
Martun is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his wife (in the photo) and three children (in the photo). 

Martun and his wife have been involved in the retail business for four years already. Martun sells fruits and vegetables and his wife sells clothing and other accessories from their home. Both Martun and his wife are very honest and hardworking, and this is a reason why they have many local customers who prefer to purchase goods only from them.

Now, for enlarging the stock that Martun and his wife are selling, Martun needs financial support. He has requested this loan for purchasing clothing and watermelon. Martun plans to take watermelon to market and resell it there. Martun has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, the support of lenders is very important for this family to be able to increase their retail business and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell to customers and to buy watermelon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Habib's Group

texts.en:
Habib is a member of this group from Iraq.  He is 45 years old, married with seven children.  He has been selling bananas for eight years. 

Habib is a hard worker.  Every day he starts his day at five in the morning and keep working until he sells all of his bananas.  Habib wants to buy more bananas and also fix his old transport motorcycle.

Habib expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to rent a place where he can store and sell his bananas. 

The story of Habib and his business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona's economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and fix his old transport motorcycle.

loans.name: Belal

texts.en:
Belal is 28 years old, married man and has three children who live in Taiz, Yemen.  He is cheerful and a hardworking man. 

He works in a company but earns a low salary.  Every day, he gets up with his characteristic optimism and cheerfulness in order to work.  

Due to his limited resources, Belal is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to make prepared houses. 

With this loan he will be able to offer a greater variety of houses and rentals for his customers.  He will continue to work hard every day so he can become famous for his work.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to make prepared houses.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is managing her own farm of banana to make a living. Her husband is a farmer, and her two adult children are having their own family. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and recently, she borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, in order to improve her farm and gain an abundant harvest from her banana farm. 

She want to expand her farm by cultivating the adjacent vacant lot. She plans to sell her farm produce in bulk for a higher price. In the future, she wants to improve her business for a better living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, to improve her banana farm and gain abundant harvest.

loans.name: Pulemau

texts.en:
Pulemau is a 36 woman who is married with five children. 

She has had a small fishing business for five years.  Pulemau needs a loan to buy a fishing net, rope, fishing spear, goggles and life jacket. 

Pulemau will use her profits to to help her family financially.  Pulemau joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora a su mayoría de edad piensa continuar trabajando en lo que sus padres le han enseñado, en la agricultura, tiene una manzana de cultivo de Piña los cuales requieren de mantenimiento y abonarla con Fertilizantes, Urea, Triple 20, Completo. Con esto su cosecha podrá crecer en buen estado sin temor a que se queme o que la plaga pueda apoderarse de ella. Doña María Auxiliadora agradece profundamente el apoyo que se le ha brindado estos últimos años ya que con estos Financiamiento su economía ha mejorado grandemente.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora intends to continue working at what her parents taught her, agriculture, despite her advancing age.  She has a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of pineapple that needs care and to be fertilized with Urea, Triple 20 and Completo.  With this, her crop will be able to grow in good condition with no fear of it being scorched or that pests can take it over.   María Auxiliadora is profoundly grateful for the support she’s gotten these last few years because the loans have helped her economy to improve considerably.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Logo

texts.en:
Logo is 40 years old and married with three children.  She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and cucumbers and she sell her produce in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Logo needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, pick, shovel, garden fork, garden hose and rake.  Logo will use the profits to support her family.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy seeds and garden tools.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and resides at Villalin, Panaon, in Misamis Occidental along with her family. 

To  make a living, she and her husband grow and harvest vegetables for sale.  She sells her produce in the market and her husband is a part time driver. 

She seeks a loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy fertilizer to improve her farm.  She hopes to gain more profit in return for her investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah (her son is shown in photo) was born in 1970.  She is married and the mother of four children.  One of her sons works as a rescue officer. 

Sabah has been raising bees and selling honey for one year.  She found her project tom be profitable. So, she is planning to expand by buying more beehives in order to raise her productivity and sales.  This will help her support her children. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. 

For this reason, Sabah applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more beehives.

loans.name: Jose Orbelio

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres, con quienes comparte las tareas agrícolas. Debido a las difíciles condiciones de vida de su familia en aquella época, no pudo terminar sus estudios de educación media y estudio solo primer año de bachillerato.

Desde hace 20 años trabaja en la agricultura, su padre le enseño a trabajar desde muy pequeño, cuando ya pudo trabajar solo, rento un terreno para trabajar aparte. Es presidente de la directiva de su comunidad, también tiene conocimientos de fontanería. Para llegar al lugar de siembra camina aproximadamente 600 mts. Todos los días le dedica 6 horas a su cultivo.

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de insumos agrícolas, Fertilizante, herbicidas, pesticidas y pagar mano de obra para preparar el terreno de siembra.

Tiene pensado seguir trabajando en la siembra de frijol, y administrar un invernadero que será donado a la comunidad y hará lo posible por mantener dichas instalaciones.
texts.en:
José, 40, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents who share the agricultural tasks with him.  Due to his family’s life conditions in the past he wasn’t able to complete his secondary education; he only attended one year of high-school.

He’s worked in agriculture for 20 years.  His father taught him to work when he was still very young and when he was able to work alone leased land to work apart.  He’s president of his community’s governing board and also has plumbing skills.  To get to his fields, he must walk about 600 meters.  He spends about 6 hours  daily working his crops.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, herbicide and pesticides and to pay labor costs to prepare the soil for planting.  He intends to continue working growing beans and managing a nursery that will be donated to his community.  He will do everything possible to maintain said installations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Yadira Isabel

texts.es: Yadira es una mujer de 44 años de edad que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició de manera empírica. Inicialmente tenía un kiosco ubicado dentro de un colegio del sector donde reside, allí aprendió gran parte de lo que hoy sabe sobre el manejo de este tipo de establecimientos. La cliente es una señora emprendedora, activa y pujante, dedicada a su labor, pues se ha convertido en la columna vertebral de la economía de su familia, conformada por sus dos hijos y su compañero sentimental con quien convive en unión libre. Solicita el crédito con el ánimo de comprar una vitrina para exhibir los productos y surtido al por mayor (galletería, mecato, productos de aseo, café, confitería, entre otros), así tendrá más variedad de artículos disponibles para satisfacer las necesidades de sus compradores, dándole la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe por ellas. Yadira sueña con hacer de su negocio una actividad rentable, que le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su hijo mayor la oportunidad de tener una educación universitaria y continuar velando por el bienestar de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Yadira, 44 years old, runs her own business, a grocery store that she started as an experiment. At first, she had a kiosk located inside a high school in the neighborhood where she lives. There she learned a great deal of what she knows today about running this kind of establishment. This client, Yadira, is a hard-working, active, and thriving, dedicated to her work. She has become the central core of her family's economy, a family that consists of her two children and her common-law partner.

She is requesting this loan in hopes of buying a glass case to exhibit her goods and her wholesale stock, including cookies, pastries, cleaning supplies, coffee, candy, and more. That way, she will have a greater variety of merchandise available to meet the needs of her buyers, giving her the chance to increase her sales and her income from them.

Yadira dreams of making her business a profitable venture, one that provides her and her family with economic stability and the opportunity to send her oldest son to university and the ability to keep flying high for the well-being of her entire family.

loans.use: Purchase a glass case to showcase her goods and wholesale stock.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
This is Genalyn, 28, resident of Batasan, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Ariel, a mason, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide her income for their everyday expenses.

Genalyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also has a piggery for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Genalyn dreams that her business will get bigger, and hopes that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sunite

texts.en:
Sunite is a 25-year-old who lives with her partner and four children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taros, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. Sunite has requested a loan to buy chemicals, wheelbarrow, barb wire, backpack sprayer and pickaxe.
 
She recently joined SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Sunite hopes to help improve her family standard of living and their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, wheelbarrow, barb wire, backpack sprayer and a pickaxe.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 26 year old married woman with four children.  She runs a small business selling pancakes and has been in operation for two years. 

Victoria has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, dripping oil, baking soda and large frying pan. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital.  With her earnings, Victoria will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pancake supplies.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 52 year old married with 11 children.  She runs a sewing shop in her community and has many years of experience. 

Nora has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, more material, thread and oil. 

She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family financially.  She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, material, thread and oil.

loans.name: Muterian

texts.en:
Muterian is 48 years old and married.  He supports a family of five children.  He is a wheat farmer and he rears livestock.   Muterian has been in business for 23 years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 12000. 

He is seeking his sixth loan of KES 100000 from KADET to help prepare his farm and purchase needed inputs. Some of the funds will be used to cater to his livestock.

Muterian hopes to use his anticipated profits to expand his farm and to reinvest.  His future dreams are to improve his family's standard of living and to educate his children

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and livestock supplies.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña María del Carmen es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada la cual goza de una excelente salud con mucha energía y mucho entusiasmo al momento de ejercer su trabajo. Ella trabaja en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos de los cuales el mayor está casado en hogar a parte y colabora con algunas de las actividades del campo y el menor el cual vive con ellos y al igual que el mayor ayuda a sus padres diariamente con las actividades en la plantación de café, como: aplicación de abono, foliares, formula cafetalera, limpieza, etc. Los 3 viven en la misma casa y doña María del Carmen tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad en compañía de su esposo. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 4 kilómetros de distancia al cual se traslada a pie o en vestía. Sus sueños como madre de familia es poder educar a su hijo para que él pueda vivir en mejores condiciones, tengan más oportunidades en la vida.

Doña María del Carmen solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para  la compra de 4 QQ de urea, 18 sacos de abono 18-46-0, 5 litros de foliares, 6 litros de boro, entre otros para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y obtener una mejor producción y una mejor ganancia de la venta misma.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is 38 years old and married. She enjoys excellent health, plenty of energy, and a great deal of enthusiasm for her work. She works alongside her husband and their two children. The older son is married and lives in a separate home, but works with them on various activities in the field. The younger lives at home, and like the older, he helps his parents daily with the work on the coffee plantation, including the application of fertilizers, herbicide, and plant food formulated specifically for coffee, as well as cleaning.  María del Carmen has more than fifteen years of experience focusing in this activity alongside her husband. Their coffee fields are located four kilometers from their home, a distance which they walk. Her dream as a mother is to be able to educate her son so that he can live in better conditions and have more opportunities in life.

María is requesting this financing through the COMIXMUL cooperative to purchase 4 quintales of urea (approximately 100 lbs each), 18 sacks of fertilizer, 5 liters of herbicide, 6 liters of boron, and other supplies needed to aid her coffee growing and obtain a better production and subsequently higher earnings.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies for growing coffee

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is a 50 year old married woman with eight children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taros, bananas and yams to earn a living.  Malia has been doing this work for more than six years. 

Malia has requested a loan to buy a wide variety of garden tools and supplies.  

Malia recently joined SPBD in 2013.  With her profits, she hopes to improve her family's standard of living and meet their everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of garden tools and supplies.

loans.name: Group 11 At Lien Mac 1

texts.en: Luyen, pictured first on the right, is 52 years old and married with two grown children.  As a farmer, she makes about VND 800,000 a month.  She has been a member of her local Women's Union since 1980 and recently joined a campaign to improve her community's sanitation and hygiene.  Currently, her family does not have a hygienic toilet.  With this loan, Luyen will install a toilet that will improve the quality of life for all of her family members and help her family and community avoid the diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary latrines.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 40 years old married to Richard.  Together they support a family of five.  

Phoebe runs a cereals and grocery business in Kericho town.  This has been her income generating business for the last two years; she earns an average monthly income of Kshs 40,000. 

She seeks a second loan with Kadet Ltd of Kshs 60,000.  With this loan she plans to purchase more cereal for resale, to boost her business. 

Phoebe's dream is to expand her business into a big cereal store and to expand her grocery business.

loans.use: to purchase more cereal.

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn, 25, is a creative woman. She is married with two children, ages two and five. 

She sells prepaid loaded phones to her customers in the community of San Miguel, where she lives with her family. 

Annelyn is asking for a loan to buy more prepaid loads in order to generate a bigger income. She is hoping that someday she will be able to have another business to better support her family, specially her children.

Income generated from her business is used for nutritious food for her children.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid loads

loans.name: Group 10 At Lien Mac 1

texts.en: Oanh, pictured first on the right, is 51 years old this year.  She works as a farmer with a monthly salary of about VND 700,000.  She is married with one child, who is now an adult.  Her family does not yet have a sanitary toilet at home.  However, she recently joined a campaign through her local Women's Union, where she has been a member since 1983, to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene.  With this loan, Oanh will build a sanitary toilet that will improve her family and community's quality of life and help them stay healthy by avoiding the diseases and infections commonly associated with using an unsafe latrine.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has three children and has been doing this work for twenty years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling milk!" His biggest challenge is ''feeding animals in drought season." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Kitanga and Nyameni; both are cows."

Godfrey was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "They have brought their services to us."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "One can develop from the microloans."  His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how will this loan benefit his family, Godfrey replied "Will see my children through college."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Godfrey owns the following: "cow, poultry, bicycle" but does not own "pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower does not have "mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 34 years old divorced, with two children ages 13 and three years.

She has a pool table business in Naivasha which she has been running for two years.   Evalyn has applied for her first loan from Kadet ltd. to enable her repair her pool table.  Evalyn plans to pay school fees with her anticipated profit. 

In the near future, Evalyn hopes to see her children well educated.

loans.use: to repair a pool table.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 23 years old and supports his one sibling and his aging parents.  He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for three years and he earning kes 16,000 per month. He learned about Kadet from other riders in Narok town who have already been funded by Kadet ltd.

Antony has been advanced a first loan of kes 91,019 which will enable him to purchase his own motorcycle. This is likely to help him earn more income as he already has an established customer base. 

He will use the proceeds to repay the loan and cater to the needs of his family.  Antony's dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Taaloga

texts.en:
Taaloga is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. Taaloga has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a weed sprayer, barbed wire, a shovel and boots. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Taaloga hopes to help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a weed sprayer, barbed wire, a shovel and boots

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es: Jairo se ha dedicado durante 20 años a trabajar en su negocio, una tienda y legumbrería, actividad que conoció gracias a su familia, ya que es una tradición pues todos se han dedicado a ser comerciantes independientes. Trabaja todos los días de 6:00 am a 10:00 pm, en compañía de su esposa y uno de sus hijos, de esta forma ha generado los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos y necesidades familiares. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, lácteos, granos, panela, pastas, entre otros) de esta manera incrementará su inventario y tendrá mayor variedad de productos disponible para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus compradores, lo que dará como resultado un incremento en los ingresos que percibe para su familia. Jairo desea fortalecer y acreditar aún más sus negocio, para que le genere una estabilidad económica que le permita dejar la tienda como legado para que sus hijos puedan continuar con el negocio y lo conviertan en una supermercado, rentable y reconocido y así, se forjen un futuro de progreso y éxito.
texts.en:
Jairo has been running his grocery and vegetables store for 20 years. He was introduced to this activity by his family, it is a tradition among them since everybody in his family have worked as independent merchants. He works every day from 6 am to 10 pm together with his wife and one of their children. That way he has generated the necessary incomes to pay for the expenses and needs of his family. 

He is applying for a loan in order to buy wholesale supplies such as snacks, soft drinks, dairy products, grains, unrefined whole cane sugar, noodles, etc. This way he will be able to increase his inventory and have a greater variety of products available so that he can satisfy the needs and tastes of his buyers. This will give him economic stability and allow him to pass the store on to his children so that they can continue the business and turn it into a profitable and acknowledged supermarket, which will bring them a future of progress and success.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies such as snacks, soft drinks, dairy products, grains, unrefined whole cane sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fish net, gasoline and floaters

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en:
Aqil is a 22 year old farmer who is single.  He grows and sells fruits and vegetables.  He was not fortunate to finish school or go to university and had to work on his farm to support his family. 

Aqil has a brother who's name is Haider.  He is in his last year of high school.  Since his work is seasonal he always worries about not making enough money and saving some money to help cover his brother’s school expenses. 

Every year Aqil face the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the school year, for the additional expenses that occur to cover school fees, uniform and  books.  With this loan he can cover all these expenses.

Aquil is requesting a loan to pay his brother's tuition fees and other school expenses.  Haider plan to continue his university education after finishing high school.

The story of Haider is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona's economic development clients who was able to obtain a better education.

loans.use: to pay his brother's tuition fees and other school expenses.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a married mother of three children who has worked as a butcher for twenty years. They serve high quality meat at special prices. Hoda’s long experience in this field provided her with customers' trust and support even though it is weird in her region for a woman to work as a butcher, which is always given the image of a man’s business. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business income through buying cows and increasing their meat capital to better respond to the increasing customers’ requests.

As for the future, Hoda is willing to increase the number of cows she owns to open her own farm and to expand her business and increase productivity.

loans.use: to increase her business income through buying cows and increasing their meat capital to better respond to the increasing customers’ requests

loans.name: Eseneiaso

texts.en:
Eseneiaso is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Eseneiaso needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, boxes of chicken, soy sauce, garlic, onions, a container and a pot. She plans to use her profits to assist her family financially. 

Eseneiaso became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, boxes of chicken, soy sauce, garlic, onions, a container and a pot.

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De Smp Group

texts.es: Elsa es miembro de la alcancía “SIEMPRE UNIDAS DE SMP” este grupo lo integran 8 socias todas son amigas y vecinas del mismo barrio. Elsa es divorciada tiene 03 hijos la ultima de 10 años es la más pequeña y depende de ella, desde hace 5 años  se dedica a la venta de menestras tiene un puesto alquilado en un mercado de su zona, su negocio esta prosperando gracias a sus clientas que siempre acuden  a comprarle los productos que vende, trabaja 8 horas diarias por la mañana en las tardes se dedica a sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de menestras al por mayor esto le permitirá tener mejores ganancias y seguir creciendo como comerciante. Elsa esta agradecida  a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo de su grupo, en la foto es la cuarta de la izquierda(paradas) viste chompa blanca.
texts.en: Elsa is a member of the group "Siempre Unidas de SMP" this group is formed by 8 members that are friends and neighbors of the same district.  Elsa is divorced, has a 3 children, the youngest one is 10 years old and depends on her, for 5 years she has been selling "menestras" (vegetable stew) in a stand that she rents at a market of her area, her business is successful thanks to her customers that always come to buy the products that she sells, she works 8 hours a day in the morning and in the evening she is with her children.  The loan will be invested in buying "menestras" at wholesale, this will allow her to make better profits and be able to continue growing as a merchant.  Elsa is thankful to the KIVA investors for the loan to her group, in the picture she is the 4th from the left (standing) she is wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy vegetables
