Ahora necesita el crédito para realizar unos arreglos en su casa.
texts.en:
The client is from the Guasmo area of Guayaquil.  He learned his trade at a young age and one day decided to work as a vendor. From that time, he started to work selling encebollado (fish stew made with vegetables). He is responsible for preparing it, so that he can later sell it at his street stand. 

He is married and his wife helps him with the household expenses, as she also works. He has children, but all are adults now. In the future he wishes to have his own shop, so that he can set up an eatery, and with his income finish building his house. Now he needs money to carry out repairs to his home.

loans.use: To pay for home repairs.

loans.name: César Ramiro

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó tiempo atrás trabajando con su papá y con el tiempo decidió independizarse.  Trabaja todos los días desde temprano, inclusive los fines de semana.  Es casado y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene 3 hijos, de 13, 11 años, quienes van al colegio y escuela fiscal de su barrio, y también uno pequeño, de 2 años.  A futuro, le gustaría arreglar su casa y levantar otro piso para que sus hijos tengan cuartos independientes.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de forros de colchón, controles y sábanas.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Portoviejo.  He started out some time ago working with his father, but eventually he decided to become independent.  The borrower works every day, including the weekends, and begins in the early morning hours.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have three children (ages 13, 11, and 2).  The two older children attend schools in their neighborhood.  

In the future, the borrower would like to remodel his house and add another floor so that his children can have rooms of their own.  For now he needs a loan so that he can buy mattress covers, remote controls, and bed sheets.

loans.use: to buy mattress covers, remote controls, and bed sheets.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is expected to give birth to a boy very soon, within days. She has two children and is 29 years old. They all live in a village where, according to VisionFund Albania’s poverty measurement tools, the majority of people fall way under the poverty line. 

“Just like so many other people who live in rural areas and practice their skills in agricultural/livestock, I do the same. There was nothing else that I could do. Besides that I’ve got no education but even if I did, the unemployment rate in Albania is high. So, I am content with what I have been pursuing so far; selling raw milk to the village dairy farm and also I sell potatoes, red onions and dried beans to wholesale buyers.” said Lindita.

Lindita is requesting a loan to build a storage room where she can store and dry the onions, potatoes and beans.

loans.use: to build a storage room to store and dry her produce.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Guasmo en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás con la venta por catlálogo con unas amigas, luego arregló un cuarto donde puso una copiadora, recargas electrónicas y sus productos de catálogo.  Es madre soltera pero mantiene una buena relación con el papa de sus hijas, ya que le ayuda con los gastos.  Tiene 3 hijas que estudian en colegio y escuela fiscal.  A futuro desea seguir trabajando duro e instalar un cyber.  Ahora necesita el crédito para comprar una copiadora más grande.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the sector of Guasmo in Guayaquil.  A long time ago, she sold catalog products with some of her friends.  She later remodeled a room and installed a copying machine, but she also sells electronic phone credits and catalog products.  The borrower is a single mother who maintains a good relationship with the father of her daughters since he helps with the expenses.  Her three daughters attend state schools.  In the future, she wants to keep working hard and open a cybercafé.  

For now, the borrower needs a loan in order to buy a larger copying machine.

loans.use: to buy a copying machine.

loans.name: Gene Agustin

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Tiene 20 años con este negocio de taller de madera, ya que su padre le enseñó desde muy pequeño y le gustó ya que ha resultado ser muy productivo.  Trabaja de lunes a viernes, desde temprano en la mañana.  No es casado y no tiene hijos por el momento.  A futuro le gustaría tener un almacén donde pueda exhibir sus artesanías en madera.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de madera, diluyente, pintura y herramientas.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Portoviejo.  He has had his woodworking shop for 20 years, as his father taught him from a young age.  He liked it and it has turned out to be very productive. 

He works from Monday to Friday from early in the morning. He is not married and has no children for the moment.  In the future he would like to have warehouse where he can display his wood crafts. For now he needs a loan to buy wood, paint thinner, paint and tools.

loans.use: To buy materials for his business.

loans.name: Lucrecia Concepción

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó trabajando en un taller y decidió salir de ese trabajo por sus hijos, ya que necesitaban más cuidado.  Es ahí cuando monta el taller en su casa.  Trabaja sola, todos los días.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer para una empresa.  Tiene 3 hijos, de 15, 13 y 6 años, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal de su barrio.  A futuro, desea que su taller sea muy conocido y poder mejorar sus casa también.  Por ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Portoviejo.  She began working at another shop and decided to leave that job because her children needed more attention.  That is when she decided to establish a workshop in her house.  The borrower works alone every day.  She is married and her husband works as a chauffeur for a company.  They have three children (ages 15, 13, and 6) who attend a state school in their neighborhood.  

In the future, she wants her workshop to become well-known and to make improvements to her house.  For now, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, and to pay for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy materials and to pay for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: José Marcelino

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó trabajando en un amigo y luego decidió trabajar solo y tener su propio negocio.  Trabaja de solo, de lunes a sábado.  Es casado y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene 3 hijos, de 15, 11 y 5 años, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  A futuro, desea poner un local en su casa para que lo atienda su esposa y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.  Ahora, necesita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales, carcasas y controles.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Portoviejo.  He began working with a friend and later decided to work alone and start his own business.  The borrower works by himself Monday through Saturday.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have three children (ages 15, 11, and 5) who attend a state school in the area.  In the future, he wants to set up a shop in his house that his wife can manage while their children finish their studies and go on to become professionals.  

For now he needs a loan so that he can buy natural products, phone cases, and remote controls.

loans.use: to buy natural products, phone cases, and remote controls.

loans.name: Nursultan

texts.en:
Nursultan graduated from secondary school this year and is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

"Studying at school, we gain knowledge and skills for future development. But there is a day when we finish school and stand at a crossroads, where every road is a path on which we will go into the future. It is known that everyone has their own aptitudes and wishes. Based on these, we choose our path. 

In the future, I want to be a specialist who can speak the language of business and administration. I am sure that education, training, and the ability to work, which I received at the Lyceum, can go on by learning the program of Business Administration at the American University of Central Asia.
 
The choice of this career, first of all, associates with a rapidly developing system and market relations in the daily life of our country and the world.
Whereas before, during the Soviet system, everything was decided by the state authorities in the form of state plans and five-year plans. Nowadays we are living in times of market economy and all ways are open for business. If you have the necessary knowledge, you can open your own business and develop it, or realize yourself in a variety of business firms, cooperation and government organizations.

In this regard, I chose a path – studying the laws of business and administration. For this, first of all, I consider it is necessary to get a quality education, and I’m sure at AUCA I can get it because in our country, only there that appropriate education is given. After learning that the business administration program at AUCA is the leading business program in our region, I definitely stopped my choice on it. In addition, the fact that many of AUCA graduates continue their education at the universities of the United States, Europe, and other major countries also affected me.

The school where I studied, I was tough to work, having explained to me a simple postulate, which states that the work is the result of my own efforts and leads to quality education. In 10th grade, I began to participate in the Olympiad on mathematics. But then I was advised by my teacher to take history. I won it twice and then I took second place in Republican Olympiad.
 
In the future, I would like to become a professional who is able to manage large business projects where new, innovative, and creative ideas and programs will be generated and implemented. 

Unfortunately, my parents cannot afford paying the tuition fees fully. But AUCA gives a very good opportunity to its students. All the students of AUCA have an opportunity to get Kiva loans to cover the tuition fees. So, I am applying for a Kiva loan, which will help cover the fees."

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Zholdoshbek

texts.en:
Zholdoshbek is a student at the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration. Below is his story:

“My name is Zholdoshbek. I graduated from Bishkek Kyrgyz-Turkish high school this year. Since seventh grade, I have excellent marks in all subjects and over the past five years my GPA at school was 5.0 and I am a holder of Diploma with Honors. In ninth and tenth grades I was a president of my class and made big changes in our extracurricular activities, one of which was gathering smart students together. The group was responsible for students with marks. We used to help those who had difficulties in their studies in order to advance their knowledge through organizing English language, math, chemistry, biology and computer courses. I was the one responsible for math and chemistry courses. As a consequence, our class became one of the best among four.
 
To take part in the development of my country is one of my dreams and I must take my place in the society to make it happen. I hope our generation will bring big changes to our country’s development. 

My family cannot afford to pay the tuition fee fully as we have five children in our famly, and my parents pay not only for my education, but also for my siblings. Therefore I would like to take an opportunity and apply for a Kica loan, which AUCA gives to all its students.”

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Comparative Politics. Below is the story of Malika:

“My name is Malika. This year I have graduated from secondary school in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan and enrolled in the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Comparative Politics. That was my dream, and I am so happy to become a student of one of the prestigious universities of Central Asia that gives the best education to its students. I believe that I will be able to achieve my goals after graduating from AUCA. I am a diligent student and would like to work in international organizations after graduation.
 
I have played a very active role in the social life of my school and in general. Social activities really bring me pleasure. There were so many competitions that I took part of in my life. One of them was the Turkish Olympiad, which I aimed myself to win. I tried it every year from 7th to 10th grade and I won. The finalists were sent to Turkey, so I visited Turkey. Lots of school children were representing other countries too and I was so proud to represent my country.

It was an exciting trip, and I won bronze medal for my presentation. I wished I've won 1st though. But I am sure, I will be able to do so in the future. While in Turkey, I deeply felt how much I love my country, and I represented all the best things we have: our national dress, our hospitality, etc. 

Moreover, my presentation was about “Manas”, which I think was a great thing to share with others. All people wanted to take a picture with me and I was so excited about that. I also took an active part in many other extracurricular activities in my school. 

I believe that both my educational background and all the mentioned above will allow me to be one of the best students of AUCA. I will try to be one of top students.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education tuition.

loans.name: Burul

texts.en:
Burul is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Sociology; her story is below. 

“I think that education is the most important thing in life, if a person wants to be successful. The last year was a very important period in my life, because I finished a preparatory program, and I had to decide which profession I would choose for my future. 

The idea to enroll in the American University of Central Asia has been in my mind for a long time. I wanted to study at AUCA since I was twelve, because I heard that it is a unique institution and that I can get a high quality education there. 

AUCA is the only university in Central Asia with such a great method of education. Now I am happy to study at AUCA, in the department of Sociology. From an early age I have been interested in humanities, as well as different societies and cultures. Therefore, I chose Sociology as my future and want to obtain a Master's Degree in Europe or the United States, similar to many AUCA graduates. I would like to do an internship or find a job. However, after spending 3-4 years abroad, I would like to come back to Kyrgyzstan and work here.

I had a big desire to study at AUCA, but my family cannot afford to fully pay the tuition fees. So I would like to take an opportunity of applying for a Kiva loan, which is given to each student at AUCA.”

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa graduated from secondary school this year and enrolled in the American University of Central Asia, department of psychology. Raisa studied at a private school, “Ilim.”  Below is her story.

“My parents believe that the future of each person depends on the quality of the education. Therefore they did their best to give all opportunities to get a high quality secondary education. I studied at one of the best schools of Bishkek. I also have a brother, who enrolled at University in Moscow after graduation of secondary school. 

"Besides I strongly believe that each person has a duty to involve in social life. I am an active person and try to take part in all social events actively. I have a volunteering experience: there is a relief fund for orphans and older people in our secondary school. We organized volunteer groups and visited an orphanage, named 'Meerim bulagy.'  Our group picked up clothes, toys and bought food and presented them, but the most important thing that we came to share our love and care with them. We organized concert, sang songs, danced and played. In the end, children didn’t want to let us go. Besides, I visited a home for the elderly and sometimes brought them to school, where we organized a holiday for them. I also work in Resource Centre for the old people in Kyrgyzstan since February. 

"I hope both my educational background and my volunteering experience will help me to be one of the best students of AUCA. The American University of Central Asia has been the University of my dreams for years, and I will try to do all my best to be one of the best students. 

"Unfortunately, my parents cannot afford paying the tuition fees fully. Therefore I am applying for Kiva loan, which will give me an opportunity to cover my higher education.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.en:
Dmitriy is a student at the American University of Central Asia, department of business administration, and below is his story.

“Nowadays the role of education is very important in our life. There are many universities in our country, so the step of choosing a suitable one defines our future career and even the whole life. it is known that one of outstanding universities in Central Asia is AUCA because it provides high quality of education and a big variety of extracurricular activities. There are lots of required and well-paid professions nowadays and AUCA gives an opportunity for students to choose and study according to their interests. 

"A reason of my desire to study at AUCA is that I am fond of mathematics, economics and even international relations with other countries. Economics is one of the most important sciences, which helps to develop the world’s living conditions and relations among the people from different countries. I think it is amazing to forecast the future decrease or increase of economics situation, estimate all important object and sources and make correct decisions which will determine my future success. That’s very outstanding and useful knowledge which I can get at AUCA. 

"I have some achievements in education. I won second place in the English language in Republican Olympiad. At the same time I have a particular interest in mathematics and physics. Last year I won second places in regional Olympiads in math and physics. 

"Our family is not able to cover the tuition fees fully, though. Therefore I would like to apply for Kiva loan, which is great opportunity. I hope to get this financial support, so that I could fully dedicate myself to studies.”

loans.use: To pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Comparative Politics, and below is his story. 

“My name is Parviz. I have graduated the Aga Khan Lycee in Khorog, Tajikistan. It was my dream to study at AUCA, department of International and Comparative Politics, and I am really happy that I’ve been admitted to this program. I am interested in this field because my society faces many problems related to politics that need specialists who are able to bring changes to the system of policies that lead to the development of my society. My interest in the subject grew when we studied economics, history, law and humanities in my ninth to eleventh grades and through my involvement in the sessions conducted in American Corner, a project of the US Embassy. 

The last few years of school, I was involved in a number of extracurricular activities. One of those was organizing charity competitions between youth in my local area last year. The aim of the competitions was to help sick or poor people with the money received from the competitions. People of different ages participate in competitions of various kinds of sports like volleyball, basketball, football, tennis, etc. The collected money was directed to help people in need; for medical treatment. These competitions became a positive push for school children, and now there are already several groups taking part in these competitions as well. Apart from sports, I also play guitar and sing. I think this experience will allow me to take an active part in the extracurricular activities of the university to make it interesting.

I live in a family of five: my parents, two siblings and myself. Education is very important for my family. Therefore, one of my important aims is to increase the financial situation in my family through education. My siblings also study at the Aga Khan Lycee, which has a monthly tuition fee, so it is unaffordable for my parents to pay for all of us. The tuition fees will increase much more than it before, when three of us studied in the Lycee. I hope to get financial support to pursue my further education at the American University of Central Asia – the University of dreams.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Daler

texts.en:
Daler is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Business Law and below is his story.

“My name is Daler. After successfully passing my final examination as a school-leaver, I set a goal to pursue a career in the field of International and Business Law. It has been a part of my plans since I became aware about the role and function of International and Business Law in our society. So I dreamed of getting a higher education at a prestigious University like AUCA. I know, in order to study at University, I need to work hard to show high performance, but rarely thought of the financial aspects of education. Now thinking about education far from my home country and about the income of my family, I know that it is one of the most important things and one of the most important problems.

I live in a family of five: my parents, and two siblings. My two brothers also study at the Aga Khan Lycee, which means that my parents pay their tuition fees also.

Taking into consideration my family’s income and expenses, I will need finance assistance to continue my education in the future. Although my family income is not so much, my parents always try to support me, but I know it will not be affordable to cover the tuition fees at the American University of Central Asia. Continuing my education at AUCA will prove to my family that their hard work and sacrifices were not in vain. I would also challenge my younger brothers to continue their education and also follow me as a role model in the family.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Saikal

texts.en:
Saikal is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Comparative Politics. She is requesting a loan to pay for her university education. Here is her story: 

“My name is Saikal. To achieve my goals in life, it is necessary for me to obtain an education after graduation of secondary school. Unfortunately, I and my family do not have enough resources to provide the necessary finances due to limited financial income. Therefore I am applying for Kiva loan, as this is a good opportunity to pay for my higher education. I have worked diligently to maintain excellent grades and had the highest GPS among other students in my class throughout 11 years of study, which is given on my transcript in details. For my achievements I received a 50% discount on the tuition fees, which I am very grateful of. I am very well prepared for the specialization I chose and my special efforts were dedicated to my further studies at the American University of Central Asia. I tried my best to achieve best results not only on advancing my literacy in English language, but other skill as well. I am sure my effort will be considered and help me in pursuing my studies at AUCA. I very much hope that I will be one of candidates to get some financial aid for my studies, which will make my dream come true. The American University of Central Asia has been the university of my dreams for years and I do not want financial restrictions to be a barrier for my future success.”

loans.use: to pay for her education

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Далер дружелюбный и ответственный парень. Он женат и имеет прекрасных детей. Далер живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Начиная с 2012 года Далер сотрудничает с Арванд. Он получал кредит на развитие своего бизнеса, и показал себя как ответственный клиент, своевременно выплачивал свои обязательства по кредиту. Раньше Далер занимался  деканством и получал от этого хороший доход. Но из-за засухи и других природных явлений каждый год он терял половину урожая. Это приносило большой ущерб для его семейного бюджета. Затем он решил заняться ещё откормом скота и получал от этого дополнительный доход, что помогало ему покрывать все семейные нужды. В данный момент Далер начал ещё один вид бизнеса, он купил грузовую машину и занимается купле продажей угля. Клиент покупает уголь из другого района и продает местным жителям. Сейчас как раз начинается зимний период, и люди начинают запасаться углём, чтобы обогреваться. Далер обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку угля. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Daler is a friendly and responsible guy. He is married and has wonderful children. Daler lives with his family in the rural area. He has been a client of Arvant since 2012. He received a loan to grow his business and has showed himself as a responsible client who pays his dues on time. Daler used to be in the collective farming business and received good income. But because of the drought and other weather related conditions he lost half of the harvest every year. This made a big damage to their family's budget. Later he has decided to start doing animal husbandry and received additional income from it which helped him cover all family expenses. At this time Daler started another type of business and bought a truck to buy and sell coal. He buys coal from another region and sells to the local residents. Right now is the beginning of the winter season and people start to stock up on coal for heating. Daler has come to Arvand and wants to get a loan to buy coal. He hopes for a positive outcome and is thanking Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase coal.

loans.name: Angeles Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGELES DEL CIELO”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de toallas, tienda de barrio, salón de belleza, tejido de chopas, compra y venta de CD y DVD, venta de pescado, venta de ropa interior, venta de productos de limpieza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la Institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior; cuenta que por iniciativa propia hace varios años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, el crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Angeles del Cielo village bank is beginning its ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional center. The group has eight members and is led by a board and its president, Hilda. The members of the group make their living in a variety of ways, including selling towels, running a neighborhood shop, running a beauty salon, weaving blankets, selling CDs and DVDs, selling fish, selling lingerie, and selling cleaning products.

Their loan will help the people of the group, including Hilda, with their businesses. Hilda says she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is also a member. At the moment she has a business selling lingerie, which she started several years ago.

She will use this loan to increase her working capital and buy more clothing, which she purchases from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then sells in her own shop. The work allows her to earn more income to support her household, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the saving, the loans, and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Frank

texts.es: Don Frank, 46 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos, oriundo del departamento del Beni. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable con su familia y con su trabajo sobre todo. El radica en la poblacion de Chimore hace unos 20 años atras, es de profesión carpintero, al principio trabajaban como ayudantes junto con sus hermanos donde adquirieron bastante experiencia, luego cada uno se independizo y abrio su propia carpinteria y poco a poco fue equipando con maquinaria su carpinteria. Ahora el ya tiene su negocio establecido en la poblacion de Chimore, con clientes regulares que ya conocen la calidad de producto que ofrece don Frank. Ahora el solicita el credito para comprar madera ya que tiene gran demanda de clientes.
texts.en:
Frank, 46, is married, has two children and is originally from the department of Beni.  He is a hard-working, responsible person regarding both is family and his work.  For 20 years he has been living in the village of Chimore and working as a carpenter.  He and his brothers used to work as assistants and acquired their experience.  Later on, Frank became independent and opened his own carpentry shop.  Little by little he bought carpentry machinery and now has an established business in Chimore.  He has regular clients who are familiar with the quality of his work.

Frank is requesting a loan to buy wood due to the great demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Eugenio Manuel

texts.es: Eugenio a sus 25 años de edad, se ha dedicado al arreglo de motocicletas durante varios años, tiene su propio taller, en el que ha aplicado todos los conocimientos infundados por su padre y, gracias al buen servicio que presta ha logrado conseguir muchos clientes, que le han generado los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. El cliente es un joven activo, pujante y tiene un espíritu emprendedor que lo ha llevado a lograr los objetivos que se propone. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para continuar con su labor, pues requiere comprar repuestos (bujías, neumáticos, bombillas, entre otros), para tener disponibilidad suficiente y así prestar un servicio más ágil y oportuno, lo que dará como resultado un incremento de su clientela y de las utilidades que recibe por realizar su labor. Eugenio sueña con acreditar y fortalecer su negocio poco a poco, dándose a conocer por la excelente calidad del servicio que presta y así lograr ser uno de los mejores talleres del pueblo donde reside, abriéndose paso para generar una estabilidad económica favorable que le permita ofrecer a su esposa mejores condiciones de vida y un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 25, has been in the motorcycle repair business for several years.  He has his own shop where he applies all the knowledge he learned from his father.  Thanks to the good service he offers he has many clients and, so, has been able to generate enough income to cover his family's basic needs.

The borrower is an active person with an entrepreneurial spirit that has allowed him to achieve the goals he has set for himself.  He is requesting a loan to continue his work and buy spare parts (sparkplugs, tires, light bulbs, etc.) so he is able to provide faster service.  This will increase his customer base and profit.

Eugenio wants to strengthen his business little by little, and become well-known for the excellent quality of his service.  He wants to have one of the best repair shops in the village where he lives.  This will open the way for him to generate a favorable economic stability so he can offer his wife the best possible living conditions and a prosperous, successful future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts (sparkplugs, tires, light bulbs, etc.)

loans.name: Francisco Luis

texts.es: Francisco a sus 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja en unión libre. Se ha dedicado a las labores del campo desde que tenía 12 años, pues viene de una familia campesina muy humilde, con quien aprendió todo lo relacionado con el cuidado de animales y la agricultura. Actualmente comercializa cerdos y además posee cultivos en la finca donde vive; de estas actividades percibe los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Es un hombre pujante, activo y trabajador, lucha diariamente con esmero y dedicación para sacar adelante a su familia. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para continuar con sus labores, con el dinero comprará más lechones para cría y engorde e insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, fungicidas, entre otros) para que la cosecha sea más productiva y pueda ser vendida con mayor facilidad en el mercado, generando así un margen de utilidad más amplio. Francisco con su humildad y su sencillez sólo desea poder tener una estabilidad económica favorable para que su familia no pase ninguna dificultad y proveer siempre el alimento, lo que para él significa disfrutar de buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco, 46, lives with his common-law wife and has been working as a farmer for 12 years.  He comes from a humble rural family where he learned everything related to animal husbandry and agriculture.  Currently, he sells pigs and also grows crops on the land where he lives.  He is able to earn enough income to maintain his household.

Francisco is an active, hard-working man who struggles daily with much care and dedication to provide for his family.  He is requesting a loan to continue in his work.  The money will be used to buy more piglets ro raise and farm supplies (fertilizers, fungicides, etc.) to achieve a more productive, profitable harvest.

With his humbleness and simple lifestyle, Francisco only wants to give his family economic stability and food on the table.  This, to him, means they will have a good lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and farm supplies (fertilizers, fungicides, etc.)

loans.name: Edmundo José

texts.es: Edmundo nació en una familia campesina humilde y trabajadora, virtudes que le enseñaron sus padres a medida que fue creciendo, además de involucrarlo en todas las actividades del campo. Gracias a ello, hoy en día, a sus 32 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, pues posee cultivos de plátano y otros productos, adicionalmente alterna esta actividad laborando como jornalero para complementar los ingresos con los cuales sostiene a su familia. Su empuje y tenacidad lo han llevado a lograr los objetivos que se propone y siempre va en busca de alternativas que le ayuden a salir adelante, esto lo motiva para solicitar el crédito con el que comprará insumos agrícolas (venenos, abonos, fungicidas, entre otros) con los cuales continuará cuidando sus cultivos y podrá obtener una cosecha más productiva que le generará mejores ingresos, de esta forma Edmundo podrá seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de adquirir más tierras y cultivarlas, que su actividad crezca y le permita disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su amada esposa.
texts.en:
Edmundo was born into a humble, hard-working rural family.  His parents taught him many virtues and involved him in all types of farm activity, thanks to which he is now a farmer at age 32.  He grows bananas and other crops, and also alternates his activity working as a hired hand to earn extra income for his family.

Thanks to his drive and tenacity, he has been able to achieve the goals he has set for himself; and he is always looking for alternative ways to prosper.  This is what motivated him to request a loan to buy farm supplies (weed killer, fertilizers, fungicides, etc.) which he will use to continue caring for his crops.  This will give him a result in a more productive harvest with increased income.  Edmundo will be able to continue progressing and realize his dream of acquiring more land so he can continue growing and give his beloved wife a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies (weed killers, fertilizers, fungicides, etc.)

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan, a sus 60 años de edad, sigue luchando por sus sueños, pues ni su edad, ni las adversidades que se le presentan en el día a día lo detienen. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a laborar como comerciante independiente, actividad que inició vendiendo frutas y verduras de manera ambulante durante muchos años y, desde hace aproximadamente 18 meses cambió de actividad y ahora se dedica a distribuir cereales, productos que ofrece en tiendas y supermercados de diferentes barrios de la ciudad; algunas ventas las realiza sobre pedidos y, diariamente sale a las calles a ofrecer sus productos puerta a puerta; aprovechando la ventaja de ser reconocido en las zonas por donde transita gracias a su anterior actividad; además esto le ha permitido ir aumentando su clientela, de esta manera es como este hombre pujante y trabajador se gana la vida y logra sustentar las necesidades de su familia, conformada por su esposa y 5 hijos. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para seguir acreditando su negocio, pues con el dinero desea comprar una máquina selladora, una gramera, etiquetas y surtido al por mayor (chocoarroz, hojuelas azucaradas, aros frutales, hojuelas simples), de esta forma podrá aumentar el margen de utilidad, pues se ahorraría el dinero que paga para que le empaquen el producto, así mejorará notablemente sus ingresos, con los que espera dar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida, además, tendrá la posibilidad de ampliar su negocio en un futuro que le permita generar empleo y poder ahorrar para comprar una casa propia en la que pueda pasar los últimos años de su vida, en compañía de los suyos.
texts.en:
Juan continues struggling at the age of 60 to realize his dreams, because neither his age, nor life's adversities have stopped him.  During his productive life he worked as an independent merchant.  He started by selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor and did this for many years.  But approximately 18 months ago he changed his business and now distributes cereals to stores and supermarkets in different neighborhoods in the city.  Some of his sales are based on orders but he also offers his products daily door-to-door.  He takes advantage of the fact that he is well-known because of his previous business.  This has allowed him to increase his clientele and earn a living for his family, comprised of his wife and five children.

This hard-working man is requesting a lon to buy a plastic sealing machine, a scale, labels and a variety of wholesale cereals (choco-rice, sugar flakes, fruit loops, etc.).  This will allow him to increase his profit margin and save money on packaging.  His aim is to give his family a better quality of life and to expand his business so that in the future he can generate employment.  He also wants to buy a house where he can live with his family for the rest of his life.

loans.use: To buy a plastic sealing machine, a scale, labels and a variety of wholesale cereals (choco-rice, sugar flakes, fruit loops, etc.)

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Rosalba es una mujer de  años de edad que vive con su esposo. Hace aproximadamente 10 años se dedica a atender su negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que tiene ubicada en la sala de su casa, allí ofrece todo tipo de productos de la canasta familiar y ha tenido muy buenos resultados; esta actividad surgió de la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y de sentirse útil, poco a poco fue aprendiendo de manera empírica todo sobre el manejo de su negocio y al mismo tiempo ha podido estar al frente de su hogar. La cliente manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir luchando por sus objetivos, por ello siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan avanzar. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, gaseosas, lácteos, café, panela, entre otros), de esta forma tendrá más variedad de productos disponible para ofrecer a sus compradores y podrá satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades, dando como resultado un incremento en sus ingresos. Rosalba desea continuar con su labor para que en un futuro cercano le permita terminar de construir su casa y poder disfrutar el resto de su vejez al lado del hombre que la ha acompañado en este largo trayecto.
texts.en: Rosalba is a woman of age who lives with her husband. She has run her business for approximately 10 years. It is a convenience store located in the living room of her house. She offers all types of staple products and she has had good results. This activity came about out of necessity of helping her husband with the household expenses and to feel useful. Little by little she learned empirically about managing the business and at the same time she has been able to run her home. This client says that her age doesn't stop her from fighting for her goals. For that she is always seeking alternatives that will allow her to advance. She is asking for the help of the loan to buy merchandise wholesale (pastries, cookies, sodas, dairy products, coffee, brown sugar, and more). In this way, she will have a wider variety of products available to offer her buyers and be able to fulfill the diverse tastes and needs. The result will be an increase in her income. Rosalba wants to continue with his work so that in the near future she will be able to finish building her house and be able to enjoy the rest of her old age and be able to enjoy the rest of her old age next to the man who has accompanied her this whole time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (pastries, cookies, sodas, dairy products, coffee, brown sugar, and more).

loans.name: Luz Magnolia

texts.es: Luz es una mujer de 50 años de edad que se dedica al arte de la confección. Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres como operaria, pero luego de un tiempo decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio en un salón de su casa; allí comenzó a confeccionar para terceros, pero por incumplimiento en el pago de los contratos, decidió incursionar en la confección de su línea propia y, hoy en día comercializa sus productos en diferentes almacenes del centro de la ciudad, en  otros barrios y en pueblos aledaños, obteniendo muy buenos resultados. La cliente, con su empeño, empuje y tenacidad ha sobrepasado diversos obstáculos, pero esto no la detiene, por el contrario, la anima para seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es fortalecer la producción de su marca propia y ampliar aún más el mercado en los diferentes pueblos de la región. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, agujas, entre otros), así podrá tener más variedad de texturas y colores disponibles para la venta, que vayan a la vanguardia de la moda y así satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de su clientela, de esta manera podrá mejorar notablemente los ingresos que percibe para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
texts.en: Luz is 50 years old and she works in the art of sewing. During he working life she has worked in different workshops as an operator, but after a time she decided to go off on her own and start her own business in a room in her house. That is where she started to sew for third parties, but due to non-payment of contracts, she decided to go into making her own lines. Today she sells her products in different stores in the center of town, in other neighborhoods and in nearby towns, getting very good results. With her hard work, drive and tenacity, the client has overcome obstacles and these haven't stopped her. To the contrary, they drive her to keep going toward the realization of her main dream, which is fortifying the production of her own brand and expanding even more in the market in different towns in the region. She is asking for the help of the loan to buy materials wholesale (fabrics, thread, buttons, needles, and more). This way, she can have a variety of textures and colors available to sell that will be on the vanguard of fashion and thus satisfy the needs and tastes of her clientele. This way, she can notably improve the income she receives to pay for her household's basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy materials wholesale (fabrics, thread, buttons, needles, and more).

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SABOUGNOUMA est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses,  et enfants dans le quartier  MASSABLA COURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2éme prêt. Le précédent prêt  à été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  cosmétiques à l’image de OUMOU qui est la première de la droite vers la gauche  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, des cartons de crèmes, pommades, lotions et savons à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is made up of 4 women, all married, with an average age of 30 years and an average of 2 children each. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, and children in the Massabla Coura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni. The women came to know each other as neighbors, friends, and through business.

In order to increase their financial capacity to better run their businesses, they have partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second loan. The previous loan was fully repaid.

This group of women is in cosmetics sales, such as Oumou, who is the first woman pictured on the left. She plans to use to her loan to purchase creams, pomades, lotions, and soaps in Bamako. She makes her sales both at the market and from home, at retail for both cash and credit, to a customer base made up mostly of women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es: Dina, a sus 28 años de edad, se dedica a realizar las labores del campo,ya que posee un galpón  y una marranera donde cría y engorda pollos y cerdos para posteriormente venderlos, esta actividad la aprendió desde que era pequeña, ya que sus padres le enseñaron todo lo relacionado con el manejo y el cuidado de sus animales. Solicita el crédito con el ánimo de comprar más polluelos y lechones para cría y engorde, lo que le permitirá aumentar su capacidad de producción y por ende mejorará notablemente los ingresos que percibe por las ventas realizadas. Dina, con su empuje y dedicación desea seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia y además, fortalecer su negocio para que sea más rentable y productivo.
texts.en: Dina, at 28 years old, works in the country. She has a shed and a pig sty where she raises and fattens chickens and pigs to later sell. She learned this activity since she was little. Her parents taught her everything related to the handling and the care of her animals. She is asking for the loan in order to buy more young chickens and suckling pigs to raise and fatten. This will allow her to increase her production capacity and therefore notably increase the income she makes from the sales. Dina, with her drive and dedication, wants to keep advancing to maker her dream come true of giving her family a better quality of life and fortifying her business to be more profitable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more young chickens and suckling pigs to raise.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is been photographed with her two sons in front of the animal stable. When they heard that their mother would be photographed for Kiva, they ran to the stable where she was and took her outside, so that three of them would be in the picture. 
Here it is what the little one said to the loan officer: “We want lenders to see us too, why only mom.” Natasha’s family lives in a very rural part of the country where the winters are very cold and snowy. She has been in the livestock activity for fifteen years now and has been selling raw milk to the nearby dairy farms. 
Natasha wants to prepare the soil for planting potatoes and buy potato seeds as well with the loan she is requesting from Kiva lenders. This will be her first loan.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and prepare the soil for planting the seeds

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    KELEGNA est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLA COURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 9 eme prêt. Les 8 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à l’image de ROUTIE qui est la 1ére femme  assise de la gauche vers la droite. Elle fait l’achat vente de céréales et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1,3 tonnes de maïs avec les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Kelegna group is made up of 4 women, all married, with an average age of 44 years and an average of 5 children each. They live in traditional extended families in the Massabla Coura neighborhood of Bougouni. They came to know each other as neighbors, friends, and through business.

In order to increase their financial capacity to better run their businesses, the women partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their 9th loan. The previous 8 loans were all fully repaid.

This group of women is in the cereal business, such as Routie who is the first woman pictured sitting from left to right. She purchases and resells cereals, and plans to use her loan to purchase 1.3 tons of corn from wholesalers. She makes her sales at the market and from home, at retail for both cash and credit, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 37,000 francs CFA which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Aventura

texts.en:
Aventura wants to buy potato seeds for planting. She has been in the agricultural type of activity for five years. She plants and sells potatoes and she also has cows and she sells raw milk to the local market of a main city in southern Albania. 
Aventura is a 30-year-old mother of three young aged children; one of her children, her daughter, was born with medical conditions. “I suffer every minute I see my daughter in such a condition but I can’t do much. So far, I have done it all and the doctors have made me aware that there would be no treatment. When I was told the news, I broke down, because up until then I was in denial and wanted to believe that there would be some treatment for such cases. Slowly, I have started to come to terms with and take it day by day. Anyhow, thank God that I am a stay-at-home mother so that I can take great care of her,” Aventura said.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
Dave is a villager from the rural north and a 50 something mother of seven children.
Dave has been in the livestock activity for ten years. Not only she has been selling raw milk to locals but she has been enjoying making cheese and due to this factor she has built a larger clientele. She takes orders for cheese and she delivers it to homes. 
“I love making cheese; it’s not that difficult at all, yet someone must know the ins and outs. I feel that I have mastered the skills in cheese making,” Dave said smiling.
Dave wants to add one more dairy cow and a calf with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a calf.

loans.name: Hil

texts.en:
Hil is a villager who has been living in the rural north since he was born. 
“I can’t imagine myself living somewhere else, but here. I love the cold and snowy long winters and the beautiful sceneries. My financial income has not allowed me to get out of village often either, so...” said Hil petting his dog that he seemed to adore. 
Hil has two children and is married. He has been in the livestock type of business for over 20 years and with this loan he wants to build up a stable.
“Being the only one, who has provided financially to my family, is making me feel good and especially when they say it in a very appreciative way,” said Hil laughing.

loans.use: to cover the stable, because right now there is no roof to it.

loans.name: Zyra

texts.en:
This is Zyra’s all-in-one  stable & storage shack where she stores and dries out all agricultural items and where the animals sleep as well. She wants to build a proper stable and barn with this loan.
“It is very cold inside here for my animals. In our village the winters are long and snowy and extremely cold, so my animals are not safe here. Also hungry wolves come down in our village in the winter searching for food. So many times, these hungry animals have eaten the cows and sheep of my neighbors and mine have been very lucky so far. Thank God,” said Zyra showing consistently the shack. 
Zyra is a 34-year-old mother of two and has lived in Greece for long time. Many Albanians have been coming back recently including her. They establish themselves in the rural area so that they can make a decent living by focusing on agricultural/livestock activities.

loans.use: To build a stable and barn

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal who has been photographed right by his grapevines. He is a married father of five children who lives in the rural north of Albania.

Here it is what Pal said: “I have been in the agriculture business for over twenty years now and have experienced a slow progress throughout the years. The competition in this type of activity is high in Albania, because almost every family that lives in the rural area does the same. Yet, there are no arrangements from wholesale buyers so that they can buy our products and also no arrangement from the government either so that our fresh and all organic produce gets exported. It is very sad that often we see our produce rot and get thrown in the garbage. The new prime minister has mentioned throughout his campaign that his government will fix this. Let’s see.”

Pal wants to surround the grapevine with a fence with this loan.

loans.use: to surround the grapevines with a fence.

loans.name: Oscar Nelson

texts.es: Oscar, a sus 25 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos de 2 y 5 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja sentimental. Realizó estudios de tecnología en telecomunicaciones, ha trabajado como empleado en empresas y desde hace 5 años trabaja como comerciante independiente, tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos y accesorios para motos y con el paso del tiempo comenzó a incursionar con alarmas de rastreo satelital paraeste tipo de vehículos, pues vio en esto una potencial fuente de ingresos y por ello realizó la importación de dicho producto desde China. El cliente es un joven honesto, juicioso y trabajador, día a día lucha incansablemente para generar los ingresos que le permitan llevar el sustento a su hogar. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (repuestos y alarmas), con lo que podrá ampliar su inventario y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, pues tendrá los repuestos a la mano para cuando el cliente lo requiera; esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ingresos con lo que podrá seguir sustentando las necesidades y gastos de su familia. Oscar sueña con seguir progresando, pero es consciente que para lograrlo debe ser disciplinado, dedicado y proyectarse hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, esto es la clave para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is 25 years old, the father of two sons aged 2 and 5, and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner. He studied telecommunications technology and worked as an employee in companies. For five years he has been working as an independent trader. He has a business selling parts and accessories for motorbikes and over the time he began also selling satellite tracking and alarm systems for these types of vehicles.  He saw this as a possible source of income and therefore started importing this product from China.

The client is an honest, thoughtful and hardworking young man who works tirelessly every day to generate the income which enables him to provide for his family. He asks for a loan in order to buy merchandise at wholesale (spare parts and alarm systems). By doing so, he can increase his inventory and offer a better service to his customers, because he would have the spare parts at hand when a customer requires them. This will also result in an increase of his income and will enable him to continue providing for the needs and expenses of his family.

Oscar dreams of making further progress, but he is well aware that in order to achieve this he needs to aim on reaching his goals with discipline and dedication. This is the key to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale (spare parts and alarm systems)

loans.name: Etelvina María

texts.es:
Nérida es una mujer de 78 años de edad, quien por su avanzada edad tuvo que solicitar el favor a su amiga Etelvina para fuera la representante en la solicitud de este crédito. 
Nérida ha vivido durante toda su vida en el área rural de la ciudad, allí aprendió todas las labores del campo cuando era joven, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Para aprovechar sus conocimientos, decidió iniciar su propio negocio y actualmente se dedica a comercializar todo tipo de animales como cerdos, gallinas, entre otros, ella ya es reconocida por muchos finqueros del sector, razón por la que va aumentando sus ingresos. La cliente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más animales como polluelos, lechones y terneros, para criarlos, engordarlos y luego venderlos en el mercado, generando así los recursos suficientes para solventar las necesidades de su hogar y seguir sosteniendo su finquita, en la que desea pasar los últimos años de su vejez mientras disfruta los resultados de su larga trayectoria por la vida.
texts.en:
Nérida is 78 years old.  Because of her advanced age, she has had to ask her friend Etelvina to represent her as she applies for this loan.

Nérida has lived her whole life in the rural areas of the city and there she learned from her parents all sorts of country work when she was young.  In order to use her knowledge, Nérida started her own business and she currently sells all kinds of animals, including pigs and hens.  Nérida is known by many farmers in the area and so her income has increased.  Nérida is applying for a loan in order to buy more animals, such as baby birds, piglets, and calves, to raise, fatten up, and then sell at the market.  This will give Nérida the income she needs to cover household costs and to maintain her farm.  It is on the farm that Nérida wants to spent her last years, as she enjoys the results from her long life.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as baby birds, piglets, and calves.

loans.name: Anton

texts.en:
Anton has been operating his vehicle parts store at a convenient location for people to reach for ten years now. “I have seen a steady growth throughout the years. I started thinking that I wouldn’t do well at the time, but I was wrong. I have been doing very well so far, and I am happy with the progress,“ Anton told the loan officer.

Anton is a 42-year-old married father of three school-age children, and they all live in Northern Albania. The loan that he is requesting at this point will be the first one for him and will be used to stock up on inventory items.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for his vehicle parts store

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe, whose name in English means white, is a 50-year-old mother of six children. She is a villager from the rural north, and the way she’s dressed up shows just that. People from this region are easily distinguished in Albania due to their traditional wear, usually with half of their head covered and their hair in braiding.  

Bardhe has been photographed in front of the brand new store she just finished building a few months back, yet she was lacking money to stock it with inventory items that she plans to sell. Thus, she preferred to have the picture taken outside the store because she did not like the emptiness inside. “It will be like a grocery store where I can sell some toiletries,” said Bardhe.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for her brand new village grocery store.

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjollca has been in the fast food business for the past seven years. During the summertime, she takes her mobile fast food trailer to the beach, where she serves the beach goers. During the school time, she takes it to nearby schools. “It has been profitable and rewarding at the same time. This has been the only source of income for my family ever since I started it and I am content,” Vjollca told the loan officer.

Kindly note that the loan officer could not take a picture of Vjollca at her business, because she was at home when interviewed. Both of her children had the flu, and she felt that she needed to stay at home since her husband was away at that moment. Vjollca now wants to buy some necessary equipment for the fast food trailer.

loans.use: to buy some necessary equipment for her mobile fast food trailer

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a widowed mother of a 20-year-old son who has been studying at a university. She doesn’t have all the money (50,000 Albanian Lek) at the moment to pay for the semester fees, and this loan would become very handy in their situation. This will be her second loan from the same institution. 

“When my son turned just three years old, my husband passed away. Throughout the years, I tried to do my very best to raise my son. Gladly we lived in a village, because should we have been living in the city, it would have been more difficult for me to provide for him. But in the village, somehow you manage to secure food at least, maybe not variety but still…,” said Leonora.

Leonora has been in the livestock type of business for the past 6 years and has been selling raw milk to a nearby dairy farm.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees for the upcoming semester.

loans.name: Lule

texts.en:
Lule wants to build a fence around her agricultural plantings, and for this she is seeking your financial help. The amount she requests is 100,000 Albanian Lek, and this will be her first loan.

Lule lives in the rural northeastern part of the country with her five children and her husband. She was left an orphan when she was just one year old after her parents were killed by the regime then, and she was raised by her uncle on her mother's side. 

“I remember nothing of all the happenings. I was raised to believe that my uncle and his wife were my own parents, and they were in reality. As I grew older though, the wish of knowing or being with my biological parents grew as well. There is no picture of them which I could see; nobody took photographs back then in the villages. So, believing in God and life after death, I am left to believe that someday I will be with them and I pray for this,” Lule said, wiping her tears away.

loans.use: to build a fence around her agricultural plantings.

loans.name: Nasibe

texts.en:
Nasibe wants to replace a cow that just passed away with another cow and this loan will help her do just that. 

Nasibe is a married mother of three young children who are attending public school, ranging from 13 to 9 years of age. They live in the very rural southeastern part of the country known for bitter cold and unpaved roads. Yet, despite all these difficulties, Nasibe and other villagers leave their homes early in the mornings to reach the nearby cities in an attempt to sell their fresh products. She sells raw milk and homemade cottage cheese and she has been doing this for the past eight years.

Nasibe’s plans are to add two more dairy cows to the existing herd. This will be her first loan.

loans.use: To replace a cow that just passed away with another cow.

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en:
Pashke is a villager from the rural northern part of the country who has been in an agricultural type of business for almost twenty-one years now. Kindly note that her photograph was taken at her field planted with kale. In this region, however, people do not consume green veggies as much as in the southern part of Albania. They consume more animal protein and potatoes, and veggies other than green.

Pashke has four children. The youngest one, who is 24 and disabled, unfortunately needs special care from his mother. This will be Pashke’s first loan and she wants to drill a well with this money.

loans.use: to drill a well for watering her plants.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim has been selling dairy products to local markets, as well as homemade wine and the traditional drink, “Raki”, made of grapes. “It's been going good so far. I started my activity long ago by taking a loan from VisionFund Albania, and as time passed by I applied for two more loans to expand my activity. I am so very appreciative to VFA for being there for me when I needed it. Now I have applied for another loan to buy equipment to press the grapes for the wine and for making the Raki,” Ibrahim said.

He has four grown up children and his previous work was in the mines. As soon as the mines closed down, he started his own activity.

loans.use: to buy equipment to press the grapes for wine and for making raki.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add one more dairy cow.

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
This is Merita who has been in an agricultural type of activity for almost eight years now. She hasn’t been photographed next to her business, though, because she felt uncomfortable being in dirty clothes and having messy hair. Kindly note that it is traditional in rural Albania for people to dress up in their best outfits; a photo is very important to them. So, according to her, Merita is in her best outfit here, and being dressed as such, she could not go to the fields for the picture because she would get dirty.  

Merita is married and only thirty years old and has two children, 11 and 5. She wants to buy onion and potato seeds for planting. The region where she resides is known for producing the highest quantity and the most delicious red onions in Albania.

loans.use: to buy onion and potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en:
Pashke is a villager living in the most rural northern region where one of the best known Albanian restaurants is built. This restaurant is frequented not only by Albanians but by lots of foreigners as well, due to offering only traditional food. The three brothers who own it have finished Culinary school in Italy and worked there for some time before coming to their own village and opening the restaurant on their farm. 100% of what they offer at this restaurant, like meat, dairy products, veggies/fruits, wine/Raki, desserts, etc. is fresh and organic from their farm. There is a legend tied to the farm where this restaurant is located and the architecture, in addition to the above, makes it stand out from the rest.

Pashke is in her early 50s and married and has been in a livestock type of activity for the past twenty years, selling dairy products at a local market of a nearby town. With this loan, she wants to build a stable, because the one in the background of the picture is not in good condition.

loans.use: to build a better stable.

loans.name: Qani

texts.en:
This is Qani, a rural villager living in southeastern Albania. Qani is 47.  He is married and has four school-aged children.  

For the past ten years, Qani has been operating a little village bar-restaurant. Prior to this, he worked in Greece. “This is not a restaurant someone would expect; it’s something poor serving the poorest in my village. That is. Usually I serve grilled meat and homemade fries and some dairy like cheese or cottage cheese and Raki, the traditional Albanian drink made of fruits, such as grapes, blueberries, plums etc.” said Qani during his interview. 

He wants to add some inventory items needed in his business and this loan will help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy inventory items for his little village bar-restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beer, soda and water for his bar.

loans.name: Ndue

texts.en:
Ndue has been selling raw milk to a nearby dairy farm and baby calves to the local market for more than fifteen years.

Ndue is married and has five children. Regionally and religiously, families with more than three children are prevalent in northern Albania. For years, children helped in the family agricultural activities and both sides enjoyed being in the company of each other. However, in recent years things have changed a bit. Young people, especially men, go to the capital city seeking a better life. In most cases, they remain jobless for some time and their parents consider it as their duty to help the children financially. Ndue’s children though have stayed around and help in the rural activities. 

Kindly note that Ndue considers this photo as something special and as he dressed up.

Ndue needs to repair the stable with this loan.

loans.use: to repair the stable.

loans.name: Mondi

texts.en:
Mondi, a 29-year-old father of two young kids, 5 and 1 years old, wants to build a stable with this loan and he is seeking your financial help to achieve this immediate goal. He and his extended family live in northeast Albania.

Mondi has been photographed in front of the current stable; one can notice that it’s been built very poorly and animals sleep under bad conditions, according to him. This is what Mondi said during his interview with the loan officer: “All the water comes inside when it rains and all you can see is mud everywhere, in a day like today. When it snows, it’s worse, because it becomes so very cold inside that you see animals start trembling from it. I am so very glad that this microfinance institution expanded to our region recently, including here twenty three villages. We will literally get help and wherever you go you hear people talking about the potential help they will be getting from here on through this institution.”

loans.use: To build a proper stable for his animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of baking flour and powder for bacing more bread for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a fence around his vineyard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of onions, cooking oil and fish.

loans.name: Behar

texts.en:
Behar is a 33-year-old married father of a four-year-old child; he had emigrated to Greece in his early twenties and recently came back to his home village and is trying to expand the livestock activity that he started as soon as he got back. He’s been selling milk to a nearby dairy farm, and soon he plans to process the milk himself instead to make dairy products. He wants to make cottage and cheese and butter also. 

Behar wants this loan to finish building the roof of the newly house that will serve as a building for the dairy farm as well; he and his family have been staying with relatives in a little one-room house for some time now until the house their house is finished and they can’t wait to move out. The amount that would help him achieve his goal would be in an amount of 150,000 Albanian Lek. Behar would be very appreciative to all lenders for the help.

loans.use: to finish building off the house, a  part of which will serve as a building for his dairy farm

loans.name: Thanks Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Moreblessing from Mutare. She is married with two children, one attending school.  She is a member of Thanks Group. Moreblessing runs a retail business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenges faced are high import duty at border posts and high transport cost. Moreblessing has requested a loan of $600 to purchase more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. In the future Moreblessing plans to have her own boutique shop in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes and foot wear from South Africa for resale

loans.name: Zhaneta

texts.en: Thanks to lenders, Zhaneta added some more goats to the existing herd. Things are getting better for her; she has had the opportunity to sell milk to the locals and also sell homemade goat cheese. She now wants to improve the living condition for the animals and this loan will help her achieve the goal. She is very appreciative to all lenders for helping her out.

loans.use: To repair the exising stable

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 44 years old. She is married with three children aged 19-23. She has a rice farming business in her town of Talibon. She also has been running a sari-sari or variety store for two years now. She works hard in order to help augment the income of her family. Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. Zenaida dreams of making her business bigger someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 51 years old and from the municipality of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with one daughter who is already an adult. 

For nineteen years now Zenaida has operated a Sari-sari (convenience) store where she sells snacks, candies, bread, detergent, canned goods and soft drinks. She barely earns an average income of 5000 PHP that is used to help meet her family’s basic needs. 

She is asking for a loan of 17000 PHP to buy rice, chips, detergent, shampoo and canned goods. She hopes that someday she can continue to improve and expand her business for increased profit.

loans.use: to buy rice, chips, detergent, shampoo and canned goods

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en: Sameena is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been running a business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. She requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 20-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store. She has five years of experience in this field.  By this time, she has retained many regular customers and makes a good profit to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of sugar, biscuits, and cooking oil to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of sugar, biscuits, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 36 years old and from the community of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with three children; her eldest is 13 years old and her youngest is 2 years old. 

Analie desires to help her husband in their fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets to replace their old ones. 

Analie would like to make sure that she can make her business more profitable. Her income will assure her that her children are kept in school and her family is well-nourished.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is from Vanadzor town where she lives with her mother (in the photo) and brother. She studies at Vanadzor State Pedagogical University, which is named after H. Tumanya, and is currently in her last course of study. 

In order to support her family's living, Astghik, as well as her university studies, also works at a local supermarket as a seller. It is very hard for Astghik to work after school every day until night, but she does her best to sustain her family's living conditions and to do well at school.

Currently the family is in a difficult financial condition and Astghik isn't able to pay her university tuition. She is asking for this loan in order to pay for her university tuition and be able to complete her education. The loan is very important for Astghik and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Japeth

texts.en:
Japeth is 22 years old and works in fishing and catching crabs in the town of Getafe, Bohol. It is his dream to continue his business and even improve it for a bigger income.

He is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and crab traps that are necessary for him to be more productive. His income will provide a nutritious diet for him and his partner, as well as provide payment for water and electricity.
