In the future, he would like to expand his fishing business and have more pump boats to use for fishing.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and crab traps

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of four. 

She has been in the business of animal sales for the past ten years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

Naseem currently needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en: Raheela is a 24-year-old, single lady. She has been in the beauty parlor business for about three years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. She needs to be able to offer more to her customers. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities so she applied a loan of Rs. 30,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to buy a stock of products for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Rihana

texts.en:
Rihana is a 36-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of selling milk for the past seven years. She has two calves and three cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. She is a motivated mother to provide her children with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. Now she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children, ages 5-14. For four years now, she has operated a food-vending business in order to help her husband, who works as a driver. She works hard selling snacks such as banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar), camote cue (deep fried sweet potato in caramelized sugar) and puto balanghoy (steamed cassava cake with coconut custard). 

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like sugar, sweet potatoes, bananas, cassava and baking powder. This would help so she can continue her business, since some of her customers will ask for food on a credit basis. Emma would like to add more snack types in the future to attract more customers and increase her income. 

She hopes to see her children become successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sweet potatoes, bananas, cassava and baking powder.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 49-year-old married mother of two children. She works as a school's principal. She is a hard worker with 15 years of experience in this field. Samia is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay her son's requested school fees. Her husband’s low income isn’t enough to cover their family’s needs; that’s why she finds herself responsible to financially support her husband for the family’s increasing needs and requests.

Samia’s only hope for the future is to see her son highly educated.

loans.use: to pay her son's requested school fees.

loans.name: Qamar

texts.en:
Qamar is 47 years old and a vigorous, married lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses on time, which will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Aneela, age 23, is a married woman and a mother of two. She has been in a beauty-parlor business since three years ago. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing her best services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demand of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta was able to purchase the dairy cow with your previous help and now she is seeking your help again to build a stable for the animals.

loans.use: To build a stable

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Mirian a pesar de sus 64 años de edad no deja de soñar en grande, de ver en un futuro no muy lejano sus cultivos de café en mejores condiciones y como tierras de mayor producción en la zona. Ella es casada, madre de 8 de los cuales 5 ya están casados y en hogares a parte y los otros tres viven con ella y su padre los cuales estudian en la secundaria y trabajan en el campo realizando las diferentes actividades como aplicación de fertilizantes, abono, foliare, limpieza entre otras para mantener sano los cultivos, con ella también viven 3 nietos. Ella tiene seis años de educación los cuales pudo cursar en una escuela de la zona, es ama de casa y agricultora desde hace más de 30 años ya que fue en compañía de su esposo que ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra siendo el la zona donde ella habita el único medio de ingreso económico para las familias. Ella también cuenta con otros ingresos por medio de una pequeña pulpería la cual está en su casa de habitación y un molino para moler maíz. La tierra que cultivan es propia gracias al esfuerzo por muchos años la cual pudieron comprar y ahora trabajar de manera propia las cuales están ubicadas a 30 minutos de su casa de habitación y cultivadas de una gran variedad de café lo que le agradecen a DIOS por ese gran privilegio y oportunidad de tener a pesar de los diferentes desafíos que día con día enfrenta esta clase de producto.

Sus planes para el futuro son los de seguir ampliando más sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de tierra de esta manera ella fortalecerá el patrimonio para sus hijos y que sean ellos quienes sigan trabajándola de generación en generación y que sea de gran bendición. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos de café como abono, foliares, formula cafetalera, fungicidas, herbicidas, entre otros que darán protección a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Despite her 64 years of age, Sra. Mirian has not stopped dreaming big, of seeing in a not-too-distant future her coffee fields in better condition and the best producers in the area. She is married with eight children, five of whom are married and live independently. The remaining three live with Mirian and their father and attend secondary school. They also help in the fields with various activities such as spreading fertilizer and manure, leaf applications, weeding etc. to keep them well maintained. Three grandchildren also live with Miriam.

She has seven years of education and attended a nearby school. She has been a housewife and farmer for more than thirty years as it was through her husband that she learned about farming. Agriculture is the only means of earning a living in the area where she lives.

As well Mirian has a small grocery store in her house and a mill for grinding maize. The land where she farms is her own; after many years of effort they were able to buy it. It is located thirty minutes from the house, and on it she grows a variety of coffee plants. She and her husband thank God for this great privilege and opportunity in spite of the challenges that this type of farming brings on a daily basis.

Mirian’s plans for the future include continuing to expand the farm by buying more land. This will enable her to leave her children a good inheritance so they can continue working the land for generations, a great blessing.

Today Mirian is seeking a loan to buy farming supplies such as manure,  plant fertilizer, special feed for coffee plants, fungicide, herbicide etc. to provide protection for the plants.

loans.use: buy farming supplies for her coffee plants

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira is a 31-year-old married woman. She has had a business of manufacturing chicks (curtains or blinds made of bamboo sticks) for many years. Her husband also helps her in this business; he is standing next to Nasira in the photo. They offer various types of chicks in different designs and varieties and have become famous for providing good quality chicks in their community. They are contentedly doing it for the sake of the family members. In order to inflate her sales, Nasira needs to purchase another machine, fresh quality bamboos and threads. For this she applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 through Kashf Foundation. It’s her 3rd year and she is satisfied from the support of it. She hopes to get an increase in her earnings to support her family well.

loans.use: to buy another machine, fresh quality bamboos and threads.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya is a 53-year-old married woman and mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Suriya’s husband; he is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Suriya has applied for a loan of Rs 25,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Suriya is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Fanny Mairena

texts.es:
Doña Fanny es una mujer casada de 37 años de edad la cual se graduó en la secundaria de bachillerato en ciencias y letras madre de 3 hijos de los cuales el mayor está en la universidad y los dos menores en secundaria. Ella es agricultora y ganadera desde hace 7 años ya que sus padres se dedican a lo mismo y en su familia el trabajo de la tierra y ganadería es una tradición y único medio de ingreso para el fortalecimiento de la economía en su hogar. El terreno que ella cultiva y trabaja como también donde tiene sus vacas es propio el cual lo compro y está ubicado a 30 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada a pie. En estas actividades solo su familia se involucra por lo que ellos trabajan en equipo y se dividen las diferentes tareas unos van hacia el cuido del ganado y ella con su esposo al mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café.

Sus sueños es tener una hacienda, tener reces de calidad y poder ser una de las importadoras más importantes del país. Como Madre ella sueña con vera a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, con carreras universitarias que ayuden a su desarrollo y fortalecimiento para desempeñarse en cualquier rama de trabajo que le sea asignada. Ella solicita un financiamiento para poder empezar a fortalecer su sueño con el cual comprara reces y mejorara el pasto de esa manera aumentar en número para poder producir producto derivados de la leche y de esa manera fortalecer la economía para su hogar
texts.en:
Fanny is 37 years old and married.  She completed high school, having mainly studied sciences and literature and languages.  Fanny is a mother to three children, the eldest of whom is at university, while the younger two are in high school.  Fanny has been a farmer and cattle raiser for seven years.  Her parents did the same work, and working the field and raising cattle is a family tradition. It has also been the family's only income that they use to strengthen the family finances.  Fanny owns the land where she works and keeps her cows.  It is 30 minutes from her house, and can be arrived at on foot.  The only ones who work on the land are Fanny and her family.  They work as a team and divide the work amongst themselves - some look after the cattle while Fanny and her husband take care of the coffee crops.

Fanny's dream is to have a ranch, have quality farm animals, and be one of the biggest importers in the country. As a mother, Fanny dreams of seeing her children become professionals, with university degrees that help with development.  She wants them to be able to do any work that they want.  Fanny is applying for a loan in order to make her dream a reality and buy farm animals and to improve her pasture.  With more animals, she can produce dairy products and improve the household's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy farm animals to produce dairy products.

loans.name: Isis Marilia

texts.es:
Isis Marilia es una mujer joven con 29 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante acompañada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales son apoyo con las diferentes actividades en el campo como ser: limpieza, corte, abono y fertilización de cultivos de café. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleto cursado hasta el quinto grado y no pudo continuar estudiando debido a que sus padres eran de bajos recursos económicos y no pudieron ayudarla. Desde su niñez se ha  dedicado al cultivo de café actividad practicada por su familia hasta hoy en día siendo este el único sustento ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra hace muchos años. La tierra que juntos en familia trabajan fue heredada por sus padres hace un tiempo para el sustento y cubrir gastos como la alimentación, vestimenta, estudio, medicinas, etc. la cual queda a una distancia de 20 minutos de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie en familia.

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos entre otros para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Sus metas son poder cultivar más plantas para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos para su familia ya que por medio de esto ellos podrán seguir invirtiendo en sus cultivos y agrandar poco a poco sus cosechas. Las ganancias son para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y para seguir invirtiendo en su tierra.
texts.en:
Isis Marilia is 29 years old.  She is feisty, enterprising and has a strong desire to overcome obstacles and get ahead.  Isis has a partner and is a mother to four children.  The children support Isis with her work in the country, helping with cleaning, cutting, and laying manure and fertiliser on the coffee crops.  Isis only completed up to fourth grade but could not continue in education as her parents had little money and could not help her.  Since her childhood, Isis has made a living growing coffee, work which her family did before her.  This work is Isis' only source of income.  Her parents taught her to work the land many years ago.  Isis inherited their land from her parents some time ago, and it helps support the household and cover costs such as food, clothing, school costs, medicines and the like.  The land is 20 minutes away from where the family lives, and can be arrived at on foot.

Isis is currently applying for a loan to buy fertiliser and manure to maintain her coffee crops.  With this she will have a healthy and good harvest to generate an income, earn a profit, and will be able to continue investing in her work.

Isis' goal are to be able to grow more plants so as to earn a higher income for family.  She could then invest more and expand her harvests.  Isis' profits will be used to give her children a future and to further invest in her land.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past five years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of zippers and buttons to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy thread, zippers, and buttons for her tailoring business

loans.name: Edubejes

texts.en: Edubejes is 50 years old, from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three grown children. Edubejes's husband works in another country so they can have a good life. Edubejes on her part helps by raising hogs for 15 years now, earning her 6000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy additional piglets to raise and feed. The income that she generates from this business helps her meet basic household needs like food, electric and water bills. In the future, she hopes to become a more successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Nadire

texts.en:
Nadire is photographed here with her husband, Skender, and their only little grandchild. They are in their late 50s and parents to six children; all of their family resides in the northeastern part of the country. 

Nadire and Skender have been in the livestock business for five years now; they started this type of activity in an attempt to put some money aside for their pension. Here in Albania for villagers, unfortunately, pension is only $80/month; this amount of money is enough to cover only one medical prescription. Now you imagine how elders in the villages live. Some of them get help from their children, some do not and these elders' later years are the harshest.

Nadire is seeking your generosity to help her buy a milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a 39-year-old woman who has been engaged in raising hogs for ten years now. She lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. She is married, with four children. Her eldest is 17 and her youngest is 12 years old. 

Haydee is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy feed, a safety device for pigs, and hardwood for renovation, and to pay for school fees. With her loan, she hopes that she can maintain and expand her business and make it more profitable. Her income will be used for food and the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed, a safety device for pigs, and hardwood for renovation and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Hafezan

texts.en: Hafezan, age 44, is married and has four children. She is very talented and excels in making envelopes with her husband. She makes a large quantity of envelopes at home and her husband sells them in the local market. She earns a good amount of income to run her household activities. To help her continue operations of her business, Hafezanis is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy bundles of good quality paper with some packs of glue to increase her sales. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands. She wishes to use the earned profits to provide a good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her envelope-making business

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is a 44-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has two children. The oldest child is 15 while the youngest is 6. She engages in fishing. Aside from fishing, Cristita is in the buy and sell business of dried fish. She buys and sells fish in her neighborhood. She requested a loan of 23,000 PHP to buy more stocks of dried fish and pay for engine repair. In the future, Cristita would like to increase her business profitability to support her family and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and pay for engine repair

loans.name: Ghulam  Sakina

texts.en: Ghulam Sakina is a 32-year-old married woman who has run a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has four buffaloes, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Ghulam Sakina has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Yasmen

texts.en: Yasmen is a 31-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for Rs 30,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and grains from the wholesale market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock rice, sugar and grains.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BADEYA est constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et.3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3éme prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce et de la restauration à l’image de  DIALA qui est la 1ére assise femme  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 200Kg de riz et des condiments  avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue la vente de ses plats alimentaires au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Badeya group is composed of seven married women, averaging 35 years of age, with three children. They live in traditional extended families in the Heremakono Nord district in the village of Bougoni. They know each other as neighbors and friends as well as through their work. In order to bolster their financial capital and improve their businesses, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their third loan. Their two prior loans have been duly repaid. The group members work as vendors and cook food for sale, which is what Diala does, for example. Diala is the first one seated from right to left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 200 kg [441 lbs] of rice and condiments from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her cooked dishes at the marketplace and out of her home, retail, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele. She plans to  earn an average monthly revenue of 35,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and pay off her loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking food for sale.

loans.name: Tuhimizane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Maombi est une commerçante et membre du groupe  d’affaire «  Tuhimizane », âgée  de 35 ans mère de 5 enfants qui étudient. Elle est vendeuse de souliers.  Son conjoint, lui aussi est un commerçant de divers. Elle a sollicité un crédit  auprès de Hekima. Elle va  acheter 40 paires de souliers pour accroitre son business.  Elle avait commencé avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir elle souhaite construire une jolie maison et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: The client, Maombi, is a saleswoman and member of the business group "Tuhimizane," 35 years old and the mother of 5 children in school. She is a shoe saleswoman. Her spouse is also a salesman of various goods. She has asked for a loan from Hekima. She is going to buy 40 pairs of shoes in order to to increase her business. She started with her own funds, received from her husband. In the future, she would like to build a pretty house and educate her children. Thus, she thanks Hekima for its support to small business owners outside the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr:
Madame MARIATOU est née vers 1974 à Yanfolila. Mère de 6 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille polygame à HAMDALLAYE, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame   MARIATOU mène des activités de fabrication de savon traditionnels  il y a environ neuf ans. Le savon traditionnel utilisé par les femmes essentiellement pour la lessive. Le savon fabriqué est vendu à domicile et au marché où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour  la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso elle est à son  deuxième prêt individuel avec lequel elle est compte acheter deux barriques de potasse  et 50 kg de beurre de karité. Elle achète ses matières première sur place à Sikasso pour  la fabrication du savon.Sa clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes et d’hommes. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en: Ms. Mariatou was born in 1974 in Yanfolila. The mother of six children, she lives with her spouse and their children in a polygamous family in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods surrounding Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Ms. Mariatou has run a traditional soap-making business for about nine years. The traditional soap is used primarily by women for laundry. The soap she makes is sold from her home and at the market, where she is very sought after by her clientele for the quality of her products. To meet the increasingly growing needs of her clientele, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. She is on her second individual loan, which she expects to use to purchase two barrels of potassium and 50 kilograms of shea butter. She buys her primary materials to produce the soap there in Sikasso. Her clientele is primarily made up of men and women. Her previous loans were properly repaid. She imagines that with this loan she will make a monthly profit of 80,000 f CFA , which will be used to increase her business funds, contribute to her family's expenses and pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to purchase soap-making ingredients.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda, age 56, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them at higher prices out in the market, near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious occasion in Muslim countries). She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Rasheeda needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: В 1967 году в селе Куркат родилась девочка по имени Мутабар. Мутабар с детства любила природу и животных. Выхаживала комнатные растения, помогала родителям по животноводству. Она выросла доброй, послушной девушкой. Как и все сельские женщины Мутабар очень трудолюбивая. Она заботливая мать,понимающая жена. Муж Мутабара Суюнбой работает на поле и выращивает разные сельскохозяйственные культуры.  Но работа Суюнбоя сезонная. Вне сезона они занимаются животноводством. Это занятие им передалось в наследство от родителей. В селе откорм и купли продажа скота является прибыльным и выгодным делом. Для развития своего дела Мутабар обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Так как ей в данный момент не хватает денег. На полученный кредит Мутабар планирует купить скот и надеется что "Арванд"  поддержит Мутабара в реализации своего бизнеса.
texts.en: In 1967 in the village of Kurkat, a girl by the name of Mutabar was born. From early childhood Mutabar loved nature and animals. She would grow plants in her bedroom and helped her parents breed animals. She grew up  to be a kind, well-behaved girl. Like all village women Mutabar is very hard working. She is a caring mother and an understanding wife. Mutabar's husband Suyunboi works on the field and grows various crops. But Suyunboi's work is seasonal. Outside of harvest they rear animals. In doing this job they follow in the footsteps of their parents. In the village, the fattening, purchasing and selling of livestock is a profitable and attractive business. In order to develop her business Mutabar contacted MDO Arvand to ask for a loan, for at the moment she does not have enough money. With the proposed loan, Mutabar plans to buy livestock and hopes that MDO Arvand will support Mutabar in the implementation of her own business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Egleceria

texts.en:
Egleceria is a 47-year-old woman. She is married, with five children. Her eldest is 28 and the youngest is seven. Egleceria and her family are from Getafe, Bohol. 

For the past 17 years, Egleceria has been in the fishing business and a buy-and-sell business of dried fish. She is requesting a loan to buy more dried fish to resell. She is confident that her loan will have a good impact on her business. 

In the future, Egleceria hopes to be successful in sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en:
Musrat is a 36-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing for the past ten years. She offers various handmade carpets and has become famous in providing good-quality products in her circle. 

She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She is mother of five children and she is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She is also doing sewing as a part-time job. In this way, she is able to effectively handle her family needs and requirements. 

This is Musrat's second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and she is satisfied with the support of it. Currently, she has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales and, hence, provide better support to her family.

loans.use: to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 40-year-old, married woman and a mother of six children. She has been providing services of catering with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They have been running this business for many years and have become famous for providing quality services in their community. 

For the improvement of her business, Shehnaz contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 35,000. In this way, she would be able to purchase more varieties of crockery, such as dinner sets, bowls, and glasses, in various sizes and designs. 

It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of crockery, such as dinner sets, bowls, and glasses, in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a food vendor from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She sell meal food like fried fish, sauteed vegetables, and different dishes made of pork. This has been her business for 15 years now, allowing her to support her children who are now ages 16, 22, and 36. Out of her business, she also can support the needs of her household, like electricity and water. 

She is asking for a loan to buy vinegar, cooking oil, fish, soy sauce, and pork. She would like to continue improving her business so that she can live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
For three years now, 28-year-old Emily has been engaged in a manicure and pedicure service to earn an income. 

She is a married woman with two children, ages 2 and 10. Her business helps to augment the income of their household. Emily is grateful for her skill so that she can help her husband, who is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan to buy different colors of nail polish, clippers, and a nail cutter. 

She hopes that someday she can get a larger loan so she can continue to expand her business and her children can go to school.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, clippers, and a nail cutter

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is a 37-year-old married woman. Her husband is a laborer. She has four children and a total of six members in her home, and her husband is the only earner of the family. 

It was very tough for Shama to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose, she started her business selling bed sheets. She buys varieties of bed sheets from the wholesales market and then sells them in her area. She is playing a very important role for her family now. 

To purchase more variety of bed sheets, covers and spreads she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. It will allow her to increase her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of bed sheets, covers and spreads.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 22-year-old single lady who has a small library where she sells books and stationary. She is a hard worker with five years of experience in her domain. Souad is the sole breadwinner for four members of her family, in addition to covering her own personal expenses.

She is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her books capital with newly released editions, and special released stationary for the current scholastic year 2013-2014.
 
She believes that through this loan she will increase her business income and develop her family’s living.

loans.use: to increase her books capital with newly released editions and special released stationary for the current scholastic year.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 30 years old and from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 5. 

She has been in the business of raising hogs for six years. This is to help augment the income of her husband, who works as a fisherman. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy feed and a piglet. She is determined to improve her business profits by looking after her hogs well. 

In the future, she hopes to have other business opportunities and a bigger piggery for a better profit. Her income will be for her children's healthy diet and education.

loans.use: to  buy feed and a piglet

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 39-year-old lady living in the Sinkor area; she is married, and her husband is a teacher. They have three children between the ages of 7 and 13; all of them live at home. 

For the past three years, she has been selling used clothing in the local market. Sometimes she make less money, but most of the time she has good daily sales. 

Comfort is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.

She plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Madame KOROTOUMOU est née vers 1969 à NINGASSO. Mère de 2 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à HAMDALLAYE, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame   KOROTOUMOU fait le commerce il y a environ vingt ans. Elle change les activités suivant les saisons, vu la disponibilité des produits de l’heure. C’est ainsi qu’elle mène actuellement des activités d’achat et de vente des tubercules (pomme de terre, ignames et patates), et des petits articles divers au marché où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son  treizième prêt individuel avec lequel elle compte acheter 70 sacs de tubercules. Elle achète ses marchandises sur place à Sikasso avant de les revendre en détail au comptant à une clientèle composée des femmes et d’hommes. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en: Ms. Korotoumou was born around 1969 in Ningasso. The mother of two children, she lives with her spouse and their children in a nuclear family in Hamdallaye, one of the districts surrounding the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). In this way, she currently runs a business buying and selling tubers (potatoes, yams and spuds) and various small goods at the market, where she is very sought after by her clientele for the quality of her products. To satisfy the increasingly growing needs of her clientele, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. She is on her thirteenth individual loan, which she expects to use to buy 70 bags of tubers. She buys her merchandise there in Sikasso before reselling it at retail for cash to a clientele made up of men and women. The previous loans were all properly repaid. She imagines that with this loan she will make a monthly profit of 100,000 f CFA which will be used to increase her business funds, contribute to her family's expenses, and to pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to purchase tubers.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in the Kitale area, a fresh land, especially for maize farming. She is married, and has four children, three of whom are in school. She has practiced mixed farming for three years. Her main sources of income are maize, beans, milk, potatoes, and vegetables. Besides farming, she also has a retail shop.

Lilian wants to improve her milk production, and thus has requested a loan of KES. 62,400 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. This cow will provide milk for her family, and she will also sell more milk in the market, thus boosting her income. She will be able to educate her children with no strain, and also improve their living standards.

The major challenges she faces are pests and diseases.

In the future, Lilian is looking forward to being a dairy farmer as she is involved in other farming activities.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for the support they have given to her.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en:
Rifat is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of sewing gloves for sportsmen for the past four years. She makes gloves in different sizes, and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality gloves. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members. 

Rifat is a motivated mother of three, and is liable to provide them with good quality food, education, and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of Rs. 25,000. The loan will be used to purchase thread and leather covers in large quantities to cater to more customers without delay. 

She hopes to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. 

She dreams of expanding her business, and desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase thread and leather covers in large quantities.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 37-year-old married woman, and a mother of four. She is involved in a business of selling bangles. She always has a great variety to offer, and she is quite familiar with the tastes and demands of her customers. Her husband also assists her in his free time, so that she can perform household activities as well. She has gradually improved her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy more varieties of bangles in different colors and designs. In this way, she can increase her net income through increased sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She dreams of expanding her business and providing a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina of Talibon, Bohol has had a rice farming business for eight years now. She is 37 years old with seven children, ages 8-19 years old. She works hard in her farm so she can provide for her family's basic needs, like food. 

She would like for her farming business to be successful. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. These are important so her crops will be resistant to rice diseases.
 
Her goal is to send her children to school.
She also hopes that, in the future, she can continue to sustain her business and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Guliver

texts.en:
Guliver is a 55-year-old man. He lives in a small village of Martvili district with his mother. His wife and son live abroad and send money. Guliver is unemployed now. He wants to begin to trade with used tires. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $1,600. He will rent a commercial space and will purchase a stock of used tires to sell. He will be involved in his own business and thus generate income.

loans.use: to rent a commercial space and purchase a stock of used tires to start a trade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 45 years old from the municipality of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages 14, 16 and 20. 

For 18 years, Cirila has operated a Sari-sari (convenience) store where she sells snacks, candies, bread, detergent, canned goods and soft drinks. She also engages in catching crabs for additional profits. 

Cirila is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy rice, soft drinks, chips, detergent, shampoo and canned goods. She hopes that someday she can continue to improve and expand her business for increased profits and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, chips, detergent, shampoo and canned goods

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. So Zubeda started her business, sewing clothes, to contribute to the family income. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list. 

Currently Zubeda has requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packages of buttons and needles. It will allow her to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Rosalia Maribel

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó vendiendo productos de catálogo y joyas, luego una amiga le propuso vender Yanbal y aceptó ese nuevo reto.  Trabaja todos los días, sobretodo en la mañana porque su hija estudia y allí aprovecha para salir.  Al momento está separada de su esposo y tiene 2 hijos de 10 años y 9 meses, el hijo mayor estudia en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  Desea en un futuro, poder tener su casa propia y su carrro también.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de perfumes, artículos del hogar y ropa.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Portoviejo.  She began selling catalog products and jewelry.  A friend had suggested that she sell Yanbal products, so she accepted this new challenge.  The borrower works every day in the mornings because her daughter is at school, so she takes advantage of this time to travel about.  At the moment, she is separated from her husband and has two children (ages 10 and 9 months).  Her oldest child attends a state school in the area.  In the future, she would like to have a house of her own as well as a car.  

For now the borrower needs a loan so that she can buy perfumes, household products, and clothing.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, household products, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Khasan

texts.ru: Хасан добродушный и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 53 лет. Он женат и имеет одного единственного сына. Его сын также  женат, имеет свою семью, и все вместе они живут в одном большом доме. Сам Хасан работает таксистом. Район, где они живут небольшой, и все жители знают Хасана как хорошего таксиста, он всегда ведёт себя порядочно по отношению к клиентам. Сын Хасана тоже работает на местном рынке, он продаёт разные бытовые вещи. Дом, в котором живут семья Хасана, находится в неблагоприятном состоянии, и давно нуждается в ремонте. У Хасана не получается накопить необходимую сумму денег для ремонта дома, потому что весь доход расходуется на нужды семьи, на пропитание. Поэтому Хасан обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Khasan is a good-natured, positive person. He is 53 years old, married, and has one son. His son is also married and has his own family; they all live in one big house. Khasan is a taxi driver. The community where they live is small, and Khasan has built a reputation as a good taxi driver among the residents by always treating his customers with integrity. Khasan's son works at the local market, selling various household items. 

The house where Khasan's family lives is in poor condition, and is long overdue for repairs. Khasan is having a hard time saving up the necessary amount for repairs because he uses his income to provide for his family. Khasan has turned to MDO Arvand for a loan in order to buy building materials to repair his home. He really hopes for a positive result and is grateful to MDO Arvand in advance for the assistance.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Ruqayya

texts.en:
Ruqayya is a 58 year old married woman. She has been providing services for flour grinding in her community. She started this business with her husband in her home to contribute to the family income. She knows the techniques of grinding very well and has years of experience in this field.  She has become famous for providing fine quality flour and earns enough to support the needs of her family members. 

In order to purchase a new grinding machine, Ruqayya contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. These funds will help her to cater to more customers which ultimately will help in generating more cash. Ruqayya wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda was born in 1967. She is married and a mother of five. Her two daughters work in a governmental entity. Majeda has been selling clothes for one year. She started her project selling a small quantity of them at home to her neighbors and friends. Then she started receiving more customers. Majeda is planning to market her products more with the aim of raising her sales. 

Now Majeda needs a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes to sell in order to raise her profit and income to cover her children's needs and to improve their living conditions. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson lives in the Kitale area in the South-Rift area of Kenya. He is married and has eight children, five of whom are still in school. He has practiced mixed farming for 20 years. His main sources of income are: coffee, bananas, maize, and milk.

He wants to venture more into dairy farming, and thus has requested from Juhudi Kilimo a loan of KES 62,400 to purchase a dairy cow. He says that an increase in dairy cows will lead to an increase in income, thus enable him to educate his children better and improve his family's living standards.

The challenge he faces in these is how to deal with the livestock pests and diseases.

Benson says that in the near future, he would want to venture more into dairy farming. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their good work.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Se ha dedicado a la venta de madera desde hace tiempo atrás y le ha resultado muy productiva.  Realiza su trabajo solo, desde temprano en la mañana.  Está en estado de unión libre y su cónyuge le ayuda en sus labores diarias de su negocio.  Tiene un hijo y desea a futuro poder tener un depósito de madera para darle un mejor estudio a él.
texts.en: This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  He has been selling wood for some time and has achieved very productive results.  The borrower goes about his work alone, beginning in the early morning hours.  He is in a common-law relationship and his wife helps with the daily tasks related to the business.  They have a son, so the borrower wants to open a lumber yard in the future so that he can provide him the best education.

loans.use: to buy wood to sell.

loans.name: Olga Lorena

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Ella empezó desde muy temprano como laboratorista debido a que su tía, quien era doctora, le aconsejó que estudiara medicina.  Posteriormente, vio la necesidad de trabajar y poner su negocio propio, por lo que emprendió en ello y más adelante se dio.  Trabaja a partir de las 4 pm en adelante, en una clínica particular.  Es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales solo uno es menor de edad y está estudiando en colegio fiscal.  Desea a futuro tener su propio local para instalar su laboratorio y comprar ese espacio en el centro de la ciudad.  Por ahora, necesita el crédito para la oompra de una máquina para exámenes médicos.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  She started out at a young age as a laboratory technician because her aunt, who was a doctor, advised her to study medicine.  Later on she needed to work, so she started her own business.  She has continued forward since then.  

The borrower begins her work at a private clinic at 4:00 P.M. and continues from there.  She is single and has two children, one of whom is still a dependent and attends a state high school.  In the future, she would like to have her own location where she can set up her laboratory.  She plans to buy this space in the central part of the city.  

For now, the borrower needs a loan so that she can buy a machine for medical tests.

loans.use: to buy a laboratory machine for performing medical tests.

loans.name: Jamshedjon

texts.ru: Молодого фермера, проживающего в районе Гиссар зовут Чамшедчон. Ему 21 год. Он обзаведен семьей и имеет двух детей в возрасте 3 и 1 годика. Чамшедчон занимается растениеводством и животноводством. У него имеется небольшой земельный участок, на котором он в основном выращивает пшеницу. Чамшедчон сейчас как и многие жители района готовится к осеннему посеву. Он просит кредит для того, чтобы купить семена пшеницы, топливо и оплатить за услуги тракториста по вспашке земли. Он занимается земледельческой деятельностью уже три года. В не сезон работы он занимается купле-продажей скота.
texts.en: Jamshedjon is a young farmer living in Gissar.  He is 21 years old.  He has a family and has two children, who are 3 and 1 year old.  Jamshedjon is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry.  He has a small plot of land on which he primarily grows wheat.  Jamshedjon is now, like many of the people who live in his region, preparing for the fall planting.  He is asking for a loan in order to purchase wheat seeds and fuel, and to pay a tractor operator to plow the land.  He has been engaged in agriculture for three years.  In the off-season he engages in the purchase and selling of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fuel and to pay for a tractor operator.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is 22 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Irbed with his three siblings and parents. His father is a retired man and currently works as a store keeper. 

Ashraf is studying for a Bachelor of Accounting, 4th year. He is planning to work in his study field after graduation to start helping his parents financially. But his parents are currently facing financial crisis, which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to help his parents pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 44-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past ten years, has been running a business selling clothes. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. 

She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

Rani expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es: Don José de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 8 y 7 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, él se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de perejil y espinaca desde hace 20 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir bien sus cultivos, comercializa en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don José esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, controles de plagas, abonos, etc. para poder obtener mejores cosechas y mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Jose is 42 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and his four children, aged 14, 12, 8, and 7. The children currently go to school. He has been farming for 20 years, growing parsley and spinach. This has given him the necessary experience to tend to his crops and sell them in markets that are close to his home. With what he earns from sales, he can settle some household expenses. Jose is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, pest control, manure, etc. This will mean he can have improved harvests and better earnings, and can give his family everything they need.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pest control, manure, etc.

loans.name: Abdulqayum

texts.ru: Абдулкаюм пожилой человек в возрасте 61 года. Он живет с женой, двумя сыновьями и невесткой в городе Вахдат. Раньше он работал в государственном учреждении города Вахдат, но зарплаты ему не хватала, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Он уволился с той работы и теперь уже год как занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он развозит пассажиров по маршрутной линии город Вахдат-город Душанбе. Абдулкаюм сейчас хочет приобрести новую машину и просит кредит на сумму 2500 долларов. Эта работа дает ему массу удовольствия от общения с клиентами и является прибыльным занятием. Абдулкаюм очень старательный человек. Все что он делает, все ради своей семьи. У такого человека в жизни должно и все получаться.
texts.en:
Abdulqayum is an elderly man of 61 years. He lives with his wife, two sons, and daughter-in-law in Vahdat. He previously worked in a city government institution, but did not earn enough income to support his family. He left his job and has been working as a taxi driver for the past year. 

Abdulqayum drives passengers along the Vahdat-Dushanbe route. He is applying for a loan of $2500 in order to buy a new car. This job is very enjoyable for Abdulqayum because of the frequent interaction with customers, and is also a profitable activity. Abdulqayum is very hard-working, and everything he does is for the benefit of his family. Thanks to this attitude, there is no doubt that anything he undertakes will work out.

loans.use: to buy a new taxi cab

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: Jose con 58 años de edad,  padre de una hijos mayores de edad uno depende de él económicamente quien está en edad escolar secundaria, su esposa ademas de dedicarse a las tareas del hogar trabaja para una institucion del estado, el se dedica a la albañileria, ellos están construyendo su casa desde hace muchos años por diferentes dificultades no la han tenimado aun. Solicita este crédito para comprar láminas de zinc, arenilla y pago de mano de obra de esta manera podrá culminar la construcción de un cuarto, para asi habitarla con su, Pintura, Perlines. Con esta obra se benefician tanto él como su familia.
texts.en: Jose is 58 years old. He is the father of older children. The one who depends on him financially is in high school. His wife, aside from doing housework, works for a state institution. Jose works in masonry. They have been building their house for many years, and because of different problems, they have not finished it yet. He asks for this loan to buy zinc sheets and grit, and to pay for labor. This way, he will be able to finish the construction of one room, painting it and equipping it with beams. This project will benefit him, as well as his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa may be 70 years old, but she is still a hard working woman in spite of her age. All her nine children are grown and she is determined not to become dependent on them for her needs. 

Since 2002, she has been engaged in fishing and selling fresh fish in her community of Talibon for an income. She also engages in farming. This gives her an average monthly income of 9,000 PHP. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net, nylon and fertilizer.

In the future, she hopes to live in comfort, and still be able to support herself.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, nylon and fertilizer.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in seaweed farming, which she has been doing for 15 years. 

Clarita is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic straw, and wooden stakes needed for her to be productive.  She knows that with the necessary raw materials, she can improve her earnings. Clarita hopes to send her children to school with her profits. She wants the best for her children and their education is one her priorities.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, plastic straw, and wooden stakes

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is 20 years old and lives in Gaza. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education, so Jihad operates a motorcycle transport business. He transports things for people from one place to another, and uses the motorcycle to sell things when he has good earnings that month. 

He earns usually a monthly income of $581, which he uses to support himself and his Family.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to repair his motorcycle and buy food stuff to sell as a street vendor; this will increase the number of clients and his income, which will help him improve the financial conditions of his family.
  
Jihad is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and buy food stuff to sell as a street vendor.

loans.name: Talal

texts.en: Talal is 22 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with his six siblings and his parents. One of his brothers works in sewing. Talal is studying Bachelor of Finance and is in his fourth year. He is planning to work in his field after graduation to start helping his parents financially. His parents are currently facing a financial crisis which does not allow them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester of school.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un campesino de 33 años de edad, padre de 2 hijos de 6 y 7 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Viene de una familia humilde y trabajadora del campo, que le inculcaron desde pequeño el amor y el cuidado por la tierra, gracias a ello, hoy en día es agricultor, en su finca tiene 450 palos de aguacate, 200 en producción y 250 árboles recién sembrados, la cosecha que recolecta la vende en la plaza de mercado y así genera los ingresos necesarios para llevr el sustento a su hogar. Es aguerrido y trabajador, se proyecta hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, esto lo motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas (fungicidas, larvicidas, abonos e insecticidas), que son necesarios para mejorar los cultivos y poder recolectar una cosecha más productiva, que le genere mejores ingresos por ventas. Así, Juan podrá continuar avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es llegar a tener un cultivo de 1000 árboles de aguacate, pues desea aprovechar al máximo el terreno que tiene disponible, logrando generar una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de prepararse y ser unas personas íntegras, además podrá brindar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a 33-year-old farmer. He is a father of two children who are ages six and seven and lives in a common law marriage with his partner. He comes from a humble and hardworking peasant family, who instilled in him, ever since he was a child, how to love and care for the land. Thanks to that he is now a farmer. On his farm he has 450 avocado trees, 200 are producing fruit and 250 were just planted. He sells the harvest he gathers at the market square and that way he generates the income necessary to support his household. 

He is an experienced hard worker. He strives to achieve his goals, which is why he decided to request help through a loan to buy the farming supplies (fungicides, larvicides, fertilizer, and insecticides) that he needs in order to improve his crops and obtain a more productive harvest that will generate higher sales revenue. This will allow Juan to continue advancing toward his main dream, which is to one day have 1,000 avocado trees. He wants to make the most of the land he has available and generate enough financial stability to give his children the opportunity of having an education and becoming upright people. He will also be able to offer them improved wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (fungicides, larvicides, fertilizer, and insecticides).

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is a 57-year-old widow with two children, 20 and 23, who go to school. She sells shoes and has been in the business for the past five years. She is requesting the loan to buy more used shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Victoriya

texts.en: Victoriya is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of five children. After her husband's business failure, she decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. 12 years ago she began stitching clothes in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds she is unable to meet the demands of her customers. She contacted Kashf Foundation and has borrowed 20,000 PKR to purchase spools of thread along with packs of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to generate a healthier source of income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread along with packs of buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимчон бизнесмен, обратившийся за повторным кредитом. Свой предыдущий кредит он брал для увеличения ассортимента женских платьев. На сегодня его бизнес успешно продвигается. Он уже продает не только женские платья, блузки, свитеры, но и мужскую одежду. В данный момент он просит кредит для развития бизнеса. Он хочет приобрести коллекцию осенней женской и мужской одежды для продажи. В ведении бизнеса ему усердно помогает его супруга.
texts.en:
Olimjon is a businessman who requests his second loan. He took his first loan to increase his assortment of women's dresses. Today his business is advancing successfully. He already sells not only women's dresses, blouses and sweaters, but also men's clothing. 

Currently Olimjon requests a loan to develop his business. He would like to purchase a collection of fall clothing for women and men to sell. His wife diligently helps him manage the business.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of fall clothing for women and men, to resell

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилчон житель Гиссарского района. Ему 39 лет. Он занимается торговым бизнесом и зарабатывает на жизнь таким образом. Комилчон женат. У него двое сыновей и одна дочь. Дети учатся в школе, а жена домохозяйка. Комилчон на рынке района имеет торговую точку. Он занимается там продажей сухофруктов и печенье. Комилчон начал свой бизнес два года тому назад и до сих пор успешно продвигает его. В данный момент он просит кредит для развития бизнеса. На запрашиваемую сумму он хочет купить ассортимент сухофруктов и печенье, чтобы увеличить спрос на них.
texts.en:
Komiljon is 39 years old, is married, and has two sons and one daughter. They live in the Gissar district. The children go to school and his wife is a homemaker. 

Komiljon earns his living by selling dried fruit and cookies at the market, where he has his own stand. He started his business two years ago and has been successful in growing it. He is currently asking for a loan to continue to develop his business. The requested amount will be used to buy an assortment of dried fruits and cookies in order to increase demand for his products.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits and cookies to grow his business

loans.name: Hanane Group

texts.en:
Hanan is the featured borrower of Hanane’s group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to improve their living standard and to solve their financial problems.

Hanan is a 35-year-old married mother of two children. She works in making handmade souvenirs for special occasions to help her husband in making their living and covering their family’s increasing needs. She has also been working for two years as a sales representative in a company where she sells plastic Tupperware to her neighbors, relatives and friends.

Hanan is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to make necessary maintenance to her house in order to keep it a healthy living place for her children before the coming autumn and winter seasons. Hanan is the lady sitting at the far right side of the picture. Hanaa is the first from the left with the green top and Abir is the lady in black.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to her house in order to keep it a healthy living place.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted fragrances, clothing for children and adults, and shoes.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and the father of two children, for whom he works hard to provide.

Haydar is a mechanic and owns a garage where he specializes in changing engine oils and fixing damaged body parts. He has been in this business since 1998 and has gained much experience through practice. Now Haydar has two hired employees and thanks to his great services, he has gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood.

Haydar is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD. The aim of this loan is to renovate his garage. Haydar believes that this loan will give him a chance to grow his business and attract more clients.

loans.use: to renovate his garage.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia is a native of Getafe, Bohol. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Her eldest is 19 and the youngest is 12. Her husband has a fishing business. Cresencia sells household basic needs through her small sari-sari store. In her store she sells cooking oil, salt, pepper, soy sauce, tomato, garlic, onion, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables and seasoning that she can resell. The additional stock would assure Cresencia that she has enough to sell to her customers. This will result in a better income for her family. She will be able to provide nutritious food for her family. In the future, she plans another business expansion.

loans.use: to buy detergent, soft drinks, rice, spices and seasoning

loans.name: Rasmeya

texts.en: Rasmia was born in 1966, is married and the mother of six children. Her husband works in agriculture, while she has been raising and selling goats for the last three years. She started her project with a small herd of goats, but expanded it slowly. Now she wants to buy more goats in order to raise her productivity, profits and income to help her husband meet their children's needs. She doesn’t currently have enough money to do this and that is why she is applying for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Nayeer

texts.en:
Nayeer is a 24-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. She began her stitching work in her house seven years ago. She stitches for the people living around her house, and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her third loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 15,000 to buy raw materials, including cloths, threads of different colors, laces, zippers, etc. to create means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income to provide a better lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including cloths, threads of different colors, laces, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en:
Razmik is from Gyumri town where he lives with his wife and three children. He earns his living by selling jars and nonferrous metals to local and neighboring markets. He works hard to earn a good income and support his family. 
Razmik purchases supplies from different small shops and resells them to his clients. Razmik has been involved in this business for six years. Over these years of hard work, he was able to establish contacts with many local shops, which prefer to purchase jars only from Razmik.
Razmik's son is involved in Greco-Roman wrestling and currently is attending the Junior World Championships. As this sport needs financial investments, Razmik works hard to help support his son. 
So, Razmik asked for a loan to purchase jars to sell to his customers.
He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan is greatly important for Razmik and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for jars he sells to customers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 33 years old and a resident of Nkokonjer, a rural area in Kyengera, She has three children and also two dependents. 
Ruth's sister passed away three years ago and Ruth is obligated to take care of her sister’s children. She pays their tuition from the little income she earns from her boutique clothing business.
Ruth started her business three years ago as source of income after she had gotten tired of being a mere employee.
She started this business as a way of supporting herself and her family since she is the breadwinner for the entire family despite the fact that she is a widow.
Ruth’s business is strategically located but her major challenge is inadequate capital which prevents her from buying in bulk. That hinders its growth and expansion as well as her profits since she has to go shopping all the time. She is therefore requesting to be funded to bridge the gap.The loan of 2,500,000 UGX will help her buy stocks of garments in bulk and at a reduced rate.
Her neighbors commended her for being a hard-working, determined and supportive person in society.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилчону 29 лет. Он живет и работает в городе Гиссар. Комилчон таксист с 10-летним стажем работы. Работа таксиста для Комилчона не только приятное занятие, но и средство дохода. Комилчон женат и живет со своей женой в родительском доме. Он еще не заработал на свой собственный дом, но такие планы уже строит. Комилчон просит в кредит небольшую сумму, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину и снова вернуться в работу. Он хочет доказать, что он успешный сын и муж. Он обязан обеспечивать семью хорошей едой, здравоохранением и в будущем быть примерным отцом для своих детей.
texts.en:
Komiljon is 29 years old. He lives and works as a taxi driver in Gissar, and has 10 years of experience. This line of work is both an enjoyable activity and a source of income. Komiljon is married and lives with his wife in his parents' home. He has not yet saved enough money to buy his own house, but is planning to do so. 

Komiljon is requesting a loan in order to repair his car and return to work. He wants to prove himself as a successful son and husband. He must support his family by providing good quality food and health care and serve as a role model for his children.

loans.use: to repair his taxi cab.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 57 years old, married and the father of 17 children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Four years ago he decided to open a retail shop in order to meet his family's daily needs since his farming work is seasonal. Price fluctuations and unpredictable weather are his major challenges, while his dream is to educate his children up to the university level and open a wholesale shop. Samuel intends to use this loan to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Wesal

texts.en: Wesal was born in 1972. She is married and a mother of three. Her husband works at a private company. Wesal has been selling blankets for a year. She started her project at home selling a small quantity of them to her neighbors and friends. She then started receiving more customers. Now she is planning to add clothes to her project. This might raise her profit and let her earn better income which will help her cover her children's needs and help her husband in improving their living conditions. She needs a loan to buy clothes. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to trade.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Зухро трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 45 лет. Она живет с мужем и младшим сыном. Старший сын находится в миграции в России. Зухро несколько лет назад начала свой бизнес с мужем, теперь в бизнесе участвует и ее младший сын. Она торговала раньше тканью, теперь в течении 5 лет она открыла еще одну точку продажи в одном из больших рынков Худжанда, где продает там скатерть и подушки.
 Настоящий кредит хочет получить для увеличения ассортимента товаров. Она планирует закупить скатерти и постельных принадлежностей.  Сейчас ее контейнер имеет товар,но недостаточно для привлечение новых потенциальных клиентов. Для этого она обратилась в Арванд, и очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Zuhro is a hardworking woman at the age of 45. She lives with her husband and youngest son. The eldest son has migrated to Russia. 

Zuhro started a business together with her husband some years ago, and currently her youngest son also takes part in the business. She used to sell fabric. Now, for of five years, she has also had another point of sales at one of the largest markets in Khujand, where she sells tablecloths and pillows. 

Zuhro takes the current loan to increase the assortment of goods. She plans to purchase tablecloths and bed linen. Currently her stall has goods, but not enough to attract potential new customers. For this she turned to Arvand, and hopes very much for your support.

loans.use: to purchase tablecloths and bed linen for increasing her assortment

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
